She also realized a tightness in her pants as her legs began to grow as well, and two black talons tore through the tips of each of her shoes as her feet stretched into long, puffy claws.

"WHAT...THE...FUCK..."

But her stomach let out an even bigger rumble that sped up her change, her stomach puffing out even further and the seams of her pants tearing apart to show the scales covering her legs. With as much speed as her growing body could move with she hauled her bulk through. Along with her expansion and transformation she started growing taller as well, each stomp progressively getting louder and louder as she waddled towards the foyer.

Soon the scales reached her chest and started covering her neck, at which point two long, thick appendages sprouted from her back and through her shirt to form long, leathery wings. As the scales reached her chin her lips and nose stretched into a long, reptilian snout. Her black hair grew even longer and fuller, two petite black horns sprouting from the top of her head.

By the time she reached the mirror in the foyer her hands were the only thing visibly human about her, which shortly turned into stubby black claws. She stared at herself with shiny orange eyes, the pupils turned to predatory slits. All that she was clad in was a few tattered remains of her clothes as she stood well nine feet tall, looking to weigh several dozen tons. Her stomach had bloated into a titanic, soft globe that covered a decent amount of the hardwood floor in front of her and pressed into her blobby legs, smoothly shaped by red scales and a long column of black armor that traveled along her enormous breasts to the bottom of her chin. Over the sides of her gut she could see the edges of her massive thighs, her rump large enough that it could fill (and obliterate) an entire sofa. She even sported a tail that gently tapered off of her enormous girth, with a line of black spikes running from the tip along her spine.

She felt a hot fire bubble within the depths of her monstrous gut, slowly stroking her midsection with her hand as she slowly absorbed that the monstrous figure in the mirror was, in fact, her.
112231122222222221.title: Go with this Storyline

choices: Try to Get Used to It. Let Sleeping Dragons Lie
1122311222222222212.content:
Carol took a closer look at the dragoness in the mirror, that obese and huge dragon lady that was actually her. She lifted up her black scaly underbelly and turned around to get a good look of her thick blubbery red-scaled backside and even flapped her new wings. Carol turned again and opened her mouth to see her newly sharpened teeth and a long green forked tongue. She even breathes out a slight flame before covering her mouth. What was surprising was that the 9ft tall dragon lady was not so much scared or freaked out at her new form but she seemed to be looking in awe.

"That must've been some tea," said the dragon woman. "I can't believe it. It turned me into a dragon. Surprisingly a European dragon. But then again I do have British ancestry." Carol let out a laugh as she smacked her monstrous booty and let out a playful hiss as she showed her claws. "Though honestly, I have no idea how the blasted tea could make me so ginormously fat. But what does that matter when you're a dragon? This might be fun. Boy is Marvin going to be surprised when he gets home.

The dragon woman then snapped her fingers. "I've got it. I'll surprise him with dinner tonight. He thinks I'm too sick to cook. We've got those steaks in the fridge and I won't even need an oven to cook them. However, that's when Carol heard a ripping noise because what was left of her clothes had torn apart. "Oh my gosh," said Carol. "Can't let Alex and Jen see me like this. If I didn't know better, I'd say that I just got bigger." Carol then spotted the curtains and got an idea.

Marvin at the time had absolutely no idea about his wife being mutated into an enormous dragon and was driving their young son and daughter home from school. "I hope Mom's doing a lot better," said Alex. "That flu has her miserable." "I wish she would get better soon," said Jen. "Daddy, how long does the flu last." Marvin let out a sigh. "I don't know, Jen. But I got some tea that should help get her over that flu faster." Marvin parked the car outside the garage and opened the door as he and his kids walked in to hear Carol humming.

"Sounds like she's doing better already," said Alex. "She only hums that song when she's in a good... mood?" Carol walked out in dragon form and it was shown that she was even larger than before and appeared to be 12ft tall. "Hi, Alex," said Carol. "Hi, Jen. How was school?" Alex and Jen didn't answer. They were too busy dropping their jaws as they processed the fact that there mother was now a huge red dragon. Carol turned to face Marvin who was just as surprised at the monster that was his wife.

Carol lowered her blobbish neck and kissed Marvin on the cheek. "Marvin, I must thank you," she said. "That Red Dragon Tea did wonders." Marvin was dumbfounded. He had no idea that the medicinal tea would turn his wife into a dragon. The only question is, what does he decide to do about this situation?
1122311222222222212.title: I Love Being a Dragon

11223112222222222121.content:
Marvin saw that Carol had appeared to have gotten bigger and if he didn't know better, he'd say that his wife was now 18ft tall and 20ft wide, wearing the curtains on her massive dragon rear like a thong. He wanted to say something but what could he say? He simply gave a nervous smile. Although he was going to give the company that made the Red Dragon Medicinal Tea a rather angry letter about this.

"Well, come on, Marvin," said the dragon giantess. "Dinner will be ready shortly." "Uh, I'm coming, Dear." Said Marvin. Many thoughts were going through Marvin's head. "I can expect an earful from the in-laws about this, but what can I do? Calm down, Marvin. She's still your wife. So what if she happens to be a 10 ton dragon. For better or worse." Marvin smiled nervously and Alex and Jen just stared at their giant dragon mother. "I am definitely not going to cross her anytime soon." Thought a very afraid Alex to himself. "I wonder if I'll turn into a dragon when I'm Mom's age." Thought Jen to herself.

Carol reached into the fridge and Marvin couldn't help but stare at his dragon wife's enormous butt as she was rooting around and looking for the steaks. “If she turns over in her sleep,” thought Marvin. “I’m a dead man. Than again, I did marry her for that booty.” “Aha.” Said Carol. Carol then took out the steaks and smirked before she opened her mouth wide. Marvin gave a gasp. “Carol,” he said. “Do you think it’s such a good idea to...” Carol let out a scoff. “Marvin,” she said to her husband. “What’s the point of being a dragon if you can’t breathe fire.” Carol held her mouth out wide and spewed a stream of flames to cook the steaks, nearly burning them to a crisp in the process. Carol then coughed out smoke as she put the steaks down and then inhaled. “That is going to take some serious getting used to.”

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
 Meanwhile, unbeknownst to Carol, Marvin and their children, there was a movie producer in the area and from the looks of it, he was on the phone. “No, no, no,” he said. “The CGI is all wrong, it makes the dragon look out of place. For this latest project I need the dragon to look as realistic as possible. I don’t know. I mean, the dragon has to look like a dragon. Come on, male dragons are a dime a dozen. My latest project calls for a female dragon. I don’t know, I can’t build a machine. They’re too unreliable. I know we have a deadline. I’ll think of something.” The movie producer let out a groan as he hung up. “Quigley,” he said to himself. “This is your last chance. You don’t want to go back to working for the company that makes that insult to comic book heroes cartoon. I’ve got to do something.”

That was when the producer came across an old woman talking to the police. “I’m not lying. I saw my neighbor, Carol Hale, from my window and she turned into a dragon!” “Lady,” said one of the police. “The doctor assigned you meds for a reason.” “I did not hallucinate! She got big and red and fat and....” “You seriously think that it’s entirely possible for a human woman to spontaneously transform into a giant obese firebreathing reptile? We better take you to a doctor.” However, Quigley overheard what that woman was saying and he was now suddenly very interested to see if this dragon rumor was indeed true.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Meanwhile, the Hales were at home having dinner. Of course, being a dragon, Carol wasn’t even bothering with her silverware and was messily devouring her steaks and chewing on them with her huge fangs. “I’m sorry,” said Carol. “Kids. Don’t be like me. Eat like human beings.” Alex just inched his chair away from his mother out of pure fear.” “Mom,” said Jen. “My corn on the cob is a little cold.” Carol just spewed fire out to fully cook Jen’s corn. “Thanks, Mom.” Marvin just kept watching the dragon giantess that was his wife eating her dinner. At this point, Carol had gotten so big that she crushed the four chairs she was sitting in underneath her huge dragon booty. “Carol,” said Marvin to his transmogrified wife. “Is there any way to turn you back to normal.” Carol shrugged her shoulders. “I don’t know but quite frankly, even if there was, I wouldn’t take it. I like being a dragon way too much.” Alex and Jen gasped. “You mean you’re just going to be a dragon for the rest of your life?” asked Alex.

Carol gave a snort and then nodded her head before she pulled a T-bone out of her mouth and patted her large stomach as she belched out some smoke. One of her love handles even pushed up against Marvin. "Carol," said Marvin. "Are you sure that you thought that plan all the way through? I mean, you're more than three times my size and more than 50 times my weight." Carol gave a smirk. "I thought you liked big girls, Marvin." Jen and Alex laughed as their father blushed and then there was a knock on the door.

Carol got up to answer but Marvin gasped. "Carol," said Marvin. "I don't think you should be doing this. After all, what will people think to see a big and huge dragon at the door." Carol bent over to her husband's level. "Come on, Marvin. I mean, who is the boss of this relationship?" "I'm just saying, maybe we don't want to alarm people." Marvin and Carol just stare at each other before...
11223112222222222121.title: Dragon Her Feet

choices: Skip to Carol being lead onto the set to be fitted for the role!
Skip to Carol being a celebrity, and being much bigger!
112231122222222221211.content:
With the door knocked, Quigley straightened out his collar, forcing out his charmer smile. "Hello, there, you may know me as..."

But his recital was ended by several loud, thundering footsteps creaking the wood within the house, lugging his way. By no extent of the mind, he was a gullible person; at most, he'd expected some sort of enlightening location scope, but by the monster-sized sounds coming his way, he could tell that the water was quickly rising over his head. "...the hell is..."

...and then the door opened.

Quigley's years of business training couldn't prepare him at the red, mountain-sized creature inside who eased the door open, filling the entire length of the opening with a portion of her girth. He could hear the fire warming her system bubbling ferociously within her mammoth stomach, which poured out of the doorway in a long, generous arch despite that her head still stood inside beneath the foyer's chandelier.

In utter awe, he shuffled back down the steps and halfway down the path across the lawn so he could meet her gaze, who eyed him curiously.

"Yeah?" She said starkly.

"U-u-u-u-u-u-u-uh..." Quigley couldn't form a single sentence in his head. There were only words, bouncing around in a hurricane of single thoughts.

Huge. Monstrous. Immense. Massive. Crimson. Ferocious. Terrifying. Female. Passionate. Gorgeous.

Perfect.

"Sir?"

"Uh...Miss! Hello." Quigley bowed, shakily putting his bussinessman face on display. "My name is Quigley Petersen, and I'd happened to hear local word of a dragoness crossing some roads around these parts."

"Hm." Carol replied simply.

"And, if it weren't to blunt of me, I couldn't help but notice you were a dragoness..." He weakly gestured to her. "...and I'd been involved with the production for Night of the Red Sky II, the-soon-to-be-blockbuster that shall-"

"Wait a minute, you want me to be in your movie?" Carol asked with immediate interest.

"Yes, well..." She'd pretty much made it through the door, leaving him nothing to lure her with. "What do you say?"

"Carol, who's at the door?" Marvin asked his wife, entering the foyer to find her belly plugging the front door.

"I'm gonna be in a movie, sweetie!" She exclaimed excitedly, to Quigley's delight, as well. "Tell the kids they're going to any college they want!"

"A movie? What the hell are you talking about?"

"I'm in!" Carol eagerly told Quigley, who leafed through his briefcase for the right papers. "There's a movie guy outside asking if I wanna play the dragon in his movie, and I'm going for it!"

"Woah, woah! Wait a minute!" With his wife turning into a dragon and being cast for a movie in just one day, it was safe to say Marvin was overwhelmed. "Carol, can't we talk about this?!"

"Come on, Marvin, what's not to get out of this?!"

"Don't you think turning into a giant reptile and being seen by millions of people could have a little bit of an effect on our lives?"

"Marvin, we'd already be seen by the entire neighborhood, so it's safe to say the ship has already sailed. Besides, I'm a dragon! What paparazzi's gonna mess with a dragon?"

"Well...I dunno, but..."

"...and if I'm gonna get bigger, it's gonna be in a house a hell of a lot bigger than this one."

"Sign here, miss?" Quigley tossed the long roll of paper so its end unrolled through the air, sailing onto her cleavage. Daintily taking a pen from an end table by its fingers, Carol jotted her name into the contract.

"Get the kids to get their bags ready, Marvin, we're going on vacation." She smirked, turning to look back down at Quigley. "Alright, lead the way!"

"Lead the way!"
112231122222222221211.title: Carol Answers the Door

112231122222222222.content:
It begun off the coast of France on a moon lit night during a full moon. A wedding was about to take place this very night and the bride was getting ready. The bride was a tannish skinned young woman with bright red hair and a crescent moon tattoo over her left eye. As the bride was getting her dress ready, there was another woman with her, a middle-aged woman with graying black hair with green highlights and the exact same tattoo on her face as the bride.

"Andrea," said the older woman. "You must reschedule the wedding. You'll live to regret this night." "Aunt Nicole," said the bride. "This is my night. Don't try to ruin it. You never liked Jonathan." Nicole just let out a scoff. "That Belmont boy is trouble. He's only after the family fortune. But that is beside the point, there is a reason no woman in our family has ever married during a full moon." "Why is that?" asked Andrea as she put down her lipstick. Nicole then froze in place and then twitched her fingers slightly. “Uh,” she said. “Trust me, there is a VERY good reason. You definitely don’t want to go through with this.”

Andrea turned to face her aunt. “Whatever it is,” she said. “It can’t be any stranger than the man I’m marrying. He claims to be a vampire hunter. Said that he destroyed the last descendent of Count Dracula.” “King Dracula,” says Nicole correcting Andrea. “And experience with vampires does not prepare him for what he’s about to unleash onto the world by going through with this.”

That’s when the organ begun to play. “Oh geez,” said Andrea. “It’s starting. Come on, Aunt Nicole. You may not agree with the wedding, but you did agree that you would give the bride away. As Andrea and Nicole were about to enter the church, Nicole looked down at her palm. There was a strange birthmark on it that looked like a pair of wolf’s fangs.

“So, Jonathan is a vampire hunter, or so he claims. He wasn’t the first vampire hunter to fall into a trap set by the Luna Clan. No vampire can prepare him for the beast he will unleash. After the stroke of midnight on the night they tie the know, the monster will come out."
112231122222222222.title: Wedding by Full Moon

1122311222222222221.content:
Andrea and Nicole walk out to the aisle and the wedding begins. The two of them slowly make their way toward the front where Jonathon waits. He's a young man with short brown hair that looks a little messy. "He could have done something with his hair at least." Nicole mutters. "That how his hair is." Andrea says under her breath. Jonathon looks at his future bride as she approaches and smiles broadly. To him there's nothing more beautiful.

When they reach the altar Nicole stands by her niece as the priest says his part. She looks out at the guests and glances over Jonathon's family. There doesn't seem to be many of them. She gets a strange vibe from them as well. Sure they're dressed formally and are enjoying the wedding, but she feels like they're ready to fight for some reason. Indeed. the older of the men on his side look grizzled and experienced. There's even one old man with a long thick beard and an eye patch.

Jonathon's family isn't the only strange thing about the ceremony. Andrea's family is pretty interesting too. In addition to outnumbering the Belmonts by quite a bit, they appear to be comprised of only females. Nicole knows why this is, but Andrea doesn't know yet. She would be told once she was married, but the stubborn girl had to have the ceremony on a full moon! That just complicates things. Well, she'll just have to let things run their course.
1122311222222222221.title: The Two Families

choices: She Loses Control of Her Werewolf Form
11223112222222222211.content:
The ceremony was about to begin and Jonathan and Andrea smiled at each other. The preacher was a lanky and emancipated man who was obscured by his clothing and appeared to have withered skin and bandages covering his throat. “Eerie... I mean dearly, dearly beloved. We are gathered here to unite Jonathan Belmont and Andrea Luna in unholy... uh, I mean, holy, holy matrimony.” Jonathan and Andrea both looked in concern because they didn’t trust the preacher for some reason. They weren’t the only ones in the church who had trust issues because Nicole was glaring at the older man with the thick white beard and the eyepatch. From the looks of it, he was the patriarch of the Belmonts and from the looks of it, he also had a gun in his belt. Several of the younger Luna girls seemed to growl but Nicole gestured for them to stop.

“Do you, Jonathan, take Andrea to be your un... I uh, mean, awfully... I mean LAWFULLY! Lawfully wedded wife.” “I do.” Said Jonathan. Jonathan was slightly nervous as the preacher turned to face Andrea. Before the preacher could say another creepy word, Andrea covered his mouth. “I do!” The preacher gave a hiss. “If anyone has a reason why this wedding should not be, speak now or forever rest in peace. Uh, I mean, forever hold your peace.” Nicole glared at the Belmonts who turned their heads as not to face their future in-laws and the preacher prepared to fully unite Andrea and Jonathan. "By the power invested in me, I pronounce you human... er... man and wife. You may now kiss the bride." Jonathan and Andrea kissed as the organ played loudly.

Later, the newlyweds were ready to go on their honeymoon but some of the relatives weren't too sure of themselves as they were at the airport. "You are making a grave mistake, Jonathan," said the Belmont patriarch. "That woman is not what she seems." "Dad," said Jonathan. "I knew when I laid eyes on Andrea, she was the one. And now we're married. Besides, she's not a vampire in case that's what you're worried about." "Vampires you can handle. This woman is something that's more dangerous than a vampire. You best be on your toes." Andrea gave a giggle. "Don't you worry, Mr. Belmont. Everything is going to be alright. Besides, it's just a flight to London. Nothing bad will happen." Nicole's eyes briefly turned animal-like as she heard her niece's words. "That's what you think, Andrea. You'll see all too well." The Lunas looked right up at the sky and saw that the moon was glowing bright. She looked at her palm to see her birthmark was throbbing. Underneath Andrea's gloves, it was shown that the bride had the exact same birthmark and it was throbbing as well. Andrea looked at her hand in confusion but then shrugged her shoulders right before she and Jonathan were about to leave on the plane.

The bride tossed her bouquet and while one of the Belmont women tried to grab it, one of Nicole's cousins jumped into the air and caught the bouquet in her mouth before landing on the ground and letting out a growl. Some of the Belmonts took out guns but Jonathan's father gestured to them to put the guns away just as Jonathan and Andrea's plane took off. For some reason, Andrea couldn't stop staring out the window at the bright full moon up in the sky as it shined through the clouds. "Andrea?" asked Jonathan. "Sweetie?" Andrea turned to her husband and let out a laugh. "I'm sorry Jonathan. I just can't believe it. Here I am, Mrs. Andrea Luna. I don't know why, but Nicole insisted that you took my family name. I hope you don't mind." Jonathan smiled, shrugged his shoulders and then laughed.

“This is it,” said Jonathan. “I promise you this, Andrea. Our life together will be glorious. I’m even giving up vampire hunting. Besides, the last great threat to humanity was wiped out last week.” Andrea let out a laugh. “No more talk about vampires or other creatures of the night. You’ll sound like my aunt if you keep that up.” “Yeah,” said Jonathan. “I noticed that your Aunt Nicole doesn’t seem to like me that much.” Andrea let out a sigh. “She thought that you were after the...” Jonathan gave a glare as if he was insulting. “What? She thinks I’m a gold digger. She is so narrow-minded. You should listen to my dad, he said that there was something evil about you. He’s trusted no one since somebody he considered a friend turned out to be a vampire and tore out his eye. Next you’re gonna say that she thinks that vampires aren’t real.” Andrea let out a nervous laugh. “She’s never denied it. But for some reason, she didn’t want us to get married on the night of a full moon. I thought it would be more romantic.”

But at that moment, there was a clash of lightning. A storm was brewing in the sky and it was a rather large and loud one. Rain came down and thunder roared. Meanwhile, far away, Nicole was confronted by Jonathan’s father. “You may have fooled Jonathan, but I know you creatures are devils in human clothing.” Nicole let out a scoff. “Shows what you know. Historians remember our kind as enemies of the devil. Besides, your family may have wiped out several vampires but you have no idea how to deal with other creatures of the night. But on the off chance that your son tries to put a silver bullet through Andrea’s heart, there will be war.” Nicole even gave a slight growl as Mr. Belmont walked away. “This isn’t over, Luna. You’re the matriarch of those monsters, but that doesn’t mean you can see us as livestock.” Nicole gave a glare and gestured she was watching the Belmonts.

At that moment, Andrea and Jonathan had landed in London where they heard Big Ben ringing loudly. "The sound of Big Ben," said Andrea. "How majestic and romantic. C'est l'amore." Jonathan smiled and Andrea climbed into his arms so they could walk down out of the airplane. However, Jonathan grunted slightly. "That's odd," he thought to himself. "Andrea seems heavier than she was a few hours ago." But Jonathan shrugged his shoulders and felt that it was nothing to worry about. Andrea saw several clouds forming in the sky. "Gee," she said. "An evil night." Andrea and Jonathan thought it would be best to go to a nearby bus stop and wait for an omnibus." However, Andrea felt her stomach and groaned. "Something wrong, Honey?" asked Jonathan. Andrea just stuck out her tongue to pant. "I dunno," she said. "Maybe I'm having trouble getting used to this new and foggy London air." Jonathan then decided to feel Andrea's head. "Your forehead appears to be fine. But your nose seems really cold for some reason."

Just then Andrea grunted and crouched down. She then begun to growl in a feral tone as Jonathan looked in confusion. "Andrea?" As Andrea turned around, Jonathan looked in fear because his new wife’s eyes appeared to be glowing bright. “Andrea?” asked Jonathan. “Honey, what’s going on.” Andrea grunted as she held onto her chest. “If I knew,” she said with a grunt. “I’d tell you. Suddenly, Andrea felt her stomach to see that it was growing and gasped. She turned and then Jonathan saw her rear was expanding. “I know all brides let themselves go,” said Jonathan. “But not this soon.” Andrea then gave a howl and her fingernails begun to get longer as her breasts were expanding. Jonathan was in utter horror. “If I didn’t know better,” he thought. “I’d say....”

- - - - - - - - - - - - -
 Meanwhile, Nicole was laughing to herself as she saw the birthmark on her palm was glowing. Her own eyes glowed bright as she smirked and showed her teeth were fangs. “There’s a reason that it’s bad luck for one of the Lunas to have her wedding night during a full moon. Because now she’s doomed herself to never be able to transform back. The rest of us can transform at will. I hope for Jonathan’s sake that Andrea can control herself, otherwise, I hope he tastes good.”

- - - - - - - - - - - -

Back with the newlyweds, Andrea was still getting bigger, but something else was coming over her because her long brown hair was getting even longer as bright silver fur was growing over her body. Her teeth turned into fangs sharp enough to munch on diamonds as her fingernails and toenails turned into razor sharp claws that looked like kitchen knives. Her fangs were so large her bright red gums were exposed as her eyes became more animalistic and her face stretched into a snout. She even sprouted a tail as Jonathan only watched in terror right before she let out a howl and held her head up into the air.

By the time the transformation was complete, Andrea was a 30ft tall werewolf with a 50ft belly and 60ft ass and a pair of H-cup breasts as well as three chins and chipmunk-like cheeks. Surprisingly, despite Andrea’s massive increase in weight and height, her wedding dress, veil and tiara were completely intact, if a little tight on her body. Her shoes and gloves however were shredded by her claws. Andrea was drooling heavily as she grit her teeth and Jonathan could not believe what he was looking at.

“Oh my gosh! She’s a werewolf! My wife is a werewolf! I knew vampires were real, but werewolves too?” Andrea’s stomach rumbled heavily and then Jonathan got really worried. “And me without my stake and hammer. What are you saying, Jonathan!? This is Andrea! Sure she’s a giant, obese, flesh-gobbling canine, but she’s still the woman you fell in love with. I just hope she’s in control. I’m not trained to deal with a werewolf, let alone one so big.” Andrea got on all fours as her belly pushed into the ground and her boobs shook. She was wagging her tail as she panted and held out her tongue.  The question was, was Andrea fully in control of her new transformation.
11223112222222222211.title: Night of the Werebride

1122311222222222222.content:
Our story begins in a small town in the heart of Texas during a high speed chase. Somebody had broken into an occult jewelry store and was driving away with the contents. However, there were two women on motorcycles chasing after him. The first of the woman was a buxom young woman with long brown hair that had a slight white highlight in it and was dressed as a cowgirl. This was Daisy Downe, the sheriff of the town of Garlen. She was accompanied by a younger looking Asian cowgirl who appeared to be her deputy. “So what’s the situation, Jen?” asked Daisy. Deputy Lee nodded her head. “Repeat offender. Shackleford.” “Good grief,” muttered the sheriff. “How many times do we have to bring him in? Who did he rob this time?” “That’s the weirdest part, Daisy,” said Jen. “There was nobody home. It was a new curio store that had all sorts of weird jewelry. It only opened yesterday.” Daisy was curious but then shrugged her shoulders and then drove off in an attempt to catch Shackleford.

The robber was looking at the jewelry he stole, among witch was a strange skull that looked like it belonged to some sort of bovine. He then noticed Daisy driving her motorcycle towards him. “Damn!” he yelled. “Sheriff Downe!” Shackleford held out his gun and would’ve shot the sheriff, but she shot the barrel of his gun right off with her own gun. “I don’t think so, creep. Jen, you take one side, I’ll take the other.” Daisy drove to the right side of the car in order to distract Shackleford as he reached for a knife but before he could do anything, Jen drove to the left side of the car in order to handcuff the robber to his own steering wheel as he gasped. Before the car could go any further, Sheriff Down drove her motorcycle in front of it and kicked the car in the grill in order to stop it, causing the airbag to go off and force the crook to turn the car off. In the process, the cow skull was sent flying out of Shackleford’s car and landed in the seat of Daisy’s motorcycle as she stepped off of it and went to arrest him. “We have got to stop meeting like this. Good work, Jen. I’ll take this polecat back to the station. Y’all return these jewels.” But as Daisy sat down on her motorcycle, she yelled in pain. “Daisy!” yelled Jen. “Are you okay?” Daisy stood up and rubbed her backside in pain to see she sat on the bejeweled cow’s skull. “Dang it,” she said. “Looks like we missed one.” Daisy picked up the skull, not realizing that its eyes were glowing and tossed it to Jen. “This is a funny looking skull, Sheriff,” said Jen. “Not like any cow I’ve ever seen.” Daisy looked at the skull and seemed to agree with her deputy. “That is mighty strange. But then again, it came from a strange store.” Jen nodded her head and went to return the stolen loot as Daisy was taking Shackleford to jail.

“You know something, Sheriff,” said the robber Shackleford. “There is one thing you are and that’s a cow! Nothing but a big, mean, fat cow!” Daisy was unintimidated and returned to her office before locking up Shackleford in jail. “That’s what you say, you old coyote,” said the cowgirl. “But I’m the cow that brought you in. Maybe now you’ll stay put.” Back at the curio store, Jen had returned the stolen jewels and then put the cow skull in place. “I’ve never seen a skull like this. It looks like it came from a cattle breed I’ve never seen before.” But then Jen gasped because the skull mysteriously vanished and then Jen rubbed her eyes. “I must not be getting enough sleep.” She said.
1122311222222222222.title: The Real Cowgirls

choices: Suddenly, There's a Burglar Alarm Nearby
Skip to the Next Day on Patrol
11223112222222222221.content:
Daisy at the time hadn’t put my thought into the minotaur skull once she had brought Shackleford in. Soon, she had returned home to her husband Rick and daughter Violet. “That’s the third time I’ve had to bring in that punk this month, Rick,” said Daisy. “I tell you, Garlen used to be a nice quiet town.” “The law is the law, Daisy, you can only hold them for so long.” Said Rick. Violet just smiled. “Let them escape. Mama will just catch them again. Daisy smiled and rubbed Violet’s head as Rick was busy at the grill. “Still,” said Daisy. “I wish there was some way to stop these crooks before they have a chance to start. Something to scare them straight.” “I dunno, Dear,” said Rick with a laugh. “Outlaws are getting bolder.” “Not much has changed from the days of the wild west.” Said Daisy with a laugh.

Suddenly, Daisy felt her head and groaned. “You okay, Daisy?” asked Rick. Daisy just let out a scoff. “Quit your worrying, Sug. It’s just a slight headache.” Daisy grunted again. “As well as another pain. I sat on a cow skull earlier.” “Ouch.” Said Violet. “Yeah, Darling,” said Daisy. “Ouch. But it was kinda weird looking. I’ve seen every type of cow and what they look like inside and outside but that didn’t look like any skull I’ve seen before.” Violet gave a nervous look but then her mother picked her up to walk her to her patio table. “Don’t be so worried, Violet. Your Mama is hard as steel and there ain’t no such thing as a poisonous cow. Come on, let’s get the grub going. I’m hungry enough to eat a horse. And I ain’t kidding. My stomach feels like it hasn’t eaten in days.” Both Violet and Rick laughed at what they thought was a joke.

Soon, the Downes were eating their ham steaks, but surprisingly for them, Daisy was devouring the lion’s share of the meat and had already eaten three ears of corn. “You weren’t kidding,” said Rick. “You have a tapeworm or something?” But Daisy just continued to eat. “I’m hungry, Rick,” she said. “It feels like my stomach split into four.” Then, Violet noticed something. “Mama,” she said. “Did you always have a tail?” Daisy gave a look of confusion. “Tail?” she asked. Daisy then looked to see she had grown a long tail like that of some kind of bovine. “What the?” asked Daisy. Daisy then twitched. “Mama!” yelled Violet. Daisy saw that her breasts appeared to have doubled in size and then she heard her jeans unzipping and looked down to see what looked like an udder like that of a cow. “Huh?” asked Daisy.

Daisy then twitched again as she felt her thighs get bigger as her jeans were coming apart at the seams. “Daisy!” yelled Rick in horror. Daisy then felt herself getting bigger and then she felt what looked like long horns growing out of the sides of her head as her ears changed shape. Daisy let out a yell that then turned into a loud moo as her cowgirl boots tore apart and revealed that her feet had turned into hooves. She was also getting bigger and fatter with her stomach and chin bulging out and her ass following afterwards, destroying what was left of her pants. Her shirt was reduced to a bra on her growing breasts as Daisy’s face twisted into a snout of some snort. Then copper brown fur grew all over her body with the occasional spots of sienna brown, including one spot over her eye. Both Daisy’s husband and daughter looked up at the sheriff in surprise. She had become a 35ft tall, gigantically obese minotaur. A gigantic minotaur in her undergarments since her clothes were destroyed by her growth spurt. All except for her cowgirl hat that for some reason grew with her. Daisy looked around surprised at how she had become a giant bovid monster.

However, Daisy was not at all horrified at what she had become and even let out a laugh as she looked all around her new bovine body. She swung her tail and she even held up her udder as her husband and daughter looked in Daisy.”Daisy,” said Rick. “You’re taking this surprisingly well.” Daisy gave a smirk and lowered her head to Rick level. “I’ll admit it, Ricky,” she said. “Being turned into a minotaur was not something I was planning to do today, but look at how ginormous I am.” Daisy let out a laugh as she bumped her hip into the house. “Think about it. If the crooks knew that the town’s sheriff was a gigantic minotaur, they’d think twice about trying anything.” Rick was baffled at his wife’s words, but she did have a valid point. No criminal could stand up to a minotaur lady the size of a house.

Daisy then looked around and noticed how fat she had gotten from the transformation before she shrugged her shoulders. “Who ever heard of a skinny cow anyway?” she asked before letting out a hearty laugh.
11223112222222222221.title: Don't Have a Cow Man

112231122222222222211.content:
As Daisy was immediately getting used to her transformation into a giant minotaur, she heard a ringing noise. It sounded like a bell from a burglar alarm. The noise made the bovine titaness smirk. "Perfect timing," she said. "Now to give crime a rude awakening." "I don't know if that's such a good idea, Daisy." Said Rick. Daisy just smiled down at her husband. "Don't worry, Rick," she said. "What could one bank robber do against a mega minotaur. I'll be right back." Daisy bent down to kiss Rick and Violet, coating them in cow saliva before walking off. "Yuck." Muttered Violet.

Daisy was walking off to the scene of the crime with a grin on her face. "That sounded like it was going to Cherish's jewelry store," said the giantess to herself. "Jen warned me that that nasty crook, Raymond Yates escaped from the state pen a few days ago. If he thinks he can cause trouble in my town, he is in for a big surprise." Daisy let out a laugh at her own joke pointing out her size. It would appear that the curse that transformed her was not over because she appeared to be getting bigger with every step. Although for some reason, her cowgirl hat seemed to be growing with her (it's magic, we don't have to explain. And if anyone calls it a cheat, that's too damn bad).

At that moment, there was screaming at the jewelry store and the sound of bullets. "Next time I won't miss, you noisy bitch!" yelled an aggressive sounding voice. That voice belonged to Raymond Yates, a criminal infamous throughout Texas. He had actually been sentenced to death for his violent crimes before he escaped and he was trying to get some pocket money before heading to Mexico. "Depraved sadist," muttered Yates. "I didn't mutilate any of those teachers until after they were dead. I wonder if they know I'm here. Bah! The sheriff in this town is a skirt. She'll be easy to get rid of." That's what Yates thought, but as he tried to start the getaway car, he saw that it wasn't going anywhere and then the criminal heard a creaking noise. "What the hell?"

Yates got out of the car and looked in surprise to see one of Daisy's hooves pressing down on the roof. He then looked in even bigger shock to see an 80ft tall and ginormously obese minotaur woman staring down at him with a smirk. "Y'all must be Yates," said Daisy rather smugly. "I happen to be the law around here. Sheriff Daisy Downe. I recently just got a rather extreme makeover and I'm in a very good mood today, so if y'all surrender, I won't have to get nasty."

However, Yates was a violent man, he was a vicious man, he was a heartless man, but he wasn't a smart man. If he was he wouldn't have become a criminal in the first place. Yates took out his gun and shot at Daisy, but because Daisy was titanically obese and the size of a building, the bullet merely bounced off of her shin, to the shock of Yates. Daisy gave a smirk. "Looks like nasty it is." Daisy then turned around and Yates looked in horror as the minotaur woman held her enormous rear over him and wiggled it. "Oh no! Oh no! Oh f.....!" Before Yates could finish his sentence, Daisy slammed her butt down on top of Yates, not enough to crush him but enough to immobilize him as he yelled swear words underneath the minotaur giantess's meteor-sized rear. Just to twist the knife, Daisy then got up and squeezed the robber between her cheeks as she gave a laugh.

Finally she peeled the villain off her rear as he groaned. "Tell all the crooks back at the state pen that they better stay out of Garlen," said Daisy. "Or else they'll have this cowgirl to contend with." Several spectators looked in dumbfounded shock as their mutated sheriff walked away to take Yates to prison.
112231122222222222211.title: Longhorn of the Law

1122311222222222222111.content:
As Daisy was walking away with the captured villain, there was a sound of a motorcycle approaching. Deputy Lee was coming forward, rather late to the scene of the crime. However, as Jen approached, she gave a look of shock and turned her head to see the 80ft tall minotaur that was her boss. The titaness had huge H-cup breasts, a 100ft wide stomach, 120ft rear and 60ft wide udder. As Jen was looking up at the cow woman, she wasn’t paying attention to where she was driving and Daisy had to grab the back of her deputy’s motorcycle to prevent her from crashing. “It ain’t a good idea to stare at anything except what’s in front of you when you’re driving, Deputy.” Jen heard Daisy’s voice coming from the mouth of the giant cow and couldn’t believe it. “Daisy!? Is that you!? What the hell happened?” Daisy just held Raymond Yates in her other hand as he kept struggling. “I’ll explain it on the way. Gotta take this varmint to the state pen. Daisy placed Jen on her shoulder before walking out of Garlen’s city limits to make her way to the state prison.

As the bovine behemoth was stomping away, Jen just looked around her giantess friend’s naked fur-covered body and then looked at Daisy’s cowgirl hat that appeared to have actually grown with her. “Seriously, Sheriff Downe?” asked Jen. “How the hell did you get transmogrified into a giant cow? Did you eat a bad burger or something? You do know they’ve been using growth hormones in that crap.” Daisy gave a snort. “First of all,” said the giant cow woman. “I believe the proper term is minotaur. That’s the bull critter in Greek Mythology. Kinda funny that female minotaurs apparently have udders. As to answer your question, remember that magic shop robbery we busted earlier. I think that skull I sat on was magic. It’s like how a vampire’s bite works.” Jen just blinked in surprise. “Okay,” she said. “That would explain you turning into a minotaur but how come A) You’re a giant and B) You’re morbidly obese.” Daisy gave a scoff. “Jen,” she said. “This is Texas. Everything’s bigger here, even curses apparently. Not that this is a curse. This transformation just solved the outlaw problem in Garlen.”

Jen blinked and then she understood exactly what Sheriff Downe was talking about. “That makes sense,” said Jen nervously. “Who’d be stupid enough to pick a fight with a minotaur the size of Godzilla. Uh, just one more question though, Daisy; why are you naked.” Daisy just blushed. “I kinda outgrew my clothes when I went super colossal.” “Then how come your hat grew with you?” Daisy actually stopped to think about that. That was a good question. But then she simply mumbled and then shrugged her shoulders.” Jen gave a sigh as she laid back behind the cow woman’s ear. “Oh well,” she said. “I guess we can chalk that up to magic that can’t be explained. I just hope that if there is a sorcerer supreme in this dimension, that he isn’t some brain dead moron who abandons real magic for street magic because real magic doesn’t have “rules”.” Daisy let out a sigh. “You know as well as I do that that was the result of a biased writer. They were trying to kill the franchise because they didn’t want to work on it any longer.”

Daisy then let out a grunt because Yates was still beating around in her hand. “Hey, fatso! It’s bad enough that I got beaten into the ground by a big stupid cow. Do you have to torture me with your lame small talk as well. Go back to Moo Mesa you lousy ungulate!” Daisy just gave a snort and smirked before squeezing her captive and making him grunt. “Oh really?” asked the titanic sheriff. “That’s funny. From my perspective, you’re not in any position to be making threats and being nasty. And you know, it’s a long walk to the prison even at my size. I might need a snack on the way.” Daisy smirks, giving Yates a good view of her enormous herbivorous teeth that were big enough to crush cars and the outlaw shivers in her grip from pure fear as Daisy faked a sinister cackle. Jen just stared at her boss disapprovingly. “What?” asked Daisy. “A giant cow lady can’t have some fun? Fine, I’m not going to waste another moment. It’s off to Steeltoe Penitentiary for this varmint.”

Daisy was soon whistling to herself as she walked out into the desert to reach the prison. Jen just kicked back between the ear of the bovine titaness and was still wrapping her head around what happened. “I can’t believe it,” she thought to herself. “She sits her big butt down on a magic skull and sure enough, she’s a minotaur big enough to pick her teeth with the Eiffel Tower. What does she need me for? At her size, a Megazord could do my job better. Man, what I wouldn’t give for a piece of that action. Though maybe not a cow. I’ve eaten a lot of steak in my lifetime and that would just be creepy. Damn. I’m going to have to give up eating beef. Now that I know a cow that could just as easily swallow me.”

At Steeltoe Penitentiary at the time, the prisoners were working on a chain gang and stuck hammering away at rocks (I know it’s a western cliche and this is the modern time, but give me a break). One particularly large prisoner with a yellow tattoo of the Greek letter Sigma was biding his time as he hammered away at a rock and was sharpening it to a point. “I’m gonna get out of here,” he thought to himself. “And as soon as I get out, that lady sheriff who put me here is ****ing dead. But before I kill her, I think I’ll make sure that she can’t be replaced. Maybe I should silence that pretty little girl of hers first.” The crook with the hammer and the Sigma tattoo gave an evil smirk and was going to start to smash his chains. However, that’s when there was a loud shaking and all the prisoners were clamoring as the guards tried to restrain them. The warden himself ran out to investigate. “What’s going on here?” asked the warden. “An earthquake.” The vice warden shook his head and he had a look of surprise plastered to his face as he pointed forward. The warden saw Daisy approaching the Penitentiary and all but had a heart attack when he saw the enormous cow woman walking in and waving at him.

“Howdy, Warden Eiding,” said Daisy. “It’s just the sheriff of Garlen returning one of your varmints that leaked into my town.” Daisy then unceremoniously dropped Raymond Yates back into the prison into a puddle of rain water as he grunted. The other inmates as well as the guards themselves were shocked to see such an enormously titanic minotaur woman but they were even more surprised to hear that the creature was the sheriff. "Sheriff?" asked Warden Eiding. "Sheriff Daisy Downe of Garlen." Daisy just blushed at the warden's question. "It's a long story. I kind of got an extreme makeover from the last time anyone saw me." The prisoner with the Sigma tattoo, the one who was planning to escape and get revenge on Daisy, looked at the rock he sharpened to use as a weapon and begun to rethink his course of actions before smashing the rock and throwing away the hammer. He realized that now would probably not be a good time to pick a fight with the sheriff who originally captured him, especially now that there would be no way he could even harm her.

Yates stood up and was feeling rather irate and it was clear that anger was quickly overriding logic. "You haven't seen the last of me, you lard-ridden colossus! I'll get out again and when I do, you're hamburger meat!" The other inmates looked in horror at the idea that Yates still insisted on trying to provoke Daisy. "This guy must have a death wish." Thought Jen to herself. Daisy just gave a smug grin at Yates. "Don't you grin at me," said the criminal. "I'm serious. I'm going to kill you. If it takes me one hundred years I'm gonna....!" Before Yates could finish his sentence, Daisy flicked him into the wall with her finger and made him grunt as the guards went to apprehend the villain.

The bovine giantess couldn't help but snicker at how none of the inmates had any hope of challenging her and then grabbed her hat by the brim before speaking again. "Let this be a grim reminder for all of you varmints to stay right where you are. I'm the kind of sheriff who's tough on crime. Really tough. And from now on, things are going to be a lot tougher for any sidewinders who think they can raise hell in my time. I'll make it perfectly simple; mess with this cow and you get her horns." With that Daisy gave a snort and then turned to face Warden Eiding. "See y'all later, Warden." Said the giant sheriff as she tipped her cowgirl hat. As Daisy turned and walked away, the warden was completely dumbfounded. "That is the last time I drink a single drop of hard lemonade." The warden said as he shook his head.

On the walk back to Garlen, Daisy was attracting a lot of attention as she walked alongside the highway, making absolutely sure not to crush any cars underfoot. "No need to worry, citizens," said the bovine goddess. "I mean y'all no harm. Unless y'all is thinking about breaking the law and then y'all really in for a world of hurt." Daisy let out a laugh as Jen walked up to her ear. "You better be careful, Sheriff," she said. "You don't want to go mad with power." "Don't be such a spoilsport, Jen. I'm just having fun." "You know, you're taking this transformation surprisingly well. How are Rick and Violet taking it." Daisy shrugged her shoulders. "They'll get used to it. Ugh. I better get back home fast. My udder is killing me. Hope Rick doesn't m..." "Ew!" yelled Jen. Soon, Daisy had arrived back in Garlen and dropped off Jen on the ground before she walked off towards home. "See you tomorrow, Deputy."

However, as she watched her giant minotaur boss walk away, Jen begun to think to herself. "I wonder if that magic shop is still open," she said to herself. "I'd like to get in on some of that action."
1122311222222222222111.title: Big Beautiful Bovine of Justice

choices: She Arrives at the Crime Scene Before Daisy
Daisy is Already There When She Shows Up
11223112222222222221112.content:
As Jen was walking away, she couldn't help but look back at Daisy as she was walking towards her home. Jen gave a scoff. "Jokes on you, Boss. Rick is gonna have to take yoga classes before he fools around with you again. Oh, I can't believe this. If she's big enough to squash outlaws like bugs all by herself, what does she need me for. I wish that I was a giant mythical monster. Sure the poundage might be somewhat unattractive but at least I'd feel a sense of power." Jen passed by a department store with a mirror in it and looked all around her scrawny body and the Asian woman let out a groan. "How she chose me as deputy I'll never know. I look like a total weakling. That is final. I want to be a monster too. But how." Then it occurred to Jen. That minotaur skull turned Daisy into a giant obese minotaur so it could probably turn her into a giantess as well. "That's it!" she yelled. "That skull that was stolen from the magic shop. Time to even up the score." Jen ran forward and then grunted because she fell into one of the holes left by Daisy's footprints. She let out a grunt before climbing her way out.

Jen didn't have long to go to find the magic shop. There she saw from the window display alone, a brain in a jar, a gorilla's paw and what looked like a hurricane in a jar. "I'm definitely at the right place." She said. Jen walked into the store and looked around. Nobody appeared to be around and yet there was a table that had the same minotaur's skull in the center, except that this time, the skull appeared to have a large bandage on it from where Daisy sat on it. Jen walked up to the skull and tapped it before looking around. "Anybody home?" the deputy asked. "Hello?!" Jen didn't get an answer and looked around. "There's got to be a bell or something around here. Hello! Customer in the house over here!" Jen still got no answer and resorted to banging her hand impatiently on the table.

That was when the minotaur skull's eyes glowed bright. "You don't have to act up," said the skull in a deep voice. "I already know that you're here." "Huh?" asked Jen. "Who said that?" Jen then looked down because the skull appeared to be moving its jaw. "Down here." Jen let out a scream and then held out her gun as she pointed it at the skull. The skull just let out a sigh. "Unless those bullets are silver, they will be of no use to you." Jen couldn't believe it. "You just talked. Skulls don't talk!" "This is a magical store," said the skull. "What do you expect? More importantly, what have you come for." Jen showed the skull her badge. "Deputy Jennifer Lee. I work for the sheriff." "The sheriff," grumbled the skull. "I remember her. Big tall brunette with the skunk stripe and tight green sweat pants. She had a really big ass if I remember correctly." "Well now her ass is big enough to be used as a wrecking ball. You turned her into a giant minotaur." "Not on purpose," said the skull. "I used to be a minotaur myself, though not nearly as large as she is now. I'm afraid that the curse can't be broken if that's what you've come here for. She will be the new minotaur for the rest of her life."

Jen gave a glare. "That's not what I'm here for. Sheriff Downe is unstoppable. No criminal in Garlen stands a chance against her at her current size and form." "And what's wrong with that? As long as she's tyrannizing evildoers like those hooligans who kidnapped me, I don't see a problem." Jen let out a scream and pounded the table again. "Pay attention! Pay attention. This is the main problem. What does she need a deputy for if no criminal can stand up to her? What am I good for?" "I really don't like where this is going." Said the skull. "My point," said Jen. "Is that I want to be a titan too. I want to be as big and powerful as Daisy. I don't care what you turn me into. I don't have to be a minotaur either. Just make me a giant." The skull spun around. "You do understand that this is magic you're trifling with. Magic is unpredictable. You have no idea what you're getting into." But Jen gave a glare. "Excuse me, but do you have a permit to have your shop here? I could just as easily shut this place down." "You are like a petulant child," said the minotaur skull. "Exactly how big and powerful do you need to be in order to feel better about yourself?" Jen blushed slightly. The skull had a point that she was mainly doing this for self-gratification and to feel important. Perhaps she was being a tad selfish and impulsive.

But then Jen shook her head and glared at the skull. "Just please give it to me straight. I don't care what you turn me into. Just as long as it's something." The skull let out a deep sigh. "Why must humans be willing to trade their humanity for nothing? Fine, I have something that might be the answer to your problems, that is if you're willing to go through with it. Once you transform, you will have little to no hope of ever becoming human again." "I don't care. Just do it." The skull opened up his mouth to reveal a small box. As the box opened up, Jen instinctively closed her eyes, believing the contents to be something horrifying. "Ew!" she yelled. "What is it? Newt's eyes? Bat wings? Dragon blood?" But as Jen opened her eyes she was surprised because all that was in the box was a large farm brown egg.

"An egg?" asked Jen as she picked up the egg and looked in disbelief. "This is it. It's just a stupid egg." "That "stupid" egg as you call it," said the skull. "Is a freak of nature. It's a rooster egg?" Jen raised an eyebrow. "Are you kidding me? Roosters don't lay eggs. Hens do." "I just told you it was a freak of nature. However, the egg was then stolen by a snake and partially incubated. Inside this egg is the very same power that you so desperately seek. All you must do is eat it." Jen was somewhat shocked. "Are you kidding me. I hate eggs and an egg that was handled by a snake. Yuck." "You do want to be a giant don't you?" Jen let out a sigh. "I do. I want to be a giant on par with Daisy." The skull nodded his head. "So now you must eat the egg. You can scramble it, hard-boil it or just eat it raw. The end result will be the same." Jen didn't really fully understand what was going on but took the egg and put it in her pocket. "How much do I owe you." The skull just glowed his eyes bright. "Believe me, what will happen to your body is payment enough. Good day to you, Deputy." As Jen was about to leave, she turned her head. "Uh, by the way. Is there any way to turn into a giant without becoming inhumanly obese." "No," said the skull. "I'm afraid that everything from this store that induces growth, also induces weight gain. No gain, no growth." "Figures." Muttered Jennifer.

Jen walked out of the shop with the egg. However, the second she walked out, the store mysteriously vanished and the deputy looked back in surprise. "Okay," she said. "That was a little bit freaky. But at least I have the means to become a giant. Hope this town is big enough for the two of us, Daisy." Jennifer wasted no time running home and frying the egg on a skillet. She looked in disgust because this egg was not colored normal. The yolk was pitch blue. "Yuck," said the deputy as she sprinkled salt and pepper onto the egg in the skillet. "How revolting. You're gonna have to choke it down, Jennifer. You want to be a giant of justice much like Daisy."

Once the egg was fully cooked, Jennifer scooped it up with a spatula and then held it in front of her face. "I really hate eggs," she said. "Which is why I got to make this quick." Jen dropped the fried egg into her mouth and then screamed in pain because it was still hot. As she swallowed and choked slightly on the egg, she immediately drank a glass of water in order to make the egg go down faster. Jen then breathed heavily and then ran outside of her house. She knew she didn't want to be indoors when she turned into a big fat monster giantess. "This is it!" yelled Jen. "I'm going to be big! I'm going to be mighty! I'm going to be monstrous!" Jen let out a pretend roar and swung her arms. However, she looked around and saw nothing happened and let out a groan.

"What a rip! Stupid skull ripped me off! Wait, he didn't say that the results would be immediate. Maybe it takes time to... bucaw!" Jen gasped because she could've sworn she clucked like a chicken. Suddenly she heard a ripping sound and saw that her hips were outgrowing her pants. "Oh my.. squawk!" Jen held out her arms to see that bright purple scales were growing on her arms as well as bright fuchsia leather wings. Onn her back and face, she was sprouting bright light blue feathers as her purple hair got longer. Jen's belly was bulging as well and she felt herself grow purple scales on her legs as she sprouted a long dragon-like tail and her feet turned into bright golden-yellow talons like those of a bird but with abnormally sharp claws. As Jen grew bigger, she sprouted two more chins as her neck elongated and she squawked as she grow a fuchsia-colored chicken's wattle and her mouth extended into a golden-yellow beak. She just kept growing bigger and fatter as she squawked and her clothing, except for her vest and cowgirl's hat was torn completely apart.

Once the transformation was complete, Jen was a 65ft tall cockatrice with a 75ft wide rear and 80ft wide stomach and D-cup breasts. She looked at her new body and squawked as she saw her reflection in a window. "I'm a cockatrice?" she asked. "Oh man. Not what I had in mind, but it's an improvement. Okay, so I'm not as big as Daisy, but it's still good." As Jen was laughing to herself, she heard a burglar alarm and squawked. "Show time!" Jen then waddled rapidly as fast as her chicken legs could carry her.
11223112222222222221112.title: The Deputy's Diameter

11223112222222222222.content:
It was a busy day at the Ajax Joseph Memorial Hospital and one of the surgeons in particular was hard at work. This doctor was a young woman with long golden red hair and a blue patch over her right eye who was dressed like a doctor. “Her name was Dr. Diana Queen and she was in the middle of a surgery on a man who looked like he had been heavily wounded in an accident. “Faster, people,” said Diana. “We can’t lose him. It’s a miracle they brought him here on time. These neck wounds are very severe. Somebody get me the anesthetic.” Outside, there were a couple of janitors listening in. “Dr. Queen sure sounds serious today.” Said one of them. The other janitor just nodded his head. “The patient is a Stephan Warner. He was just in a mountain climbing accident and Dr. Queen is doing all she can.” “I wouldn’t worry, kid. She’s the best surgeon we have.”

“Just a few more,” said Diana. “Everything will be already. Maynard, hand me the scalpel. I have to get out this last piece of metal. I haven’t lost a patient yet and I don’t plan to. Not when there is so much to live for. Don’t worry, Mr. Warner, you’re gonna be alright.” Hours passed and Diana took off her surgical mask as she smiled and spoke with Stephan Warner. “Good news, Mr. Warner. You’ve made a complete recovery.” Stephan moved his hand a few times and sighed in relief. “Thank you, very much, Dr. Queen. But I’m afraid I can’t pay the medical bill. Business has been slow this month and as for my insurance...” Diana gave a smile. “Don’t worry,” said the surgeon. “Just pay the bill when you can. I joined this profession to help people.” Stephan gave a smile at Diana.

Hours later after work, Diana was at her penthouse with her fiancé, Jim and they had just gotten through with intercourse. “Damn, Jim. You are so weak. You must be out of shape.” “Hey,” said Jim. “I am marrying a doctor in a few months, Diana. And you’re vicious.” Diana just let out a scoff. “I have to be. Not everybody listens to doctor’s orders. Oh, damn. I forgot to get the newspaper today. Wait right here, Jim.” Jim just ran as Diana walked to the door. Of course he gave a glare. “I just hope she never has to see that patient from earlier again,” he said. “That’s the one thing I hate about her being a doctor.” Jim was a very envious man and didn’t like any other guy he even imagined would be trying to get it on with Diana. But as Diana went to get the paper, she saw a strange package waiting for her. When Diana walked back in with the package, Jim got concerned. "What's with the box, Di?" asked Jim. "I don't know." Jim took a look and gasped. "You have got to be kidding me. It's from that Stephan Warner joker."

“That’s odd,” said Diana. “What would a patient be sending me?” “Maybe he’s paying you in advance,” said Jim. “He must’ve found some cash on hand after all.” Diana opened the package and gave a gasp because what Stephan had sent her appeared to be a wool scarf that was in a bright gold color. “I-I don’t know what to say.” Diana put the scarf on and looked at herself in the mirror. “How do I look, Jim? This wool is gorgeous. It feels almost like it’s made of actual gold.” Jim looked at the scarf and was kind of mad that Stephan would send his girlfriend something so nice. “Oh,” said Diana. “You’re being paranoid, Jim. Think of this as payment for the surgery. I told Stephan that he could pay me later and apparently he didn’t have any actual money on him, so he sent me this golden fleece instead. it looks as if it’s the same worth as the medical bill. Nothing to worry about.” But Jim was still skeptic.

Diana didn’t think there was anything apparently wrong with the wool scarf and was wearing it to work the next morning. As she was walking into the hospital though, she let out a gasp. She clutched her chest and saw a billboard advertising a poster for a monster movie involving a werewolf. Diana shivered and then she raised an eyebrow in confusion. “What am I doing?” she asked. “I never had a fear of wolves before.” Diana shrugged her shoulders as she walked away wearing her scarf. She then let out a yawn that almost sounding like a bleat. “Boy,” said the surgeon. “I must be tired.” What Diana didn’t realize that with every step, she appeared to be putting on weight.
11223112222222222222.title: Golden Fleeced

112231122222222222221.content:
Inside the hospital, Diana was walking down the hallway when a nurse spotted her. “Good morning, Dr. Queen.” “Good morning, Nora.” Suddenly Nora stopped because she noticed that she was two heads shorter than Diana and Diana seemed to be getting fatter with every step. “Dr. Queen, are you putting on weight?” Diana turned and gave a glare. “Excuse me?” she asked. Nora gave a nervous laugh. “I didn’t mean it like that, Dr. Queen, but for some reason you look so much.... bigger than you usually are.” Diana crossed her arms but then noticed that her breasts were getting bigger. “WTF?” she asked herself.

Suddenly, Diana grunted and felt her head. “Dr. Queen?” asked Nora in worry. “Nothing,” said Diana. “Just a strange headache. Ouch. I’ll be fine.” That’s what Diana thought but when she got to the bathroom, she saw that she did indeed get larger. “You gotta be kidding me,” said Diana. “How could I get so fat so quickly? All I had for breakfast this morning was one banana and I haven’t cheated on my diet even once.” Then Diana felt her head and then grunted because she felt something prick her and she saw that her finger appeared to be pleading from a minor puncture wound. Diana felt around her head. “That’s odd,” she said. “It feels as if something is growing on my head.” The female doctor splashed water on her face and even wiped beneath her eyepatch before splashing some water into her own eye. “I must not be getting enough sleep.” She said to herself. Then Diana let out a gasp

As Diana stood in front of the sink, she looked into the bathroom mirror to see that she was undergoing a strange mutation. She was not only getting taller, but she was growing very obese, especially in the thighs. She saw that her high heels had slide off as her feet turned to hooves. Diana then felt her butt expand until it was higher than her waist and revealed her naked booty (she was going commando) and she sprouted a stubby tail Diana than felt long and thick, shining, golden wool growing all over her body as her ears became pointed and her face extended into a snout as her skin turned pinkish gold. Diana let out a scream that turned into a bleat right before she sprouted a pair of long reddish gold curved horns like that of a ram, which contrasted with her ewe body. Diana backed up as her large rear accidentally knocked down down three bathroom stalls.

Diana bent over and looked in the mirror to see she had transformed into a 15ft tall golden sheep who had to weigh at least 5 tons. As Diana stepped back, the floor begun to crack. She then felt her neck to learn that her scarf had somehow merged with her skin and formed a wool collar. “Well,” said Diana. “I wasn’t expecting this to happen today. I hope Jim likes the idea of being screwed by a ewe tonight.” Diana even bit her fingernails to find they had turned to solid gold as well, every part of her body was shining as she looked in the mirror. It appeared that even though she was very obese and soft, her skin, wool, horns and bones appeared to have turned into actual gold. “Did Stephan’s gift do this to me? His profile did say that he ran a curio store. Perhaps the fleece was cursed and he didn’t know it.” Then, Diana heard a pounding on the door. “Dr. Queen,” said a voice. “Dr. Queen. Come quick!” Diana gulped because from the looks of it, the doctor was not going to have any choice but to go to work as an obese amazonian ovine.

“Dr. Queen, hurry up. We need you in....”
112231122222222222221.title: Sheep-Wrecked

1122311222222222222212.content:
"We need you in the maternity ward. It's Mrs. Duncan. Her water's just broke." Diana blinked (or winked more accurately given she only had one good eye) in surprise and then she sheepishly (see what I did there) walked out and the orderly spotted her in her transformed state and gasped at the obese sheep giantess stood in front of him. "No time for gaaaaawking," said Dr. Queen before grabbing her mouth in embarrassment at the fact she had just bleated. "This is an emergency." The sheep woman was walking down the hallway as her lab coat was coming lose from her obese body. As the sheep waddled down the hallway, she seemed to be getting larger and fatter. She even accidentally knocked her booty into the wall and cracked it.

At the maternity ward there was a pregnant woman screaming in agony as the nurses were trying to calm her down. "Don't worry, Mrs. Duncan. Everything will be alright. The doctor will see you shortly." "What's taking her so long?!" yelled Mrs. Duncan. "Oh!" The orderly from before ran into the room and looked at the rest of the staff. "Everyone," he said. "When you see Dr. Queen, it might come to a shock. She's not looking like herself today." "What are you talking about?" asked a Hispanic female nurse. There was then a rumbling sound and Diana walked into the room as her golden fleece flashed brightly. The nurses looked in surprise at their mutated boss and Mrs. Duncan outright screamed to see a 20ft tall and 6 ton sheep woman looming down on her and wearing a surgical mask.

"Everything will be alright, ma'am," said Dr. Queen. "I'm still a doctor, even if I look like I belong in a zoo right now. Take it easy, just push, just push." Mrs. Duncan was looking up at the sheep giantess in pure fear but she remained calm and decided to let Diana do her job. "Everything will be find. Lila, bring me some warm towels. This is gonna be messy." The Hispanic nurse nodded her head and went to get the towels.

After a while, Mr. Duncan was called into the room. He saw his wife in pure fear and then he looked up and gasped in shock at the giant sheep holding his newborn baby. The baby herself was surprisingly unafraid of Diana and was even pulling slightly on Diana's wool as Diana was in mild discomfort. "Congratulations, Mr. Duncan," said Diana. "It's a girl." Diana handed Mr. Duncan his daughter who was giggling and reaching out for the large sheep woman. "I must be more stressed out than I thought." Said Mr. Duncan. "I'm starting to see things." Diana looked down at the newborn baby who was giggling at her.

- - - - - - - - - - - - -

Soon, Dr. Queen was in the break room buying a candy bar from a vending machine. However, since her body was now much bigger, the golden sheep giantess had emptied out the entire machine. Nora and Lila went out from behind the corner and was watching Dr. Queen in surprise. "That scarf," said Nora. "It must've transformed her." Lila nodded her head as she looked at Diana's enormous body. "Well, it certainly hasn't stopped her from performing her job." Nora was drooling at the sight of the golden fleece surrounding Diana's body. "It looks like her body, hair and bones have turned into gold. I wouldn't be surprised if her blood was golden as well." Lila then walked forward behind Diana and took out a pair of scissors.

Diana then yelled in pain as she heard a snipping noise and turned around and looked down at Lila who had cut off a piece of her wool and then placed it in a jar. "Lila." Grunted Diana rather crossly. Lila just smiled nervously. "Dr. Queen. I read about the golden fleece. According to legend, it has the power to heal all ills. Your wool could be used to develop cures for cancer better than any chemo. In theory that is." Diana let out a sigh. "Okay," said Diana. "You can use my wool for research, but you better not clip anymore than you need. I'm too obese to fit into any known clothes and I do not feel like showing off a sheered buttocks around the office. I'm a surgeon, not a hooker."

Lila then walked away as Diana rubbed her thick, juicy mouton booty. She looked into her makeup mirror and saw her teeth had even turned to gold. I hope Jim doesn't mind the fact that he's engaged to a sumo-sized ovine made of organic gold."
1122311222222222222212.title: Here Goes Mouton

11223112222222222222121.content:
Lila and Nora had taken Diana’s fleece to an appraisal office and the appraiser was looking at the piece of wool in surprise. “No doubt about it,” he said. “This is definitely real gold. But I’ve never seen literal golden fleece. I thought it was only a myth.” “I knew it,” said Lila. “That strange scarf must’ve merged with Dr. Queen and turned her hair and skeleton into pure gold. That is, if you can find a skeleton underneath all that blubber.” Nora was rubbing her chin as a sneaky smile appeared on her face. However, Lila had a more idealistic smile on her face. “If that truly is the golden fleece,” she said. “Then there’s virtually nothing that it can’t cure. I’m going to take this stuff to that patient who’s been in a coma for three months. If it wakes him up, we’ll know it’s the real deal.” Before the nurses could leave however, the appraiser stopped them. “Where exactly did you find that golden fleece?” Nora just bit her lip. “Well that’s simple,” she said. “From a golden sheep.” The nurses walked out just as the appraiser blinked. “That... makes... sense. I guess.”

The nurses were walking down the street and Lila held up the jar with the golden fleece. Nora was smiling rather fiendishly. “If this truly is golden fleece,” said Nora. “Then that makes Dr. Queen a living gold mine. I wonder if Stephan Warner even knew what he had on his hands. Oh man. Think of the possibilities, Lila.” Lila gave a smile. “With this fleece, the most incurable diseases will be a thing of the past." Nora just rolled her eyes. "Uh, yeah. Something like that." Nora begun to think to herself. "I just need to find a way to discretely sheer that giant sheep for all she's worth." Lila then realized something. "Uh, Nora," she said. "Exactly how big do you think Dr. Queen is going to get?" "What do you mean, Lila?" "Well," said Lila. "Last time we saw her, she was 20ft high and I'm pretty sure that she's still getting bigger, not to mention fatter." Nora gave a look of surprise. "Are you saying that we could be looking at a sheep as big as Godzilla?" Nora gave an evil smirk because she figured that that way they're be more gold for her to harvest. "Gee," said Nora. "I wonder how Dr. Queen is doing? Hope she's alright?"

- - - - - - - - -

Meanwhile, back at the hospital, Diana was walking down the hallway and the floor was cracking under her massive weight. However, Diana couldn’t determine whether or not her weight was due to actual obesity or due to her wool and skeleton being turned into gold. “Well this looks ominous,” said Diana. “If this keeps up, I’m going to have to retire early, due to not fitting in the hospital.” Diana then felt her horns. “Ewes don’t always have horns. Then again, magic doesn’t necessarily have to make sense.” Diana noticed that people were covering their eyes slightly as they saw her because of the sunshine reflecting off of her golden fleece.” The sheep woman bleated and then went to shade the window. As she did this, she heard a tearing sound and realized the back of her coat was ripping. She let out a sigh. “Pretty soon,” she said. “My eyepatch will be the only thing on my person that actually fits. I hope I eventually stop getting bigger.”

Suddenly Diana heard a barking sound and turned around to see a blind man with a seeing eye dog who just so happened to be a sheep dog. Instinctively the mutated doctor moved into the corner. “Sorry about that, Dr. Queen,” said the blind man. “Usually he’s not very chatty.” The man’s dog just barked again and Diana got on all fours as she blushed in embarrassment. “This is not doing much for my dignity.” Said the obese sheep woman out of pure frustration. That was when Diana heard her cell phone ringing and picked it up out of her pocket as the sleeve on her coat tore. "Darn! Hello. Oh, hi, Jim. Well, it seems like I'm gonna be late. Something really weird happened today. Oh no, the wedding is still set for June. I just hope you down mind (BAAH!)." Diana covered her mouth and blushed. "I'm sorry. That just came out."

- - - - - - - - - - - -

At that time in the medical laboratory, Lila had successfully melted Diana's wool down into a liquid medicine as Nora was watching. "Okay," said Lila. "Now to test it." Diana took out a jar of what looked like tainted sea water. "Be careful with that, Lila," said Nora. "That stuff is dangerous Crimson Fever. It's incurable." "Not yet." Lila dropped several drops of the melted golden fleece into the sea water and then it begun to glow before it transformed into cool clean water yet again. "Yes!" yelled Lila. "It worked." Nora just let out a scoff. "Seems like a waste of perfectly good gold to me." Lila just laughed at how the golden fleece was in fact the real deal. "There's no denying it," said Lila. "The myth of the golden fleece was all too true. This is amazing." Nora shook her head. "What's really amazing," she thought to herself. "Is that we have a living gold mine right under our roof." Nora let out a laugh to herself. "Get ready, Diana. It's sheering time."

However, as Nora looked into the hallway, she ran into something that made her grunt. "Hey!" yelled Nora. Nora then looked in surprise because what she had bumped into was one of Diana's thighs. Nora looked up to see that the golden sheep woman had gotten slightly bigger and her lab coat at this point had been reduced to a vest as the sheep woman was panting and sweating. "Oh," said Diana. "Hi, Nora." Diana looked down to see that the ground was continuing to crack beneath her. "Oops," said Diana. "No time to talk, Nora. I have to get to lower ground before I crash the entire hospital. Bye! Oh, and be careful to make sure I don’t step on you.” As Diana was walking away, Nora looked in awe because the sheep woman’s wool had managed to get even longer as she got bigger. That was it, Nora needed to find a way to make sure the sheep woman overflowed with golden fleece, all the more that could be harvested by a very greedy nurse.

Once Lila had left to tell Dr. Queen about her discovery with the golden fleece, Nora decided to dabble with some chemistry of her own. First she looked up ovine growth hormones and then she snuck off of work in order to meet up with somebody to pick up said hormones. She double checked the case before she spoke with the supplier. "Are you certain that these are real growth hormones?" "What do I look like?" asked the supplier. "A criminal. They're legit. Why?" Nora gave a smirk. "Let's just say that I found out that dealing with wool can be very profitable."

Back at the hospital, Diana was stuffing her face with jelly rolls and swallowing gallons of milk in order to keep her hunger under control. "This is one of the biggest drawbacks of a larger body," thought the giant sheep lady to herself. "I have to eat a lot more food. As if I wasn't large enough." While, Diana was busy, Lila ran up to her. "Dr. Queen! Dr. Queen!" Upon hearing her nurse, Diana accidentally swallowed an entire container of milk and coughed before she let out a bleat. "Lila," says Diana. "Don't yell. Remember, this is a hospital." "I'm sorry, Dr. Queen. I just had to show you the results. Your new wool has amazing healing properties. I liquidated the golden fleece and put it in a jar of poisoned water and in an instant the bacteria was gone." Diana smiled as she bit into another pastry. "That's wonderful. If there's any of the liquid left, please bring it to that patient in room 13B, the one sick with Chaga's disease." "Yes, Doc." Diana smiled and then caressed some of her wool. "Maybe this transformation isn't such a bad thing." Diana then looked into her iPhone and then red several articles that looked interesting. "My word," she said. "Giant Pegasus woman spotted? Texan sheriff transforms into colossal minotaur? Good grief, these transformations must be more common than I thought. That must be very traumatic. Note to self, Diana; set up support group for mutated women."
