In the medical lab, Nora had put the growth hormones together and was smiling to herself. "That curse is slowly making Dr. Queen bigger and woolier," she said. "But the bigger the sheep, the bigger the gold. Time for Dr. Queen to become even more queen-sized." Dr. Queen at the time was outside with her cellphone (cellphones aren't allowed to be used inside the hospital) and was speaking with Jim. "Yes," said Diana. "I cancelled my order from the bridal shop. But don't get overheated. I'm just retracting my order because the dress isn't going to fit me and I need to schedule... uh, yes, I did put on some weight. How could I gain so much weight so fast? Uh, you'd be surprised. Jim, how do you feel about sheep." Diana then shivered because Jim didn't answer in the way she wanted. "Okay, how do you feel about sheep without mint jelly." Before Diana could continue, the cellphone's battery ran out. "Ram it!" yelled Diana. "I mean, damn it! I knew I should've charged this thing before going to work."

At that moment, Nora had walked up to Diana and was holding up a glass of tea. "Some tea, Dr. Queen." "Thanks, Nora," said Diana. "I need it after the day I've been having." Diana took the tea and swallowed it, cup and all before letting out a grunt. "No offense, Nora, but that tea isn't exactly the best I've had." Nora let out a smirk because the growth hormones would soon take place. "Well, Doc, maybe you shouldn't eat the cup?" Before Diana could answer, the sheep woman bleated in distress as a strange sensation overcame her and her wool was growing at a rapid rate. "What the?! What was in that tea?!" Nora gave a smile but then looked in surprise because Diana was growing larger and larger. Apparently combining growth hormones with a curse isn't the best idea.

Diana let out a yell as the hormones took effect and the obese sheep woman's height reached....
11223112222222222222121.title: Gold Fever

112231122222222222222.content:
“Maggie,” said Darren loudly. “Hurry up with your makeup.” “I’ve got to get this right, Darren,” said Maggie in her British accent. “ Darren and Maggie Germaine were on their way to a medieval fair in town. Darren was dressed in a black knight’s outfit modeled to look similar to a scorpion fish, even with a fish-like decoration on the helmet. His wife, Maggie on the other hand was getting all dressed out. She had her whitish blonde hair worn with crimson highlights and let down and was wearing a silver tiara with a horn in the center along with a pair of silver earrings shaped like skulls. She was wearing a large pink and red gown like one a queen would wear, with a large collar, gold bracelets and ankle bracelets and she was just putting her makeup on.

“Maggie,” said Darren. “I still can’t believe you’re going as Morgan Le Fay.” “Why not?” asked Maggie. “Jarrod is going as King Arthur.” Darren groaned. Maggie was referring to her older brother. Darren didn’t care much for his brother-in-law and the two of them have been at each other’s throats since high school. “How a sweetie pie like you could be related to a crumb like him is beyond me. The even had the nerve to make him king of the fare. I think he only dressed as Arthur to get under my skin.” Maggie let out a sigh. “It always did disappoint me that you and I couldn’t get along. Oh dang!” Maggie then held up her dress as she ran upstairs. “I almost forgot.” Maggie immediately came back down with a strange ruby necklace with a black unicorn’s head symbol on the medallion. Maggie put the necklace on and Darren let out a laugh. 

“What’s so funny?” asked Maggie rather accusingly of her husband. “Morgan Le Fay was the most wicked sorceress in medieval times,” said Darren. “I can’t imagine her being associated with unicorns.” “You never know, Darren,” said Maggie rather smugly. “Morgan Le Fay had the power to transform into various beasts. Maybe she once decided that it would be a good idea to become a unicorn.” Darren rolled his eyes. “Come on, Maggie. We better get going or we’ll be late to the fair.”

 Maggie and Darren soon got into their car and Maggie was smiling as Darren drove the car. “You know, some say that Morgan’s beef with Arthur was because Arthur killed her husband.” “Watch what you say, Maggie. I don’t want you giving that jerk brother of yours ideas.” “The fact is,” said Maggie. “Morgan has been plotting revenge on Arthur ever since. Eventually she morphed into the form of Queen Guinevere and tricked Arthur into fathering her son, Mordred who...” Darren grit his teeth. “Could you please stop it. It’s bad enough you chose to dress as Morgan Le Fay in the first place. I don’t want you feeding your brother’s ego.”  Maggie just shrugged her shoulders. She was sure that Darren’s rivalry with her brother was going to ruin the fair. But what Maggie didn’t realize was that her medallion appeared to be glowing as the unicorn emblem on it let out a neigh.
112231122222222222222.title: The Fair's the Thing

1122311222222222222221.content:
Soon, Maggie and Darren had arrived at the medieval fair. There was upbeat violin music playing and jesters dancing as well as a man dressed in an old sorcerer’s outfit who appeared to be commanding miniature fairies that were most likely just fireflies. Maggie and Darren looked around and laughed at the sights, though Darren gave a grim look afterwards. “So, Jarrod challenged you to a joust, Darren,” said Maggie as she bit into a toffee apple. “Don’t get all worked up.” Darren just let out a scoff. “This time,” he said. “I’m going to bring your brother down a peg. He can’t push me around forever and I intend to put that pest in his place. King Arthur or no King Arthur, this time the black knight triumphs.” Maggie just continued to bite into her apple before she scoffed. “Just try to come back with at least one of your limbs. Maggie kissed Darren on the cheek and Darren blushed as he had to quickly wipe off the toffee.

The Germaines walked up and noticed the display for the Excalibur sword. “Bloody hell,” said Maggie. “If it isn’t old Excalibur.” Darren then gave a sly smile. He thought that this looked like a chance to get the one up on Jarrod. “Watch me closely, Maggie,” he said. “I’ve got this.” Darren tried to pull the Excalibur sword out but it wouldn’t budge and he was groaning as he tried to move it. “Come on. Come on.” Darren then had to stop and catch his breath as Maggie walked forward and effortlessly took out the sword with one hand as she continued to eat her toffee apple with the other hand. “I loosened it for you.” Said Darren. “Sure you did, honey.” Said Maggie as she patted her husband on the back. Darren let out a groan.

Soon, trumpets were playing and everyone had gathered into an arena. Darren was getting his horse ready for the joust and was polishing his shield. Darren’s brother-in-law, Jarrod, in his King Arthur armor, walked behind Darren and smiled. “Well,” he said. “If it isn’t Daryl.” “That’s Darren, Jarrod.” Said Darren in annoyance. Jarrod gave a smirk. “I still can’t see what Maggie sees in a blighter like you. You are so uncouth.” “We’ll see who’s uncouth when I literally knock you off of your high horse, Jarrod.” But Jarrod wasn’t exactly worried about his brother-in-law’s words. “In your bloody dreams. You couldn’t even get a hobby horse to do what you want, Darren.” As Jarrod laughed to himself, Maggie came forward and although nobody noticed it, she seemed to be taller and pudgier than before. “Jarrod,” said Maggie angrily to her brother. “I really don’t like it when you pick on Darren.” “Oh, come on, Sis. It’s not like I can help it. There is so much wrong with him.” Maggie then gave a glare and Jarrod let out a sigh. “I never did like it when you looked at me like that. Fine, I’ll try to try to go easy on him. I’ll see you at the joust, Derek.” Jarrod walked off as Darren was now angrier than ever. “Don’t listen to him, Baby,” said Maggie. “You’re gonna knock him dead.” Darren gave a smile but then as he got up, he felt his wife’s stomach and realized something. “Maggie,” he said. “How many of those toffee apples have you had?” Maggie gave a look of confusion in response.

 At that moment, the trumpets blared to single the start of the joust. “Here ye, here ye. People of Camelot, King Arthur will now face the evil Black Knight in a joust.” Everyone cheered as Jarrod came out and booed at Darren. “Shut it,” said Darren. “Have at thee, you demon in King Arthur’s form. I’ve come to vanquish you.” Jarrod gave a smirk as Maggie took her seat to watch the joust between her brother and husband. However, she felt her stomach slightly and failed to notice that her medallion was still glowing. Maggie looked at the medallion but shrugged her shoulders. “The joust will now begin!”

Both Darren and Jarrod’s horses let out a neigh as both challengers came at each other with their lances. Darren focused his lance and was going to knock down Jarrod but then he saw a flash of light and grunted. This left him easy pray for Jarrod to strike him and knock him to the ground with a scream. Darren fell into the dirt as everyone cheered, except Maggie that was. “Darren!” yelled Maggie. Jarrod got off his horse and stared smugly at his defeated brother-in-law. “Not one word.” Said Darren angrily. Suddenly, there was another flash of light and Maggie moaned. Everyone gasped as Maggie fell out of the stands. “Witchcraft!” yelled one spectator. “It’s Morgan Le Fay!” “Maggie?” asked Jarrod. “What’s wrong?” Darren then gasped as he looked at his wife and her pendant appeared to be glowing.

Maggie’s medallion let out another burst and suddenly Maggie underwent a strange transformation. She was getting bigger and larger. Her belly, thighs and breasts were all expanding at high speed and she appeared to be growing bright white fur over her body with a long curved red and pink horn grew out of her forehead right over her tiara. “Maggie!” yelled Darren as he watched his wife. Maggie’s feet then turned into hooves as she sprouted a long tail that was the same color as her hair with the exact same crimson highlights. Her ears stretched out and her face stretched into a snout as she gave a neigh. Once her transformation was complete, Maggie had turned into a 60ft tall white unicorn who had to weigh several tons had she been normal sized and sported a pair of H-cup (in scale) breasts.  Jarrod looked in fear at his younger sister and the entire crowd shared that look of fear. “Good grief.” Said Darren in shock at his wife. Maggie herself looked all over her equine body and then gave a smile. “I am Morgan Le Fay,” she said completely in character as the woman she was cosplaying as. “Queen of the witches.” It was then she let out a laugh that sounded like...
1122311222222222222221.title: Morgan Le Fay the Horse

11223112222222222222212.content:
Maggie’s laughter quickly turned into an evil-sounding cackle that caused everybody to look up in pure worry at the obese 60ft unicorn. “Maggie?” asked Darren. “Are you feeling okay?” Maggie smirked as her eyes glowed bright pink and she looked down at everyone below. “I feel excellent!” shouted the unicorn giantess. “Magical power flows through me. I have become among the most powerful of mystical beasts!” Maggie then reached down and tore a large tree out by the roots as everyone yelled and ran out of the way in fear. Maggie held up the tree and squeezed it. “The strongest elm is a twig in my hands!” shouted Maggie right before she dropped the tree onto the ground.

Maggie then raised a hoof into the air and brought it down hard, creating a minor earthquake that forced the people on their knees. “My mere footsteps shake the mother Earth, crushing the largest mountains like anthills!” Maggie waved her tail as several men dressed as knights held up their swords to her, but Maggie held her hand in the way, knowing full well that the swords weren’t real weapons and flicked her fingers to knock the legion away. “Entire armies are little more than swarms of insects to me.” Maggie gave a sinister sounding neigh as she appeared to be growing even bigger and heavier than before. Both her husband and brother looked up in concern.

“Darren,” said Jarrod. “Where the hell did you get that medallion for Maggie’s costume?” “Oh, so now you remember my name, Jarrod!? I have no idea! I didn’t buy that stupid necklace. Maggie bought it in some strange shop after she made the rest of the costume. It must’ve been enchanted and it turned her into a unicorn. A giant unicorn. A fat giant unicorn. And now she’s drunk with power.” Everyone at the fair bowed down out of fear of the enormous unicorn’s wrath as Maggie stopped growing. The unicorn woman had doubled in size and now had three chins with a 150ft wide belly and rear. The giantess sat her large and bloated ass down on the fair’s castle, using it as an improvised throne as she smiled wickedly and her eyes continued to glow. She smiled fiendishly at those that were cowering below.

"That has got to be an illusion, right?" asked one man dressed as a squire. "Special effects?" "I don't think so," said a man pointing to the hoof mark that Maggie left in the ground. "That's definitely a real giantess." "The end of civilization is upon us. Now we will truly return to the dark ages." Maggie could feel everyone's fear and it made her feel powerful. She scratched her own fat belly as she looked down at the people she had conquered. "Yes," said Maggie. "Yes. Tremble, you cowards! You are nothing more than bugs at my feet! Fearful for your lives that can so easily be extinguished, should I see fit!" Jarrod could not take his sister's madness any more and walked forward with his sword held out to confront the equine despot.

Maggie then noticed her brother approaching her hoof. “Maggie,” Jarrod said. “Enough fooling around. Did your brain fail to grow with your body? You’re acting like a maniac.” Maggie then glared down at her brother right before she picked him up and squeezed him. Darren looked at his wife in pure fear. He may not have gotten along with his brother-in-law but this seemed too much. “Silence, worm!” yelled Maggie. “I can easily devour you whole.” Maggie held her brother over the abyss that was her mouth to prove her point as everyone gasped. Jarrod looked down in fear and Darren was biting his nails.”

Maggie then turned to the rest of the fair and smirked wickedly. “People of Camelot,” she said. “The age of Arthur is over. Morgan Le Fay is in charge now and I promise you, medieval is going to be a lot more evil. Take a good long look at the man or woman next to you. They could very easily die not long afterwards.” The people were shivering as Maggie let out a very evil laugh. “Somebody has gotten a little too into their role.” Thought a woman dressed as a jester.

Maggie kept laughing evilly right before her evil laugh degraded into a playful and uncontrolled chuckle. Everyone who had previously looked at the unicorn giantess in fear looked up again in pure confusion. Maggie held her bloated stomach in pain as she continued laughing and Jarrod looked at her in shock. "Oh," said the unicorn. "If I had kept that up, I'd bust a gut!" Everyone stood back up as Maggie continued to laugh.

"What the hell?! It was all an act!?" "Lady, you have a sick sense of humor!" "Are thou insane." Darren let out a sigh of relief. Maggie wasn't corrupted by her powers after all. She was just playing a prank. "For crying out loud, Maggie!" yelled an enraged Jarrod into his sister's oversized ear. "You nearly gave me a heart attack there." Maggie continued to laugh and then coughed before she got up off of the castle that had been toppled by her colossal ass. She placed her brother on her shoulder before she picked up Darren and placed him on the other shoulder. “People of Camelot,” said Maggie. “Morgan Le Fay is feeling merciful tonight. Let the merriment commence!” Maggie let out a laugh as a couple of minstrels played music and the festivities resumed. Some of the fairgoers even laughed off the charade from minutes ago as Maggie gave a smile.

Darren crawled up and kissed his wife in the chubby cheek. “You really got them good, Honey. Even I was scared back there.” “Not as scared as King Arthur.” Said Maggie tauntingly referring to her brother. Jarrod blushed in embarrassment. “Okay, Maggie. You proved your point. I’ll leave Darren alone. But did you have to scare the hell out of everyone like that?! I mean, I thought you were going to eat me!” Maggie gave a scoff. “What do I look like, a cannibal?” Maggie then proceeded to devour an entire cart filled with caramel apples as Darren gave a worried look. “Uh, Maggie,” he said as he climbed up and felt his wife’s horn. “Do you think you’ll be turning back to normal anytime soon?” Maggie let out a sigh. “I don’t know. If anything, I might be stuck as a bloated Godzilla-sized unicorn for the rest of my life. But we’ll get used to it, Dear. For now, let’s enjoy the faire.” Maggie laughed again and Darren just shrugged his shoulders.
11223112222222222222212.title: Witchcraft and Unicorns

1122311222222222222222.content:
It begun online in a game world where a man dressed as a black knight was fighting against a creature resembling an obese raptor that was breathing fire. The knight held out his shield that had a scorpionfish’s face on it and tried to deflect the raptor’s fire. However, the raptor knocked the knight down with its claws and would’ve finished him off had it not for interference from another player in the MMORPG. She was a humanoid were-panda who was dressed as a jiangshi. The panda woman cast a spell that shrunk the raptor down to size and the raptor gave a hiss before the panda woman tossed a fan that pixelated the creature. The panda woman then helped up the knight and smiled at him. “Thanks for the assist Juliet.” Said the knight.

In the real world, the knight was a nerdy looking boy with curly blonde hair and glasses and also in the real world, the panda sorceress was really an Asian girl with long reddish brown hair worn in an oriental bun and ponytail. “That’s the seventh time this week I’ve had to save your butt, Yuri. For someone called ForeverKnight you’re not really invincible.” Yuri and Juliet were a boyfriend and girlfriend who got together every night to play the MMORPG Waves of Infinity. Both had been playing since high school and since they went to different colleges, they used the game in order to stay in touch. Yuri was currently in Massachusetts while Juliet was in Montana. Yuri was a level 85 lich knight called ForeverKnight while Juliet was a level 100 werepanda sorceress called PanicButton.

“Well,” said Yuri. “That’s another win for PanicButton. I still can’t believe you already reached level 100.” “Thanks, Yuri. I hear that spring break is in a few weeks. I can’t wait to see my boyfriend again.” “That’s right,” said Yuri. “I’ll be flying in to see you. Be ready for me.” Juliet typed up a smiling emoticon and would’ve wrote more when she got an e-mail saying that she had a package waiting for her at the post office. “Oh, I’ll be right back, Yuri I’ve got a package at my campus’s post office.” Juliet let her computer in order to go out and find out what kind of package she received.

- - - - - - - - -

Later, Juliet returned to her dorm with her package. From the looks of it, it was a very small package. Juliet opened the package and then looked in surprise. They appeared to be a pair of earrings designed to look like golden and purple shoots of bamboo. “Oh my gosh.” Juliet put the earrings on and took a photograph of herself with her phone before texting the message to Yuri. Back in Massachusetts, Yuri picked up his cellphone the moment he heard it ringing and saw Juliet wearing the earrings. “Oh my gosh!’ yelled Yuri in shock. “Are those.” Juliet gave a giggle. “They are, they’re real life versions of Longevity Bamboo Earrings, a very rare item in Waves of Infinity that only works for werepandas.” “That’s amazing. Does it say who they’re from.

Juliet just shook her head. “No,” she said. “In no way does it say where they came from or who sent them. The company must’ve sent then to me as a reward for reaching level 100. I’m keeping them.” “Do whatever you want, Juliet,” said Yuri. “You can even wear them when I come to see you.” Juliet shook her head but neither she nor Yuri noticed that her new earrings appeared to be glowing and her backside also appeared to be growing.
1122311222222222222222.title: Panda-Monium

11223112222222222222221.content:
However, Juliet was completely oblivious to the rate of her own growing behind and was eating a bowl of rice as she was speaking to Yuri on FaceTime. “So how’s everything going on in Montana.” “It’s going,” said Juliet. “Just aced my art history exam.” “Amazing,” said Yuri. “I wish I could’ve said the same about my psychology quiz. It’s hard to know exactly what’s going to be on the exam.” Juliet gave a laugh as she shoveled in more rice. However, Yuri adjusted his glasses because he noticed something shocking about Juliet. He noticed that she appeared to have black rings around her eyes.

“Juliet!” yelled Yuri. “What happened to your eyes?” Juliet just blinked her eyes. “What are you talking about, Yuri.” “Your eyes,” said Yuri. “They’re black.” Juliet let out a laugh. “I probably just forgot to take off my eyeliner.” Juliet just kept eating and Yuri noticed that her dress was coming unbuttoned. “Juliet?” asked Yuri. “Uh...” Juliet was now licking her bowel of rice as her cheeks were puffing out. “What is it, Yuri?” Yuri didn’t know how to say this but Juliet’s stomach was now bulging out and was almost touching her keyboard. “What is it, Yuri” Yuri didn’t know exactly how to explain what was going on to his girlfriend who had now sprouted a triple-chin. “Juliet,” said Yuri. “Maybe you should be more careful with the food?” Juliet just raised another eye. “Are you calling me fat?” she asked. Yuri mumbled and then tried to think of the right word but then gasped because Juliet was now chewing on her bamboo plant that was next to her desk and then he saw that Juliet appeared to have sprouted fangs.

Juliet let out a sigh and then she noticed her big belly. “Well,” she said. “I’ll admit that I’ve gotten a little rounder but...” Juliet tried to get out of its chair but she grumbled because for some reason, she couldn’t get her booty out of her seat. “Okay a lot rounder. But they don’t serve a lot of healthy food in the college cafeteria so I would appreciate it if you cut me some slack... ah!” Juliet fell back in her chair and there was a loud crash as she fell through the floor.

Juliet groaned as she got up and saw that she was indeed obese and naked. She looked and saw she had fallen into the dorm right below her own and then bit on her lip. “Thank goodness nobody’s home. Suddenly Juliet grunted and she started to grow bigger and bigger as she gasped. She felt herself getting fatter as well and the ground cracked beneath her feet as she then sprouted fur. She sprouted white fur all over her torso and face and black fur grew all over her legs and arms and she even sprouted a big black tail as her ears turned rounded and black as well. She then gasped and then she saw her stomach bulge out right before a purple Chinese-style sorceress’s dress appeared on her obese body as gold bracelets appeared on her left ankle and wrist and she obtained a Chinese-style tiara on her head. Juliet saw that she had transformed into a 17ft tall and 5 ton werepanda (or pandaren if you prefer). Her belly was 25ft wide with a 20ft wide butt and D-cup breasts.

“Oh my gosh!” yelled Juliet.” “Everything okay there, Juliet?” asked a very worried Yuri, still on FaceTime. Juliet was horrified. Could she show and tell what happened to her to Yuri? Should she? The literal giant panda girl didn’t know what to do.
11223112222222222222221.title: Of Pandas and Ponderous Sizes

11223112222222222222222.content:
“Jean!” yelled Hank. “Come on! I’d like to make it to the craft fair before they close today!” “You can’t rush perfection.” Said Jean down to her husband. At that moment, the redhead was still applying her makeup in the bathroom and brushing her hair. “Give me a break,” moaned Hank. “You always take forever with your damned makeup.” “You expect me to go out without preparing the perfect face?” asked Jean. “Hold your lasagna. I’m coming.” Hank shook his head. The bottom line was that his wife was the vainest woman he had ever met. She made a peacock look modest. The reason they were going out was because Hank wanted to buy a painting at the art fair to cover an empty space on the wall in the living room. However, Jean made it difficult. She believed that she was the most beautiful thing in the house and didn’t like anything that Hank chose.

After twenty minutes, the young woman walked down to her husband who was trying to pass the time waiting by cleaning his sunglasses. “Jean,” said Hank. “You always take too long.” Jean then shook her hips and flipped her hair as she smirked. “But it’s worth it in the end isn’t it, Hanky? You know, if you had just painted a portrait of me to place over the couch, it would save you a lot of frustration. Nothing in that fair will even come close to my level of perfection.” Hank rolled his eyes from behind his sunglasses. “Mom told me not to marry her,” he thought to himself. “Why didn’t I listen?” Hank then cleared his throat. “Come on, Jean,” he said. “We better get to the art show before all the good paintings are gone.” The Morrows were almost out the front door when Hank noticed Jean wasn’t following. “Jean?” he asked. “What’s... oh no!” Jean had paused in order to look in the mirror and tapped her chin. “You think I should go out in my red vest instead of this green one, Hank?” Hank slapped himself in the face and even looked like he was going to cry.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Against all odds, Jean and Hank arrived at the co-op. Hank was looking for a suitable painting while Jean was busy with her eyebrows. Hank held up a painting that depicted mermaids in a hot air balloon and a whale with a heart tattoo. “How about this one, Jean?” Jean gave a scoff. “Why would you want a painting of sirens when I’m all the siren you’ll ever need?” Hank let out a sigh and put the painting down. “You know, Jean. You could take interest in the paintings.” “I’ve taken note of the selection of paintings, Hank,” said Jean. “It’s just that there isn’t much there that catches my eyes. I’m the most gorgeous thing around here.” However, that was when Jean felt a tap on her back and turned around as she gasped.

Behind her was a man in a metal face mask and green rags that made him look somewhat like a Dark Ages wizard. “So, you two are looking for a painting? I recommend the mermaid painting. It’s the best work of art around here.” “Ew!” yelled Jean. “Get lost. This is an art fair for crying out loud.” Erlking gave a blush. “I was just trying to…” Jean stepped back and swung her hand at Erlking in order to scare him off.

“Ugh,” grunted Jean. “They’ll let anyone in here.” “Don’t you think you were a little hard on him?” asked Hank. “He looked down on his luck.” Jean let out a scoff. “Hank, there are only two reasons why anyone would wear a mask like that. One would be if he was a fugitive from the law but the more obvious explanation is that he’s got a face that’s meant for radio. He’s gotta be drop dead ugly behind the mask.” “Well, he did look somewhat old. He might have been really handsome in the past. Take you for example. You’ll be old one day and what makes you think your face will last forever.”

Jean was about to say something to confront her husband on his choice of words but then she realized that Hank had a very valid point. She may be beautiful now, but she was more likely than not going to be an old woman one day and there was no guarantee that her beauty would last. “I hate it when you’re right, Hank,” said Jean as she looked at herself in the mirror. “Thankfully I don’t have to worry about that for a long, long time. But still, I wish there was a way to keep my face young and beautiful forever.” Hank let out a laugh. “Well, while you’re waiting for the fountain of youth, I’m going to see about what kind of painting to buy. After all, unlike a woman, a painting can stay beautiful forever.”

However, what Jean and Hank didn’t know was that Erlking had overheard them. “I can do that,” he said. “She’s lucky I’m not the kind to hold a grudge. Time to work some magic. 1, 2, spell me do. Let this woman’s wish come true. Hear me loud, hear me well, let me be this spell!” With that, Erlking vanished into a puff of smoke. At that moment, an artist was holding a painting up for Jean and Hank to inspect. It was colored in gray and looked distorted. Hank took a closer look. “You know, Jean, this painting reminds me of your sister.” “Ha-ha.” Laughed Jean sarcastically.

Suddenly, Jean let out a scream of pure pain. “Jean?” asked Hank. “What’s wrong!?” Hank saw that ashes seemed to be coming from Jean’s body and Jean was in utter panic because it looked like she was disintegrating. However, as it turns out, as the ashes cleared, she was changing. Not only did she seem to be getting bigger and rounder, bright green feathers with black and white eye patterns like a peacock appeared all over her body as she sprouted a tail of bright green and white feathers. Her arms were turning into glowing wings that looked like they were on fire. Jean felt her chin sprouting a triple chin and then more ashes fell from her face and her mouth and nose stretched out into a golden beak as her legs turned into talons.

Hank looked up as Jean spread her wings and revealed her transformation. She had transformed into a 100ft high phoenix with bright green feathers, a 135ft wide stomach, a 150ft ass with thick thunder thighs, a pair of E-cup breasts and a large 200ft wingspan. Hank stepped back as Jean nearly stepped on him and all spectators looked in shock and even snapped photographs. “Oh my gosh,” said Hank in surprise. “Jean?!” Jean felt her obese stomach and butt with her wings and then shook her long tail feathers as she shrieked.
11223112222222222222222.title: Phoenix Envy

112231122222222222222221.content:
Jean looked back at her bright tail feathers and opened up her wings before she lifted her stomach up to get a good view of her talons. Hank was greatly worried and was expecting his vein wife to freak out. "Jean," said Hank. "Stay calm. Please don't blow a fuse." Jean let out a shriek and held up her wings as they set themselves on fire. "You expect me to stay calm?! Look at how FAT I am! And I'm naked!" Hank slapped himself in the face for that remark. "Really? That's what you're worried about!?"

Jean then looked at her ass that was 50ft wider than she was tall and then tapped it to make it shake. "Hmm," she said. "On second thought, big butts are all the rage today. I even hear bustles are coming back into style. And midriffs are in." Jean looked at her compact mirror but it was too small for her to even see the tip of her beak. She gave a scoff. "It should be a crime to make hand mirrors this small."

Jean then grunted because Hank pulled out one of her tail feathers. The feather was three times bigger than he was and was so heavy that he could barely hold it up. “Jean! Your weight is the least of our concerns. You’re a phoenix so big she could use Godzilla as a couch cushion.” “A phoenix?” asked Jean. Then Jean gave a gasp and then broke out in laughter that made her breasts and belly shake. She even twirled around and forced everyone to get out of the way of falling feathers. “Jean?” asked Hank in confusion. “Are you feeling okay?” Jean giggled and held her rear into the air and opened up her tail feathers as spectators looked in awe. “I’m feeling magnificent,” said Jean. “This is the answer to my problems. You see, Hank, a phoenix is forever young. At the end of their life, they burn themselves to ashes and then rise again, as young and beautiful as ever. I’ll never lose my beauty.”

Jean laughed as Hank slapped himself in the face. “Ugh,” he groaned. “Even as a giant monster, she’s as vain as ever.” Jean then noticed several artists had gathered their easels and from the looks of it, they were intrigued to see such an enormous green phoenix. Jean smiled and then sat down as she flipped her hair and then stared down at the tiny humans with easels. “Well,” she said. “What are you waiting for? You have a goddess in front of you. Let’s see if you can capture my otherworldly beauty on canvas.” Hank saw that everyone was getting out pencils, brushes and paint and he let out a sigh. Then he realized something. “Wait a minute,” he said. “Women don’t just turn into giant phoenixes Something must have happened to cause this.” Then Hank noticed something. “The man in the mask. He must’ve cast a spell on Jean.”

At that point, several artists had already begun to draw outlines for their phoenix paintings and Hank ran up to Jean’s left butt cheek and tapped on it to get his enormous wife’s attention. “Jean!” he yelled. “Jean!” Jean smirked down at her husband. “Like what you see, Hank? Don’t think I forgot about you wanting to buy a painting. I’m doing you a favor. Whoever can make the best painting of the new me, that painting, you will be able to hang.” “Jean! This is serious. I think you might be curse.” Jean let out a laugh. “I’m 100ft tall and I’m going to be beautiful forever. If this is a curse, I don’t want it to be undone. I prefer to be a phoenix.” “But Jean...” Jean then lifted up her husband and brought him up to her beak. “Listen, Hanky,” she said. “I’m going to make myself perfectly clear. I am going to stay this way forever. I already got used to it, so I expect you to do so as well.”

Before Hank could say another word, his giant, vain, avian wife, placed him between the feathery rolls of fat underneath her left breast. Hank grunted right before he was sandwiched by his own wife’s fat. Outside, Jean continued to pose for the artists below. She even heard tapping and noticed somebody building a sculpture. Inside the walls of flesh, Hank crossed his arms. “I am going to get that man,” he said. “She’s going to be impossible to live with from now on.” Jean for her part continued to be the muse to the artists below. Some were already ready to get to work while others were trying to wrap their heads around what they were going to draw or paint. One painter was unhappy with her position in front of the phoenix's giant ass and decided to move her easel to get a better view of the giantess she was painting.
112231122222222222222221.title: The Vain Giantess

112231122222222222222222.content:
Our story begins not on Earth but in space. In deep space where you will find the constellation, Capricorn. A meteor passed through Capricorn and was bathed in a strange star power. The meteor glowed as it was coming closer and closer towards the Earth and begun to break up before turning into a pure crystal shape of lapis before falling into an ocean below. This ocean was located in Hawaii and the meteor sank further and further down, releasing a strange energy into the water. The energy was so intense that all the surrounding fish chose to move out of the way and get as far away from the glowing meteorite chunk.

Down on the ground at the time there was a beach in Hawaii and there was a blonde haired Hawaiian girl with a pink flower in her hair taking photographs as her boyfriend drove their car. The girl let out a laugh. “Thanks for taking me out to the beach for my photography class in college, Keone,” said the girl. “I need to take a few pics of the ocean life for my project.” “No problem, Phoebe,” said Keone. “What better place to take photographs in Hawaii than the beach.” As Keone pulled up the car, the beach was buzzing and there were dozens of beachgoers carrying surfboards.

Phoebe just let out a whistle at what she saw. “Man,” she said. “There sure are a lot of surfers here today, Keone.” Keone was taking out his own surfboard and was waxing it as he smiled. “It’s a moon tide tonight, Phoebe. That means the water is higher than usual and in turn, the waves rise higher than usual. It’s going to be awesome.”

Phoebe then remembered something. “Keone,” she said. “Did you see anything unusual in the sky last night at 1:12 in the morning?” “Uh, no, Phoebe,” said Keone. “I was kind of asleep at the time.” Phoebe let out a sigh. “Well,” she said. “Last night, I saw the constellation for Capricorn, clearly visible in the sky. However, something strange passed by Capricorn. It looked like a meteor. Look.” Phoebe held up her camera and showed an image of the very same meteor that had passed through Capricorn but because of the bright light, there was barely anything tangible in the photograph.” Keone just looked at the photograph and then shook his head. “Phoebe, Phoebe, Phoebe. This could be anything. You might have even been dreaming. Now, if I remember, your project is on the deep sea, not deep space. Let’s just get you a rental camera and you’ll be ready to make something beautiful.”

Keone took Phoebe down to the rental shack and rented Phoebe a scuba suit with an underwater camera. “I won’t be gone for long, Keone,” said Phoebe. “I’m just going to take a few photographs of what lies below and then I’ll be ready to join you surfing.” “You better,” said Keone. “Waves wait for no one. Good luck, Phoebe.” With that, Phoebe kissed her boyfriend and then retreated into the water. As she swam down and begun to take photographs, that meteor from earlier was nearby and it was glowing bright.
112231122222222222222222.title: This Way to Capricorn

choices: She Retreats Back into the Water
She Panics and Rampages the Beach
1122311222222222222222221.content:
In the ocean, Phoebe was continuing to take photographs of the creatures she saw swimming by when she saw a glowing light and decided to swim closer. She noticed that the very same meteor that passed through Capricorn had landed in the area and was letting lose a beam of light. Out of curiosity, she swam up to the meteor and wound up being bathed in its strange light. “What is this?” she asked herself. “It’s amazing.” Suddenly, Phoebe grunted and then she felt herself in pain and then she gasped because gills appeared to be forming on her neck.

At that time, Keone was still waiting for Phoebe. “She sure is taking long to take her photographs,” said Keone to himself. “That isn’t like Phoebe to stay underwater for so long. You’d think she sprouted gills.” Keone then spotted several surfers running to the water and paddling themselves out as a rather large wave was coming forward. “Well,” said Keone with a smile as he held up his surfboard. “Waves wait for no one.” Keone let out a giggle. “Maybe if I’m lucky I’ll see Phoebe under the water.” Keone ran towards the water and then started to paddle out as he saw the wave coming and stood on her surfboard. “Here it comes.” He said with pride. However, that was when the waves suddenly became more violent and intense and knocked several of the surfers out into the water.

Keone tried to handle himself on his surfboard, but because the waves were so violent and fast moving, he could barely stand and wound up slipping as he let out a yell and fell with a splash into the water. He wasn’t the only one because the waves kept on coming and several more surfers slipped and fell. “What’s going on?” asked one young man. “A tsunami?” There was a loud noise that was a sonic boom from a megaphone. It was the lifeguard who was about to speak. “Attention all beachgoers,” he said. “Everyone leave the water immediately.” Keone saw everyone leaving the water and then looked back to see several fish and sea creatures moving around the water in a panic. “Usually when small fish get out of the way,” said Keone in worry. “It usually means that there’s a big fish about to rise up from underneath. And I’m afraid of whatever that big fish is.

Out from the water arose a rather frightening looking creature. The creature was exactly 50ft tall with a 60ft wide belly, D-Cup breasts, thunder thighs as thick as bell buoys, a 75ft wide butt and an udder as big as her head. Her upper body resembled a bright orange-furred goat with large curvy black horns and gills on her neck with a white underbelly. However, from the lower body, although she did have hooves big enough to trample cars, her legs were covered in the scales and spines of a pufferfish, complete with fins. The goat creature also had Phoebe’s hair with the flower in it and the same bird of paradise tattoo on her arm as the goat creature was screaming.

While the rest of the beachgoers were screaming and running the otherwise, Keone looked up and recognized the creature as his girlfriend and gasped. “Phoebe!?” Phoebe kept screaming as she looked all around her new form. She was now a giant and obese hybrid of a goat and a fish and as she stepped back she accidentally crushed a boat beneath her foot and she screamed. Keone walked out and this made Phoebe more nervous out of fear of crushing her boyfriend beneath her hooves. “Phoebe,” said Keone. “Don’t panic. I have no idea what’s going on but...” Phoebe yelled again and from the looks of it, she was going to panic.
1122311222222222222222221.title: Touch and Goat

1122311222222222222222222.content:
Our story begins in a library somewhere in Georgia where a timid young librarian was about to approach several rather unpleasant punks that were making loud noise. “Excuse me,” she said to the leader. “Could you please keep it down. This is a library.” The leader of the gang slammed a knife into the table and through a book. “Excuse me?” asked the young man. “You obviously don’t realize who you’re dealing with. We’re the Red Hot gang.” “Why don’t you show her some manners, Kitadai?” asked another member of the gang. Kitadai would’ve beaten on Lorelei with his brass knuckles but screamed in pain because somebody grabbed him by the wrist.

He then looked to see a big burly and balding man with a long light brown beard who looked like a biker. He glared at Kitadai as he stood between him and Lorelei. “Let me make myself clear, punks,” he said. “You treat my wife and her library with respect or I will bust your skulls! Understand?” Kitadai nodded his head and he and his gang ran off as Lorelei’s husband picked up the destroyed book. “It’s a shame,” he said. “Nay, it’s a crime. To ruin a perfectly good book just for kicks.” Lorelei let out a sigh. “Thanks for chasing out those hoodlums, Bubba,” said Lorelei. “I wish I had your backbone.” “You can’t let those creeps push you around, Lorelei. People like that shouldn’t even be allowed here.” Lorelei let out a groan.

“Hey,” said Bubba. “It’s not completely bad. You have me to keep the riffraff out.” “I wish I didn’t have to rely on you,” said Lorelei. “Who’d be able to protect the library with you working at that construction site?” Bubba shrugged his shoulders. “I could quit and become a guard. Listen, Lorelei, the thing about these vandals is that you need to show them who’s the boss. You show them who the bigger person is and they’ll leave you alone. Well, I’m off to work now, Baby.” Bubba and Lorelei shared a kiss before Bubba was walking away. “How a good day at work.” “And I hope you have a quiet day at the library. Remember. Anyone else gives you trouble, you show them who’s boss.”

Approaching the library at that time was one of Lorelei’s best customers. He was a young golden brown haired man with a strange demon-shaped ring on his finger who was reading the book, Moby Dick, as he was eating a sugar donut. The young man spotted a little girl losing a balloon and then made his ring glow and the balloon floated back to the girl. He smiled to himself and was going to finish the donut in his hand when a skateboarder passed by him and caught him by surprise. The young man accidentally bit his finger but even though he didn’t see it, he bled slightly on the book that he was carrying.

However, the young man just shrugged his shoulders and sucked on his finger as he saw Bubba walking away to go to work. “Hey, Bubba.” “Oh,” said Bubba uneasily. “There you are, Haruto. At least there’s somebody who respects my wife and the library among teenagers. Why are you sucking your finger? That’s so unattractive.” “I accidentally bit it when I was…” Bubba just stared at Haruto. “All I ever see you eat are donuts. You’re gonna get sick one of these days. How come you never gain any weight?” Haruto shrugged his shoulders. “It’s magic.” Bubba stared at the young man and they both had a laugh at what Bubba hoped was a joke and then they walked away in different directions. “Something about that boy isn’t right.” Said Bubba. What Bubba didn’t see was that Haruto’s blood on the book appeared to be glowing as he returned to the library with his book.

Inside the library, Lorelei was at the front desk trying to organize books and trying to repair the book that the vandals struck a knife through before Haruto startled her by ringing the bell. Lorelei screamed and then turned to realize exactly who she was speaking with. “Oh,” said Lorelei in surprise. “Haruto. I didn’t notice you there.” Haruto then held up the book. “I just came to return another good one.” Lorelei smiled. “I remember,” she said. “Moby Dick. The classics. So, will you be checking out any other books today, Haruto?” “Not today,” said Haruto. “I’ve got a date with my girlfriend tonight.” “I didn’t know you had a girlfriend. How exciting.” “Yes,” said Haruto. “If we’re lucky, we’ll end up like you and Bubba. Well, see you later, Lorelei.”

As Haruto walked away, Lorelei decided to take the copy of Moby Dick and put it away. However, Haruto’s glowing blood seemed to enchant the book as the librarian was taking it away.
1122311222222222222222222.title: Of Wizards and Moby Dick

choices: Try to Get Used to It
11223112222222222222222221.content:
As Lorelei was walking away with the book, she noticed something and gasped. Haruto had bleed on a page in the book. “Oh no,” she said. “And Haruto is usually so careful. I hate to fine him. He’s my best client. Oh well.” Lorelei then walked up to the adventure section of the library and walked down to where the books were kept in alphabetical order. She saw the M-N Aisle and walked inside as she was counting the books in a row. “Moa’s Last Day. Mobius Will. Oh, here we are, Moby Dick.” However, the bookshelf was very high and Lorelei let out a sigh. She went to get a ladder in order to put the book back where it belonged.

Lorelei took a few steps on the ladder but with each step, she appeared to have gotten heavy and failed to notice that he butt was now extremely swollen. By the time she was about to reach the top of the ladder, Lorelei slipped and fell because the ladder mysteriously broke and she screamed as she landed on her butt and made the ground shake. The floor even cracked underneath her huge rear. Several patrons of the library who were reading their books. The patrons looked to see Lorelei rubbing on her head before she gave a look of embarrassment and let out a nervous laugh. “I’m okay,” she said. “I’m okay. Nothing’s broken. Except the floor apparently. But that’s weird. I’m on a diet. Now calm down, Lorelei. Let’s just put the book back on the shelf. However, this time, for some reason, Lorelei didn’t need the ladder in order to reach the top.

“Huh?” asked Lorelei. “That’s really weird. Did I suddenly have a growth spurt?” Lorelei rubbed her head and then felt something on her forehead. She gasped and then water appeared to leak out of what looked like a hole on her forehead. Lorelei was so shocked, she was turning pale, pale white. But then she realized that that wasn’t entirely due to stress and started to laugh insanely as she tried to make heads or tails of what was happening to her. She tried to move out of the aisle between the bookshelves and then she saw that her butt had expanded to the point where she was completely stuck. “I get it,” said Lorelei trying to convince herself that nothing was wrong. “I’ve been working so hard. This is a dream. A very bad dream.

Lorelei tried to push her surprisingly much fatter body out of from between the book shelves but then she heard a ripping sound. “Looks like my butt just ate my skirt.” She sighed. However, it wasn’t entirely the fault of the librarian’s massive booty, but she had sprouted a large white tail like that of a sperm whale. Lorelei squeezed her way out and the patrons of the library looked at her in surprise. Lorelei looked down in just as much surprise because she saw that the patrons of the library were small enough for her to use as breath mints.

No, they weren’t small, Lorelei was just really, really big. She was now laughing somewhat insanely while crying at the same time. “This is all just a dream,” she said trying to convince herself that was nothing more than a nasty dream. “Nothing more than a bad, bad, bad, dream.” Lorelei then bumped a bookshelf with her butt and turned around to stop the shelf from falling down. In the process she knocked down a table with her tail and made a girl reading a comic book scream. Lorelei then grunted and felt her face as it begun to stretch out into a long cylinder shape right before scars appeared all over her body and she grew bigger and fatter as barnacles appeared on her face and flabby arms. “This isn’t a dream,” said Lorelei as she adjusted her glasses and watched as webs appeared on her toes and fingers. “This is a nightmare!”

By the time the transformation was complete, Lorelei was a 60ft high pure white sperm whale with an 85ft belly and ass and D-cup breasts. She opened her mouth in horror and spotted her rather sharp teeth. “What has happened?” thought the titanic librarian to herself. “Wait until Bubba sees this. He’ll have a heart attack when he finds out he’s married to… Moby Dick! I’ve somehow turned into Moby Dick. But how? Oh my gosh! Haruto’s blood! Bubba was always convinced Haruto was a wizard. Looks like he was right. Something tells me he doesn’t know how to turn me back though. What do I do?”

Lorelei was now faced with the fact that she was going to be stuck as a real life Moby Dick for the rest of her life. How will she react?
11223112222222222222222221.title: Moby Dick's Revenge

11223112222222222222222222.content:
Our story starts where a dark-blonde haired girl in dark blue glasses is driving her car to the beach. Her name was Darcy and she hated the beach. One look at the ocean made her want to vomit. She had crippling hydrophobia and normally, she would never even think about going to the beach. However, her boyfriend, Riven had just gotten a job at the beach as a lifeguard. She let out a sigh as she walked forward.

Darcy heard Riven blowing on his whistle. “No running on the beach!” he yelled. “Hey! Stop! That’s an easy way to drown someone, mister!” Darcy let out a sigh. Her boyfriend’s temper was as hot as ever. She almost dreaded walking up to congratulate him, but she summoned the courage and walked forward. “Hello, Riven.” She said. Riven turned his head and then spotted his girlfriend. “Well, well,” he said. “Darcy. I never thought that I would think to find you anywhere were there was water.” Darcy just let out a grunt and crossed her arms. “Well, Riven, I came to say congratulations on the job.” Riven gave a smile. “Thanks. You know, if you knew how to swim, then you could be a lifeguard as well.” But Darcy just let out a sarcastic laugh. “I don’t think so, Riven. Water and I don’t mix. I’m like oil. I don’t go well with… AAAAAAAA!!”

A large beach ball landed in the water nearby and splashed Darcy, causing her to scream and crouch while sucking her thumb. All the beachgoers in the area laughed at Darcy and Riven shook his head at his girlfriend’s fear of water. “Geez, Darcy,” he said. “Now that’s just sad. You’ve been running in fear of water for 15 years. I mean, when was the last time you bathed?” Darcy blushed and ran off as everyone was laughing at her. “I’ll show that jerk,” thought Darcy to herself. “I’ll show all of those jerks. But how? Just the thought of water makes me sick.”

As Darcy was trying to figure out what she was going to do, she heard somebody yelling. “Come on! Come on! It’s gotta be a whopper!” Darcy turned her head and then she spotted up ahead, something really strange. It was a man in green rags and a metal mask who appeared to be trying to fish from the side of a cliff overlooking the water. “You’re not getting away, you whopper! You’re gonna be Erlking’s dinner!” Erlking kept trying to reel his line in when he heard Darcy’s footprints and while he was distracted, his line snapped. Erlking would’ve fallen into the water, but Darcy grabbed a hold of him in order to stop him from falling but they both fell back.

“Oh, ratzafratz!” yelled Erlking. “My dinner got away.” Darcy shivered. “I don’t know how you could possibly eat fish. Anything that comes out of the ocean has got to be nasty.” “I’ll take your word for it, young lady,” said Erlking. “After all, I read somewhere that humanity’s ancestors crawled out of the sea.” Erlking’s stomach then growled, and Darcy soon found herself buying the strange man some fried clams. “Thank you,” said Erlking. “I guess I’m going to have to find some more string if I’m going to have a fish dinner for tomorrow, but this will last me through the night.” “You don’t look like somebody who eats often,” said Darcy. “Who are you?” “I’m Erlking. A wandering wishgranter.” “Wishes?” asked Darcy. “There’s no such thing as somebody who grants wishes.” Erlking shrugged his shoulders. “You know what they say: if wishes were fishes, we’d all have something to eat. And we would.” Darcy just continued to shiver. “I really wish you wouldn’t use fish as a euphemism. I hate fish. In fact, I hate the ocean.”

Erlking raised an eyebrow. Darcy let out a sigh. “I almost drowned during a storm when I was a kid and since then I’ve been too terrified to even step foot on anywhere that’s near a large body of water.” Erlking nodded his head a few times. “That’s completely understandable.” Darcy let out a scoff. “Tell that to my asshole boyfriend. Riven just became a lifeguard and he won’t let me forget about my fear. You know, Erlking. If you really are a wishgranter, then please grant me this wish. I wish that I was no longer afraid of water.” Erlking nodded his head. “You fed me, so I’ll just do it. Step aside.” Darcy did just that as Erlking was ready to cast a spell.

“I say, 1, 2, spell me do,” chanted Erlking. “Let this lady’s wish come true. Here me high, hear me well, let me be this spell.” Suddenly a strange raincloud appeared over Darcy and Darcy yelled and ducked as the rain came down on her and was even trembling in place as the rain came down on top of her. As Darcy was mumbling, the rain begun to glow and the cloud fizzled away just as the same thing happened to Erlking. Darcy stood up and saw that she was now surprisingly dry. She then shivered and held herself tight. “If that’s your idea of trying to cure my fears, Erlking,” she said. “It didn’t work. That was horrifying.”

Darcy shivered and then begun to walk away again. However, as Darcy was walking off, she didn’t notice that fish scales were growing on her butt.
11223112222222222222222222.title: Mermaid Malady

choices: She's Able to Crawl into the Water
They Need a Crane to Get her in the Water
112231122222222222222222221.content:
Darcy believed that Erlking had failed to cure her hydrophobia and as such, she decided to try and face her fears herself as she walked onto the beach. She saw Riven in the lifeguard tower and Riven held down his sunglasses as he looked at his girlfriend and gave a mocking laugh. “Aren’t you a glutton for punishment, Darc.” Darcy just gave a glare and shivered. She was walking towards the ocean but then she remembered all the strange creatures in the water. The thought of being in the same water as sharks, eels, octopi and stingrays frightened her. Then Riven tapped Darcy on the back. “You know,” Riven said. “It kind of helps if you know how to swim.” Darcy let out a grumble and then started to step back right before Riven held onto her. “Come on, Darcy,” he said. “You’ve come too far to turn back now. I can teach you.” Darcy grunted in Riven’s grip but then Riven yelled as he felt her ass. “Geez, Darcy. Did you sit on ice cubes or something? Your ass feels like a fish out of a lake.” Darcy grunted and then gave a glare at Riven but gasped and looked down to see scales had appeared on her butt. “Oh no.” She said.

Darcy got on her knees and then she grunted as her legs started to merge together as Riven looked in surprise. “Darc?” he asked. Darcy grunted as her legs merged together into the tail of a dark blue colored whale shark with white spots all over it. Darcy let out a scream and she started to get bigger and bigger as fins appeared on the sides of her head and her teeth became really sharp. She held up her hands to see that they had sprouted webs. “Help, me!” she yelled. All the lifeguards ran forward and saw Darcy grow into a huge 65ft tall (or long given she was flat on the ground) mermaid with an 80ft wide stomach and 75ft wide tail (being a mermaid she didn’t have anything resembling an ass).

Riven ran up in shock at his girlfriend as well as a crowd of beach going spectators. “What is that?” asked one of them. “A beached whale?” “A beached whale with blonde hair.” “I think we’re looking at a mermaid. “That’s what a mermaid looks like? I thought they’d be smaller.” “Hey, different fish come in different sizes, so why not mermaids.” “She looks bigger than the princess mermaid.” “This I’ve got to take a photograph of.” One young man even leaned up against Darcy’s bloated tail to snap a selfie while another sat on one of her boobs. “Cut that out!” yelled the mermaid giantess as she helplessly tried to flop around. This only caused people to take more photographs as Darcy gave an angry hiss and showed her sharp teeth.

Riven then decided to run up and wave his arms to defend his girlfriend from oogling onlookers. “You get out of the way!” he yelled. “How would you like it if I stared at your giant mutated girlfriend.” Everyone stepped back as Darcy groaned. “Darcy,” said Riven. “What happened?” Darcy let out a groan as she flopped about. “If you must know,” she said. “I made a wish to a creepy old man who told me that he could cure my hydrophobia. And to do so, he turned me into a creature that can’t survive outside of water. Dammit. So literal. When I see that Erlking again I’m going to…”

But then Darcy grunted because she could barely move. She was a literally fish out of water and was flopping helplessly on the beach. “Darcy,” said Riven. “Need some help? I mean, you probably weight 1,000,000lbs right now and you don’t have legs, so maybe…” Darcy was struggling as she moved slowly forward. “I’m fine,” she groaned. “I just need to inch myself to the water and…” “I’m afraid you might need some help, you stubborn fish. It would take a crane to move you into the water.” Darcy just gave a rather enraged grunt.
112231122222222222222222221.title: The BIG Mermaid

1122311222222222222222222212.content:
Darcy struggled and shuffled as she tried to inch her way to the water, but the mermaid giantess’s huge E-cup breasts kept her pinned down to say nothing of her large belly and tail. Almost instantly, Darcy became very exhausted and was panting heavily as Riven walked up to his girlfriend’s double-chinned face. “Darcy,” said Riven. “There’s no way that you’ll be able to get into the water all by yourself. If you were a skinnier mermaid it wouldn’t be a problem, but the fact is that you’re basically a beached whale.” Darcy shot a glare at Riven and tried to grab her boyfriend but he was out of reach and she was way too bloated to so much as move and as a result let out a pout. “Well, that’s just great. Stupid Erlking. When I get my hands on him.” “Uh, Darcy,” said Riven to his enormous girlfriend. “If you’ll pardon the expression, you have bigger fish to fry at the moment.” Darcy just gives a glare. She clearly did not appreciate Riven’s questionable choice of words. “I’m serious, Darcy,” said Riven. “If we don’t get you in the water soon, you’re going to die.” Darcy let out a moan because Riven was absolutely right. Without taking her immobilizing bulk into consideration, she was still a mermaid and therefore would be unable to move on land anyway.

Fortunately, Riven called the national seashore and they brought a crane in order to try and carry the giant and obese mermaid into the water. Darcy was grunting in pain because several buff men were attempting to push her into the tarp laid out to carry her into the water. One of the agents shook his head. “I hate it when whales wash up on shore. If you called us any later than you did, it could’ve been too late.” “Whale?” asked Riven. “That is my fiancée.” The national seashore agent just looked in disbelief. “You’re engaged to a whale? That’s really depraved.” “She’s not a whale you idiot! She was human this morning, but for some reason, she was transmogrified into a giant mermaid.” “Mermaid? That’s ridiculous. Mermaids aren’t real.” “What do you call me then, asshole?!” yelled a very annoyed Darcy. “How many whales do you see with sunglasses and long blonde hair.” The seashore agent dropped his jaw. “We better get out of the way.” Said Riven. Riven grabbed the agent and pulled him out of the way as the muscle team managed to budge Darcy and roll her on her back as she grunt and landed with a loud “BOOM!”. “She’s in the net, Charlie!” yelled one of the men. “Pull away.” The man in the crane pulled a lever and grunted. It took minutes before the crane could lift Darcy, simply because she was that heavy. The mermaid titaness could only blush and moan. “This is SO humiliating,” she complained. “This is not doing good for my self-esteem.” The crane drove forward as more spectators watched and took photographs. “Everybody who took a picture of me,” said Darcy as she grit her sharp teeth. “Had better stay out of the water. You do not want to piss off a mermaid the size and ten times the weight of an ocean liner.”

The crane then lowered Darcy into the water as she slipped out and then she let out a loud scream as the water touched her and flipped about, creating large waves that splashed everybody and made them run back, all except for two surfers of questionable intelligence who ran into the rising waves. “Outrageous!” “Dude, that fat mermaid chick is great to have around for surfing!” Darcy’s frenzied movements created several intense tsunamis as the agent from the national seashore looked in surprise. “What’s wrong now?” he asked. Riven blushed in embarrassment. “Darcy is kind of hydrophobic.” “Hydrophobic?! How can a creature that can’t survive outside of the water possibly be afraid of it?” Riven let out a sigh. “As a child,” he said. “Back when she was human, she and her folks went on a boat ride when a storm broke out. Darcy fell out of the boat and nearly drowned. She’s been scared to death of the ocean since. She told me she made a wish to cure herself of this problem, but if anything it’s gotten worse.” Riven then had to plug his ears as Darcy screamed loudly. “I hate water! I hate water! I HATE water!” Darcy’s tantrum created a large whirlpool that sucked the two idiot surfers in and made them fall off of their boards with a yell. Darcy then flapped her tail to slap the surfer’s out of the water and back on the beach. Both of them got up and spat out some sand before smiling. “That was outrageous!” the surfers yelled as they gave each other a high five.

Darcy was shivering as she swam through the water rather clumsily and was becoming more and more distant from the beach with every swing of her large and obese tail. “What is she doing now?” asked the seashore agent. “Don’t tell me that she can’t swim either.” Riven blushed in pure embarrassment at his girlfriend’s hysteric behavior. “I’d better go after her,” Riven said. “Who knows what trouble she’ll get into?” Riven immediately ran off to the lifeguard station and got on his wave bike before revving it up. It was probably not the most ideal vehicle to chase after an enormous fish woman, but it wasn’t as if time was on his side. “Don’t worry, Darcy. Riven’s coming.” Riven took off as he went to search for Darcy.

Darcy at the time was far out as she was swimming through the waves as she was shivering and shaking. “This is a feeling that I never wanted to feel ever again.” Darcy was remembering the night of that terrible storm and could hear herself screaming and her father calling for her. “Darcy! Stay where you are! Hold on!” In the present day, the mermaid was so stressed out that she looked like she would vomit and was shaking in place as her blubber appeared to be floating. Darcy let out a groan. “Not enough that I was turned into a mermaid but I’m also so fat that I could probably be mistaken for an island. Darcy then felt something pressing against her and she grunted. It was an enormous blue whale that was nudging against her tail and rubbing against her. Darcy let out a scream. “Hey! Hey! Hey! I’m not a whale! I’m a whale shark and I’m a mermaid! And I’m engaged!” The whale swam away as Darcy was shooing it. “Oh damn,” said the giantess. “I am engaged. But to somebody small enough to live in my belly button. How is that going to work? Hell, I don’t even know if we’ll be able to have... Oh good grief. Our children would be part fish.”

Darcy let out a sigh and then swam down to rest on a coral reef. “Maybe I should break up with Riven. After all, how would we make this work? I can’t live outside of the water and he can’t breathe underwater like I can now. Maybe out there somewhere there’s a giant sumo merman under the same spell.” Darcy then heard a rumbling. “What is that?! A tsunami? Riptide! Waterspout!” Darcy then looked down to see the rumbling was coming from her rather large stomach. “Oh man,” she said. “I need something to eat.” Darcy then saw a giant squid swim by and licked her lips. “Yum,” she said. “Calimari.” Darcy licked her lips and swam towards the squid with her mouth opened wide. Above the surface, as Darcy rose, she was slurping up the squid’s tentacles as her belly got even bigger and she appeared to grow huger as well, to the point where her shirt was finally destroyed and her breasts were free. The giant mermaid was now 100ft tall with a 150ft wide stomach and tail. She let out a large belch as she rubbed her stomach to digest the squid. “Delicious,” she said. “Although squid always gives me gas.” Darcy gave another belch as she was swimming forward. “Hmm,” said Darcy. “Okay. Maybe I don’t have to be afraid of water. Hell, since I’ve been turned into a giant fat mermaid, I better get used to the ocean.”

However, as Darcy was swimming, there was a yacht nearby and at the bow there was a sleazy looking man in a Hawaiian shirt who looked like he was in his late 30s and was on his cellphone. “I know attendance to the aquarium has been at an all time low. The cretins are just too stupid to care about the different types of fish. If we’re going to increase traffic we need something big. Something nobody has seen before. I don’t know! The ocean is filled with several strange creatures. Vampire squids, oarfish... What do you mean? Alright, so nobody has been able to catch an oarfish and keep it alive, but just you wait, I’ll find...” Before the man could finish talking, he spotted Darcy breaching in the distance. The man in the yacht looked in surprise and then put on as he watched Darcy moving around in the water. "A mermaid?!" yelled the man in the yacht. "An overweight mermaid from the looks of it! I better check this out!"

Meanwhile, Riven was still on his wave bike and was looking for Darcy. "Man," he said. "How can a giant mermaid with a titanic gut just disappear." Riven saw an island in the distance and then parked his wave bike next to the island before he took a closer look. The island looked small and devoid of any form of life. "Perhaps I can get a better idea where she is from this island. Riven climbed the island and felt that the ground was surprisingly soft. "What the?" Riven the stepped on something soft and round and saw a second island next to the one he climbed up. That was when he realized the "islands" were Darcy's breasts just as the chubby face of his mermaid girlfriend surfaced, as did her massive stomach that dwarfed her breasts. Darcy smiled at her tiny boyfriend. "Hi, Riven," the mermaid giantess said. "Fancy seeing you here." Darcy then lowered her head to Riven's level to give him a large kiss. But in the process, Riven screamed as he was sucked into the mermaid's mouth. Inside Darcy's mouth, Riven saw teeth as big as trucks and fish flopping around on the tongue right before Darcy spat him out. "What the heck, Darcy?!" Darcy just gave a blush. "My bad."

Suddenly Darcy heard something coming and turned to see a rather large boat. It was....
1122311222222222222222222212.title: Like a Fish to Water (Literally)

112231122222222222222222222.content:
There was never a dull moment in the Helder residence. For one, the patriarch of the family, Steve Helder, was a novelist who was brainstorming his latest novel as he stood at his laptop. “Zombies are too overused these days,” he said. “They’re even turning that wholesome book about that small town from the 1950s into a zombie apocalypse fiction. Perhaps I could jump on that train, but that would be too predictable. I know, I’ll make a werecreature story. I even know how to open it.”

Steve immediately went to work as his son, Verne walked up behind him. “Uh-oh,” thought Verne. “He’s gonna do something weird again, I just know it.” “Our story begins in the middle ages in Ireland. Here, we follow the story of the beautiful princess, Wendy Wallflower as she is transformed into a creature of the night. This is the tale of Princess Were…” Steve stopped to think before he noticed his teenage son behind him. “Verne,” he said. “What animals haven’t been getting much attention as werecreatures and are native to Ireland?” “Uh, I dunno. Beavers, boars, seals…” “Perfect. Princess Wereseal. This is gonna be great. Thanks, Verne.” As Steve kept writing, Verne shook his head. “I wonder what mom’s doing.”

As it turned out, Steve Helder had a wife named Wendy just like the character in his story, only she wasn’t a princess, she was a scientist and arguably a mad one, she was working in her lab on several unusual chemical elixirs. “Just a little more.” Steve and Wendy’s child daughter, Rosalind was looking around the corner to see her mother at work. “What are you doing, Mom?” Wendy gave a smile. “Hi, Rosalind. I’m finally perfecting Warmblood No. 11. You remember, that lotion that would allow humans to survive in cold temperatures without having to wear tons of ridiculous clothing.” Rosalind looked outside to see it was snowing. “You chose a perfect day to continue work, Mom, but who are you going to get to test that junk out?”

Wendy let out a laugh. “Well that’s where I come in.” Rosalind looked at her mother in pure surprise. “Mom?” she asked. “You’re not seriously going to use yourself as a test subject?” Rosalind then poured some of her concoction onto herself and rubbed it all over her skin as she took off her lab coat. “Well, what choice do I have, Rosalind? I don’t have any other options. Oh, darn, I’m out of nitro glycerin. Looks like I’m going to have to stop at the store. You and your brother stay out of the lab while I’m away, okay.”

While Wendy was getting ready to run her errands, Steve was still working on his story. “The princess set off on a quest to retrieve the stones of red fire that have protected her kingdom for ages,” said Steve. “She said farewell to her beloved right before she set off on the quest.” As Wendy was walking out, she stops to kiss Steve. “I’m off to the store, Steve. Good luck with your writing.” Of course, Steve was so immersed in his work that he was completely oblivious as to what his wife had just said.

Steve was writing up a storm while Wendy was busy with the groceries. “The princess eventually came upon an old witch sore in the head with a rather painful hangover.” At that exact moment, Wendy was walking out of the store with her groceries when she noticed an old woman with a crooked nose and a wart-covered cheek. She was dressed in black with striped stockings and a flower in her hat. In other words, she looked almost EXACTLY like a witch. She was moaning and from the looks of it. She was hungover.” “Oh,” said Wendy as she snapped her fingers. “Sounds like a perfect chance to test out those hangover pills I’ve been working on. Excuse me, ma’am.” Surprisingly Wendy’s misadventure was going much like in Steve’s story.

Steve continued to write as Verne was overseeing him. “Seeing the witch in such a state,” said Steve as he continued to write. “The princess offered her a potion that instantly cured her. As thanks, the witch cast a spell on the princess so that she would turn into a great beast that would ward off evil spirits. A wereseal.” Verne raised an eyebrow at what his father was writing. “Okay,” said Verne. “Probably not the weirdest thing you’ve ever wrote, Dad.”

“And the spell,” said Steve. “Would see to it that she would turn into a wereseal whenever there is a full moon. Hmm, full moon. That sounds too cliché. Aha. I know the perfect twist. She would become a wereseal every time there was a full moon on Jupiter.” “Jupiter?” asked Verne. “But, Dad, there are 63 moons on Jupiter.” “That’s where the twist comes in,” said Steve. “With 63 moons, there will be a greater chance of the full moon.” At that time, Wendy, not aware of her husband’s writing was walking back into her car, not realizing that her face was changing form and her nose now resembled that of an elephant seal’s. She had also gotten noticeably fatter and taller and had a huge blubbery tail like that of a seal. Jupiter was in the sky overhead as the snow was coming down.

She simply took her groceries into the car and started to drive off, not even noticing in the rearview mirror that she was turning into a giant and obese selkie. “It would appear that the Warmblood No. 11 formula works perfectly. I haven’t felt a chill since I came from home. I wonder how Steve’s novel is coming along.”
112231122222222222222222222.title: Wereseal of Approval

choices: He's Surprised and Goes After Her
1122311222222222222222222221.content:
Back at the Helder residence, Steve was still trying to think of what to type. “63 full moons. Perhaps Verne was onto something. This is gonna be tough to beat. Aha. Princess Wereseal herself did not believe in the witch’s blessing and shrugged it off, not realizing that she was slowly turning into a wereseal, a type of Fay. However, the witch’s drunken state meant that she had not thought her magical spell all the way through. The princess retrieved the red fire stones only for her steed to collapse under her much bigger form as she was starting to walk back.”

Meanwhile, Wendy, now an elephant seal-based wereseal had car trouble for her car broke down under her weight. The seal woman, still oblivious to what she had transformed into, waddled out of the vehicle and inspected the damage. “Oh, damn. My car just died. Oh well, I’ve had this car since I was a teenager. Guess it’s time to junk it. I’ll just call a tow truck.” While Wendy was talking on the phone, there was a middle-eastern man driving down the street with a truck filled with carpets. At home, Steve was further typing his story. “Fortunately for the princess, a genie appeared on a flying carpet and offered to return her to her kingdom. The dragon who watched over the Fire Mountains was about to open his eye and the genie was afraid that the dangerous creature would see an intruder in his mountain range."

The carpet salesman saw Wendy in the street and was slightly surprised to see a large wereseal, but for whatever reason, he decided not to question it. "Hey, Lady, need a lift." Wendy gave a smile. "That's very neighborly of you." Wendy squeezed her huge body into the truck, not realizing that she was taking up a lot of room and her blubbery body was pressing against him. "There's got to be a hidden camera around here somewhere," said the carpet salesman. "Uh. It must be nice to have such a thick suit in this cold weather." Wendy was confused and then came to the wrong conclusion. "Oh, you mean my lab coat? Actually my secret is that I'm testing out a special formula that will allow us to survive in the cold without having to bundle up." "Well," said the salesman. "I think it worked better than you thought." The salesman begun to think to himself. "Oh boy," he groaned. "That's gotta be the sixth mad scientist I've picked up all week."

Back home, Verne and Rosalind were watching television when they saw a news report. "There have been reports of a giant snapping turtle-like monster spotted in the San Francisco area. Local pizzeria denies involvement with this alleged creature." Said the anchorwoman on the television. Verne rolled his eyes. "A giant snapping turtle created by magic pizza," he said. "Maybe Dad should write about that next when he's done with Princess Wereseal." "Get a life, Bro," said Rosalind. "It's been done. Hmm. Mommy's been gone longer than usual." "You said that she went to buy nitro glycerin from the store," said Verne. "She can't be speeding down the street with nitro in her shopping bag. That's asking for trouble." Verne and Rosalind then heard the sound of the carpet salesman's truck and walked to investigate. They were surprised to see a truck carrying carpets near the driveway. "Did Dad buy a new carpet?" asked Rosalind. Verne shrugged his shoulders. "I guess. Maybe it's inspiration for the Department of Flying Carpets. He's been putting that story off for some time."

The kids walked out and then they looked in surprise as their mother came out of the car. They looked up to see that the wereseal woman was now 20ft tall with an 18ft wide and 20ft wide tail and a 30ft wide belly. The kids looked up and recognized their mother's red hair on what initially appeared as an enormous elephant seal. "Mom?" asked Verne in surprise. Wendy still hadn't noticed her transformation as she waddled up towards the house and waved to the carpet salesman. "Thanks for the ride!" yelled the seal woman. The carpet salesman waved and drove away before he took out his cell phone to speak with his wife. "Rihana. You're never going to guess who I drove home this time. Yeah, the samurai was the weirdest one, but this one puts him to shame."

Wendy was waddling blissfully up to the steps of her house where her children were waiting for her and were looking up at her in surprise due to her rather unusual appearance. "Hi, kids," said Wendy. "What are you two doing outside dressed like that? You'll catch your death of cold. And no, I'm not going to inject either of you with Warmblood No. 11 until I'm sure I've got the bugs out of it." "Uh," said Verne. "Mom. Have you noticed something different about yourself today?" Wendy didn't know what her son meant, but she decided to humor him and reached into her now much larger cleavage to take out a makeup mirror and then she looked into the mirror in order to see what Verne meant. As she looked in the mirror she screamed. "Oh my gosh. That formula of mine got rid of my freckles. What a weird side-effect."
