Devon stopped the car near a woodland area and the two of them went out to find Owlman. Devon held up a large camera that had a flashlight attached to it to scan for Owlman.

"It is said that Owlman is named after a villain who appeared in DC comics only a little more than a decade before this creature was discovered. While the Owlman in DC comics was a ruthless villain from another world, we do not yet know whether or not this Owlman is malicious as well. Since nobody has ever reported a homicide committed by this very being, it's entirely possible that Owlman is a frightening but misunderstood creature, not unlike the gentle Nessie." Devon then shook his head, assuming that he saw absolutely nothing. "I don't like the look of these woods, Harriet. Maybe we should turn back." "Turn back?" asked Harriet. Devon shook as he heard deep hooting. "Now, now, Harriet. It can't be. The largest owl in the world is the great gray owl and even then, its length's maximum isn't even three feet large." What happens now?

Harriet grabbed her head in pure surprise. “No!” she thought to herself. “I’ve... I’ve lost my voice! I've lost my voice! Owlman held himself in pain and then gave a hiss before weakly flapping his wings and flying further and further up into the air, albeit weakly due to his wings being damaged in the process.

As Devon was walking away, he could've sworn that he heard Owlman cursing him as he was flapping away and growling underneath his bread. "She will be mine. My spell may have erred, but the transformation is complete. I'm the one who will have her in the end." A chill ran down Devon's spine and he was in pure horror. "Okay," he said. "That is hands down, a dozen kinds of creepy. I have seriously got to find my wife. Harriet, where are you.” Devon was about to run back to the RV in order to continue his search for his giant owl wife but then he saw the completely damaged car up ahead and realized that he seriously needed to rethink his options. “Blast. Looks like I’m going on foot. I just hope my wife is alright.”

Harriet at this point was flying over the countryside of Cornwall and was flapping her wings so heavily that the foliage was blown off of several trees. She was panting as well from flapping too hard and panicking. "I need to rest," thought Harriet to herself, having lost her ability to speak. "I have to find a place to roost." But before the owl woman could further worry about her missing husband, she heard a loud and very violent rumbling noise. "What was that? An earthquake?! Can't be. I'm too high up in the air to feel any kind of earthquake. Unless..." Harriet felt the rumbling again and looked down at her big bulging gut that at this point was obscuring her thunderous thighs that in turn made her feet look unearthly small.

"So that's it. I'm starving. I need something in my tummy. Come to think about it, I haven't had anything to devour since breakfast. I definitely need to find something to eat. Thank goodness owls aren't that picky about what they eat. Oh, my stomach feels like it’s on fire. I need a meal." The owl woman hooted again and then zoomed away, hoping to find something she could use to satisfy her monstrous hunger. As she was flying away, she shed feathers that were as big as canoes and these feathers dropped down into the ocean as she flew over the seaside. However, food wasn’t the only thing that was on Harriet’s mind at that moment. She grunted because there was a ringing in her ears, something that was very painful for a creature with sensitive hearing like that of an owl. “You will be mine. You will be mine. There is no fighting it. I knew it from the moment I saw you. It is destiny."

The owl titaness could not take this any longer and then shook her head as she shrieked. "Harriet," thought the giant woman to herself. "Don't you dare think about that. You just need to get something to eat, find your husband and get out of the woods before something worse happens." Speaking of Devon, Harriet's husband at the time was looking around for his ginormous mutated wife. "Harriet!" he yelled. "Harriet! Where are you!?" Devon held his flashlight into the air and he saw nothing. He let out a moan because he was becoming very worried. "Exactly how does an owl as big as a jumbo jet just disappear? She should be easy to find at night after all. I do hope I find her."

That was when Devon heard a shriek and looked up. "Harriet!" he yelled. Harriet had flown overhead but it didn't look like she saw Devon because she just kept flying. Devon ran after his wife and saw that she was indeed flying...
11223121222212.title: Owl Bewildered

1122312122222.content:
"You're overreacting, Puck," said Elisabeth as the African American woman followed her dwarf husband into the woods. "If you didn't want to go camping, you should've told me." "But Elisabeth," said Puck. "I've really found something awesome. Something that belongs in a museum." It was always like this. Elisabeth's husband worked at the museum of natural history and was always looking for something that could fit in with the rest of the museum. He was the type of person who would see giants when there were only windmills.

Elisabeth was used to this by now and took it with a grain of salt but she could tell from Puck's excitement that he had found something that was simply amazing. Puck led his wife deep into the forest to what looked like a cave. Puck could run in easily but his seven-foot tall wife let out a grunt because she had to get on all fours to come in. "This is why my parents warned me against marrying somebody less than half my height." Once both husband and wife were in the cave, Puck led Elisabeth to something that made her eyes pop out of her head.

It appeared to be a graveyard of bones of elephants from the shapes of the tusk. But some bones looked strange. There was one elephant skull with buck teeth, a long snout and barely a trunk at all, while another had tusks on the chin rather than in the mouth and another skull still had four tusks. "What is this place?" asked Elisabeth as she stood up. "Isn't it obvious?" asked Puck with a laugh. The fair skinned dwarf even walked up towards a skeleton that was perfectly in tact. "It's an elephant graveyard. There's nothing else that it could be.

"That's impossible," said Elisabeth as she picked up one of the bones. "Elephants aren't even indigenous to America." "But their ancestors are," said Puck. "This is the find of the century. Maybe prehistoric pachyderms went to die in cemeteries just like modern elephants do." Elisabeth picked up her husband and then shook her head. "You're getting in over your head again, Puck," she said. "I don't think disturbing an elephant graveyard is such a good idea. What if there's a curse." Puck rolled his eyes. "There you go again, Elisabeth," he said. "Why must you always look at the dark side. There's no such thing as curses." "Even still," said Elisabeth. "We probably shouldn't be here."

As Puck and Elisabeth were leaving the cave, Elisabeth suddenly twitched. She didn't see it but there was supernatural energy coming out of the elephant bones. "Something wrong honey?" asked Puck. "Uh," said Elisabeth. "No, I'm perfectly fine." That's what she thought, but what Elisabeth didn't see was the spectral energy from the bones was entering her body.
1122312122222.title: The Elephant Graveyard

"You can't put a graveyard in the museum, Love," said Elisabeth. "It just sounds disrespectful to me. My ancestors believed that it was bad luck to desecrate an elephant graveyard. Oh, my stomach hurts. I'm gonna go get some water for the tea kettle."

Elisabeth went out to the lake as she held up the tea kettle. As she walked away, Puck could only stare at her. Puck knew that his wife had always towered over him what with her having gigantism and him being a dwarf but for some reason, Elisabeth seemed bigger than usual as she was as tall as a tree that she passed.

As Elisabeth reached the lake, she looked into the water and felt her face. "Oh my gosh," she said. "Is my nose getting bigger?" Elisabeth started to refuel the tea kettle but then she started to directly drink the water as if she was some kind of animal. "Elisabeth?" asked Puck. "Are you putting on weight?" "What was that?" asked Elisabeth. She felt her rear to learn it had expanded to seven feet wide and was still growing to saw nothing of her hips and her belly. Elisabeth then felt her face and it wasn't long until she felt her ears getting wider and wider. She even felt what looked like tusks forming at the sides of her mouth. "Oh no!" she yelled.

Elisabeth was not only getting fatter, but bigger. As she was transforming, she had passed the 25 foot margin and looked down at Puck as her nose started to turn into a trunk. "Puck," she said. "I really think we should've left that elephant graveyard alone." Puck could only watch as his wife turned into a 40-foot tall....

Elisabeth's trunk stretched out and she let out a trumpet as she even sprouted tusks. She had reached 40 feet high while her belly and butt each reached sixty-feet wide with two thirty-foot wide breasts. Her skin changed a reddish pink color as her ears stretched fully out. She let out a trumpet as her feet became flat pachyderm-style feet. It was there, Elisabeth had fully transformed into a 40-foot tall, anthropomorphic elephant, an African elephant to be precise because she had a pair of really long tusks. Once the transformation was complete, Elisabeth was left in her underwear and a tattered shirt that was acting as an improvised bra.

Puck looked up at his giant elephant wife and gasped. "Elisabeth?" he asked. Elisabeth gave a trumpet as she walked around, each of her steps creating a slight earthquake. She was as big as the trees and she looked back to see how large her ass had swelled up to. "Oh my." She said. "Elisabeth!?" yelled Puck. "Elisabeth!" "You don't have to shout!" yelled Elisabeth at her husband. "Elephant ears, remember?" Elisabeth lowered her head and used her trunk to lift her dwarf husband up into the air. "Elisabeth," said Puck as he was placed next to his giant wife's ear. "I am so sorry. I was the one who found that elephant graveyard. It must've been cursed! I'm such an idiot! Boy, is your dad going to skin me alive. He hates me enough as it is." "Puck," says Elisabeth. "This isn't your fault. Who on Earth could've predicted something like this happening?" "Although," said the giant pachyderm woman. "I really don't like this predicament. You were already less than a third of my height before. Now look at me. I could handle being an elephant, but why am I..." Suddenly, Elisabeth realized that she was slightly taller than the trees. "What?" she asked. "I thought I was only 40-feet high. Don't tell me I grew again?" Puck then gasped. "There must've been ghosts of elephants past in that graveyard and they all entered your body and mutated you." "Holy Joseph Merrick," said Elisabeth. "How the hell big am I going to get." "I don't know, but we'll get through this baby," said Puck as he stroked one of his wife's tusks. "I promise you. Worse comes to worse, we'll find jobs in the circus. Don't worry your pachydermic head over this." Elisabeth just let out a trumpet and a sigh as she sat down and flattened a few trees in the process. "My mother told me there would be days like this." "She did?" "Well, not exactly like this, Puck. That would be ridiculous."

Suddenly there was a rumbling sound and Puck had to return into his wife's ear, stepping in some wax in the process as he grunted. "What the heck was that?" asked Puck. Elisabeth stood up and the rumbling continued as she held her stomach in pain. Clearly now that her body was much bigger and an elephant, she was now feeling an intense and very heavy...

After that was over, she swam completely under the water with Puck on top of the tip of her trunk that was above the water.

"Well," said Puck. "At least she's making the most out of her transformation." Elisabeth surfaced out of the water and shook herself off before laughed and shifting her ear and hairs. As Puck stood on his wife's trunk, he got a good view of the elephant titaness's gargantuan ass and breasts. "Maybe I like her better this way." Puck thought to himself. Elisabeth was laughing as she sprayed water all over herself and Puck when suddenly her ears twitched and she heard something, something that sounded like stomping. She froze and turned around. We were the only ones who found that elephant graveyard and even if that was so, there couldn't..."

But Puck was about to be proven wrong. He was about to be proven very, very wrong because there was something stomping towards them and knocking down several trees. Whatever was coming was the same size that Elisabeth was currently and from the shadow they were just as obese. Then she looked in absolute surprise because the creature looked similar to her current state from the shadow. That was when Elisabeth looked and saw a tree crushed beneath the creature's padded pachyderm-like feet. "Oh my gosh." Muttered Elisabeth.

She also looked slightly younger than Elisabeth. At least 20-years of age. The mastodon girl appeared to have long tusks as well as freckles on her face and bright green eyes. From the looks of it, she wasn't naked like Elisabeth was, but was wearing a pair of tattered khakis and a black bra that probably used to be a black tank top. The mastodon girl let out a trumpet as she approached Elisabeth who stood in caution and then started to sniff Elisabeth.

Puck crossed his fingers hoping that this mastodon giantess wouldn't cause any trouble for his elephant wife. What are the mastodon girl's intentions?

choices: Tin Punk the Poacher at Her Feet
A Forest Fire in the Distance
112231212222212.content:
Elisabeth had turned into a ginormous woolly mammoth. She was 40ft tall with a 60ft wide stomach and 80ft wide ass that was eating her jeans alive as bluish black fur, the same color as Elisabeth’s hair had grown all over the young woman’s body. Her nose had stretched out into a 50ft long and 10ft wide trunk and she grew two large and curved tusks. The mammoth woman let out a trumpet as she looked at her new body. Puck looked up at his mutated and ginormous wife in absolute surprise and horror. “What have we done?! Wait! How could this have happened?!” Elisabeth let out a trumpet that blew Puck right off of his feet. “This is exactly why we should’ve left that elephant graveyard alone! My ancestors were right about the desecration being bad luck.” “What desecration, Elisabeth!?” yelled Puck. “All we did was walk inside and... what am I saying. This is not good. Elisabeth, I don’t think that there’s any way to get you back to normal.” Elisabeth trumpeted angrily and then uprooted a tree with her trunk as Puck looked up in fear and screamed. “Now take it, easy, Elisabeth! I may have hurt you, but that was an accident! I’m your husband for crying out....”

Before Puck could finish his sentence, Elisabeth stuffed the tree into her big mouth in order to chew off the leaves before she let out a sigh. “I know this isn’t your fault, Puck. But for some reason the graveyard chose to transmogrify me and me alone. If we just stay calm then...” Suddenly, Elisabeth’s stomach begun to rumble again and she started to devour a few more trees. Puck let out a sigh. “As if you didn’t tower over me already.” “Don’t flatter yourself, Puck,” said Elisabeth. “I still can’t believe this is happening. Ugh. And I’m so hungry that it’s making me sick.” Puck could only watch as his wife stripped tree after tree of its foliage. However, some of the foliage wound up getting stuck in the mammoth giantess’s nose and then she sniffled and grunted. Puck looked up in horror because he knew that his giantess wife was about to sneeze. “Oh no! Oh no! Oh no! Elisabeth! Don’t even think about it! Whatever you do, don’t blow your....!” But it was too late because Elisabeth let out a mighty sneeze that blew Puck across the forest screaming. “Oh no!” yelled Elisabeth. “Puck!”

Fortunately, Puck landed softly in an oak tree on the other side of the forest. The dwarf let out a sigh. “That is one deadly nose that Elisabeth has on her.” Puck then struggled because he was trying in vain to untangle himself from the tree. “Well, this is just great.” As Puck was trying to get free, a young forest ranger walked underneath the tree and noticed him. “Uh,” said Puck. “Hello.” The forest ranger looked in surprise but then climbed up and freed Puck from the vines. “Thanks,” said the dwarf reading the ranger’s uniform. “Uh, Ronald.” “Not a problem. But one question though; What on Earth were you doing up there so late at night?” asked the ranger. Puck didn’t really know how to explain what happened. “Well, my wife sneezed me up here.” “Your wife?” asked Ronald. “She must have serious allergies.” Puck then looked around and saw that he was on the other side of the forest. “Uh-oh,” he said. “Uh, you wouldn’t have happened to see my wife, have you?” “I don’t know,” said Ronald. “What does your wife look like?” Puck bit his lip. “A woolly mammoth.” He said under his lip. Ronald raised an eyebrow. “What?” “My wife is a woolly mammoth,” said Puck. “We found an ancient mammoth graveyard in a cave and it cursed her into a giant mammoth with a big appetite.” “I see,” said the forest ranger twirling his finger at the side of his head. “You’ve obviously been in that tree longer than I thought. I better take you back to the station.

- - - - - - - - - - -

At the other side of the forest, animals were moving out of the way as the ground was violently shaking with every step that Elisabeth took. She sniffed the air with her long trunk and trumpeted. From the looks of it, Elisabeth was twice as big as she was before and had gotten just as fat as well to the point that her jacket had torn off, leaving her wearing a tank top that only covered the tops of her breasts and her jeans had split in the back, revealing her bright red panties. But Elisabeth didn’t seem to notice how much bigger she had become because she had to find her husband. “Okay, Elisabeth,” the woolly mammoth giantess thought to herself. “You sneezed Puck out around here. He should be up ahead. I sure hope he didn’t run into a bear or a wolf first though. Elisabeth continued to walk down the forest, accidentally knocking down a few trees with her enormous booty.

Of course, Elisabeth had other problems to deal with because back at the campsite where she and Puck were relaxing, there was a man who was wearing a scarf, top hat and a pair of steampunk goggles as well as a trench coat. The strange man was polishing what looked like a rifle as he looked at the tracks left by Elisabeth. "These are clearly elephant footprints," said the hunter. "I was not aware pachyderms were indigenous to this area." The man then looked down to see that a piece of Elisabeth's fur had gotten stuck to a log. "Fur?" asked the hunter. "Elephants don't have fur. But it can't be. Woolly mammoths have been extinct since the Ice Age. Hmm. This will be an interesting target. I wonder how much they'll pay for it."

- - - - - - - - - - -

Back at the ranger station, Ronald had brought Puck to his superior. "For the last time," said the head ranger. "Tell me this again, straight. You're telling me that your wife is a woolly mammoth as big as a house?" "Yeah," said Puck getting annoyed. "That’s exactly what I said.” The head ranger pounded his fist on the table. “Are you some kind of nut? You’re telling me that your wife somehow got mutated into a giant prehistoric elephant. I think all that hot air on the ground is effecting your brain.” Puck suddenly got defensive. “Are you discriminating against the vertically impaired?” Ronald let out a sigh. “Mr. Barker, take it easy on him. I think he stayed up in that tree longer than he should’ve.” “I’m telling you the truth!” yelled Puck. “What’s it going to take for you to believe me!” Mr. Barker just looked down at Puck, intimidating him in the process. “Listen here, freak. We have bigger problems to deal with than a delusional dwarf! We just got word that Tin Punk is in the area.”

Puck just raised an eyebrow. “Tin Punk?” he asked. Puck then turned his head and gasped in fear because he saw a wanted poster that depicted the face of the man in the steampunk goggles and hat. “That’s one mean looking customer.” Said Puck. “You don’t know the half of it,” said Ronald. “He’s wanted for poaching rare animals. A lot of which he sells on the black market.” It didn’t take Puck too much thought to realize that Elisabeth could be in danger if that hunter managed to find her. "Oh no! Oh no! Oh no!" Puck immediately ran out of the ranger station as Ronald looked at him in surprise. "Wait! It's dangerous to go alone at..." "Leave him be," said Mr. Barker. "We have enough cretins to worry about as it is." That was when the telephone rang at the station and Ronald grabbed the phone. What the man on the phone said made the young forest ranger very surprised. "What is it?" asked Mr. barker. Ronald turned his head and looked in disbelief. "A camper claims to have spotted a large elephant roaming through the forest." "But that doesn't mean that it's that idiot's alleged mammoth wife. It's probably an escaped zoo animal." Ronald shook his head. "I don't think so. The zoo in this area doesn't have an elephant exhibit. And from the sounds of it, this "elephant" is bigger than it should be. Perhaps that kook wasn't as crazy as we thought. I'm going after him."

- - - - - - - - - - -

Meanwhile, Elisabeth was by a nearby lake sucking up the water with her long trunk before spraying it into her mouth and then sniffed the air again. "The ranger station is up ahead. Looks like Puck's safe for now." Elisabeth was about to step forward but then realized something. "Wait a minute," said the mammoth giantess. "Exactly what am I doing? What are those rangers going to think if they see an enormous woolly mammoth with boobs. If I was transformed into a modern elephant, I'd be easier to hide, but no, I had to be turned into a creature that's been extinct for thousands of years." Elisabeth then begun to pant and sweat. "Geez," she said. "How did it get so hot all of a sudden. Ugh. All this fur is definitely going to take some getting used to." Elisabeth then started to suck up water with her trunk again and then spray it up into the air in an attempt to cool her obese and very furry body down. In the process, she stripped her jeans right off in order to beat the heat.

"Dad is not going to be happy when he hears about this. He'll probably use it as another excuse to pick on Puck. Speaking of which, this will take some getting used to. Well, I could always try to find work in a circus. It's not like I can keep my job at the bank in this condition." As Elisabeth was laughing to herself and trying to get a clear idea of the situation, her elephantine ears twitched and she let out a trumpet. "What was that." Elisabeth turned her head a few times because she was certain that she heard something. The mammoth giant stood up and looked around the forest but she was so large that the trees were obscuring her view of the area. Elisabeth moved slowly, being absolutely careful not to further damage the forest with her large body and that's when she heard something distressing and turned her head to see...
112231212222212.title: Wife From the Ice Age

1122312122222121.content:
On the ground staring up at the 40ft tall mammoth woman was Tin Punk, looking up with his steam punk goggles and pointing a gun right at her as she looked down in horror and shock. “Well, well,” said Tin Punk. “I was looking to bag some big game in this forest, but I wasn’t expecting them to be this big.” Elisabeth held up her trunk and trumpeted in an attempt to intimidate the hunter but Tin Punk stood his ground and focused his goggles to get an X-ray of Elisabeth’s body and saw her veins and heart beating. “Oh my,” said Tin Punk. “From the outside you’re clearly an animal but your x-rays show a human circulatory and nervous system. I thought that those things they were doing with genetic engineering weren’t actually possible in real life. Huh?” Tin Punk walked forward and caused Elisabeth to trumpet again because he felt the fur at one of her toes. “Fur?” he asked. “Elephants don’t have fur. Unless...”

The hunter then took out a syringe of some kind and jabbed it into Elisabeth’s foot, causing the mammoth woman to trumpet in pain. What Tin Punk had done was suck a little bit of blood out of Elisabeth’s enormous body and then placed it into a scanner of some sort and realized exactly what he was doing. “Oh my. Mammuthus Primigenius. The woolly mammoth. I’ll bet your fur should be worth a pretty penny.” Elisabeth rubbed her leg in pain from the wound but then her eyes popped because the hunter had pointed a high-tech looking elephant gun towards her head. Elisabeth gasped and stepped back, pushing down several trees with her large rear in the process. “Then again,” said Tin Punk. “Maybe I could sell you to a collector or a zoo or somewhere. I’ll bet that there are several uses for a mammoth.” Tin Punk laughed evilly and pulled the trigger.

However, despite Elisabeth’s massive size, she managed to dodge the shot and then trumpeted out loud. The hunter shot a large net and managed to tangle both of the mammoth giantess’s legs and make her land on the ground with a crash as she yelled. The loud crash from Elisabeth’s landing caused the entire forest to shake and deers, rabbits, squirrels and all other forms of woodland creatures were scurrying away. Nearby, the resulting earthquake had shaken up the campgrounds and the ranger station was starting to cave in. Ronald let out a scream as a bit of the ceiling came down. “What was that?! An earthquake.” “Impossible,” said Mr. Barker. “We’re nowhere near a major fault line. What’s going on?!” Up the hill, Puck was running into the forest looking for his transmogrified wife when he noticed the animals scurrying away. “Oh no.” He said. The fair-skinned dwarf ran into the woods knowing that his mammoth wife was in danger.

 Elisabeth at the time was trying to stand but the net fired by Tin Punk made it difficult for her to so much as move without falling flat on her enormous rear. “I’m afraid that you won’t be getting away anytime soon,” said Tin Punk as he pointed his gun to the mammoth yet again. “I always catch my mark. There isn’t a beast alive that can get the best of old Tin Punk. Even if that beast was once a woman.” Tin Punk fired a laser and greatly wounded Elisabeth, causing the mammoth woman to trumpet in pain. “Let’s see,” said Tin Punk. “I wonder how much mammoth steaks would go.. auth!”

 Before Tin Punk could finish his sentence, the poacher took a rock to the head and fell back before he turned around, revealing his mask was cracking up. It was there, he saw Puck struggling to hold up another rock. “Puck!” yelled Elisabeth. Tin Punk focused his cracking goggles on Puck this time. “Get away from my wife you rat!” yelled Puck. Tin Punk however, was not in the mood for compromise and grabbed Puck by the throat. Puck gagged as the villain attempted to choke him and Elisabeth spotted this and the mammoth giantess trumpeted in horror before she finally managed to shake off the net around her feet.

Tin Punk was just about ready to shoot Puck but then heard a loud angry trumpet and looked up to see Elisabeth fuming with rage. The obese pachyderm giantess stomped her enormous foot to shake the ground and force the poacher to drop Puck. Tin Punk reached for his gun but Elisabeth blew a gust of wind from her trunk to move the weapon out of reach. She then seized Tin Punk with her trunk and made him grunt. Puck was panting and then looked up to see his wife holding onto her antagonist. “Oh my gosh.” Elisabeth trumpeted and squeezed Tin Punk and noticed that he seemed to be at least partially mechanical under his coat. “Huh?”

Before Elisabeth or Puck could think any further on the matter....
1122312122222121.title: Mammoth Season

11223121222222.content:
At a college in Tokyo, one of the students, Yusuke was looking for any signs of his girlfriend. “Kagura? Kagura?” Yusuke looked forward and saw that the school girl was doing the one thing she always did after school, watching tokusatsu on her computer. “Go! Sock it to them Rider! Another one bites the dust.” Kagura cheered as she watched images of tokusatsu on her video. It looked like the hero would deal a finishing move to a villain but then the screen stopped.

“Hey!” yelled Kagura right before she turned to see Yusuke who paused the video. “Still watching Tokusatsu I see,” said Yusuke. “Kagura, you just turned 20. Don’t you think you’re getting too old for this stuff.” “But, Yusuke, it’s heroes like Kamen Rider and Ultraman who made me what I am, today.” Yusuke just shook his head. “Man, you like two types of Tokusatsu. Motorcycle martial artists and kaiju killing giants. I’ll bet you wish that both of them would combine.”

Kagura got up and gasped in excitement. “Wouldn’t that be awesome?” she asked. “Yusuke, that’s brilliant.” Yusuke held out a pencil. “This pencil is reality, get a grip, Kagura. I’ll see you back at the dorm.” Kagura just put away her computer and scoffed.

Reuben saw a waiter go by with a dish full of gumbo and sniffed the air. “Gotta love that Cajun cooking? You know why I love Cajun cooking, Tuesday? It’s nice and hot and spicy, just the way I like it. Come on, what’s taking our gumbo?” Tuesday just stuck out her tongue. “If it’s all the same with you, dear, I think it would be safer for me to drink some nice hot lobster bisque.”

But I’ll humor you, just this once.” Tuesday poured some pepper into her lobster bisque.

As she sampled it, she gagged slightly. “Ugh,” she said. “Even the lobster is spicy around these parts.” What Tuesday didn’t know was that the reason for her lobster’s spiciness was a factor that the restaurant staff didn’t even know. I shouldn't have laughed at you." Kim gave a laugh as she rose off of her tiny husband and Tom inhaled deeply. "You know, maybe you're onto something. Maybe dinosaurs should wear pants. Or at least a thong." Kim gave a snort."

However, before Kim could do anything else, a low flying advertisement plane flew by her head and the pilot panicked and swerved by Kim's head as Kim grunted. The pilot had in the process accidentally knocked Kim's glasses off and in her haste to pick them up, the tyrannosaurus rex giantess accidentally sat on them and smashed them. "Oh no." Said Tom. Kim let out a groan as she squinted. "Dammit. Tyrannosaurus rex or no tyrannosaurus rex, Kim could not see without her glasses and was wandering around aimlessly and stomping the ground as Tom moved out of the way. "Kim!" yelled Tom. "Calm down!"

However, the big tyrannosaurus lady who would weigh several tons had she been human-sized was wandering....
1122312122222222221211.title: Tyrannosaurus on the Beach

1122312122222222222.content:
Morgan Hendrix was the curator of the museum of science in Cherub Cove. She was leading a tour of the famous dinosaur wing of the museum. "This creature is know as Archaeopteryx lithographica. Archaeopteryx is believed to be the bridge between birds and dinosaurs. Fossils of these strange wonders have been found in the forests of Southern Europe. From these fossilized remains, we can tell that the archaeopteryx's feathers shared much in common with modern birds. Archaeopteryx lived during the Jurassic period alongside such dinosaurs as stegosaurus, diplodocus and the ever popular allosaurus."

However, as Morgan was walking, she saw her live-in boyfriend, Bruno, sleeping on his job as a janitor again. "Excuse me, folks," said Morgan with a sigh. "This will only take a moment." Morgan walked up to Bruno and slapped him awake. Bruno mumbled and Morgan gave him a glare. "Come on, Morgan," said Bruno. "I was just resting my eyes." "Dammit, Bruno," whispered Morgan. "I got you this job because I thought you could handle it." Bruno let out a scoff. "Come on, Morgan. I am totally serious." Morgan just let out a sigh and slapped herself in the face. "Just make sure this place is spotless and don't damage anything."

Morgan may have been very smart when it came to dinosaurs and paleontology but she had poor taste when it came to boyfriends. The fact was that Bruno was a total deadbeat. He couldn't hold a job and was very lazy. It was a wonder what she saw in him. Morgan walked away as her boyfriend was muttering to himself. "Some girlfriend," he muttered to himself. "You would think the museum curator would get me a better job than janitor. I'll never make it big by sweeping up after a bunch of million year old skeletons. There's gotta be an easier way to make a living.

That was when Bruno overheard a conversation. In the next room was Maya, one of Morgan's coworkers. She was working in the back room with a vial of a strange pink liquid. "If Morgan knew what I was putting together, she would can me for sure. The museum isn't getting the attendance that it used to. Which is why this vial will be the key to creating an actual living breathing dinosaur." Bruno's eyes popped upon hearing it. From the looks of it, Maya was working on creating a dinosaur from DNA. "Overnight," said Maya. "This will turn into a dinosaur egg, if undisturbed that is. Of course, I know how to avoid any unnecessary trouble." Maya held up what looked like the skull of a baby triceratops. She then heard a strange noise and went to investigate, leaving the vial unguarded.

Bruno smirked and seizing opportunity, ran off and took the vial of the pink liquid and gave a laugh. "Maya," he said. "Your triceratops in a bottle is going to make me very rich." Bruno laughed as he held the vial and when Morgan wasn't looking, he ran off the museum premises and back to their house. Well, more accurately it was Morgan's house. Bruno however, moved in after being evicted from his own apartment. He smiled and put the vial in the fridge. "An actual triceratops. That should be worth a fortune. Now, should I sell it to a zoo or a circus once it's ready." Of course, you would realize that by putting the vial in the refrigerator, Bruno wasn't that smart.

What also wasn't smart was that he didn't lock the door and Morgan found that out as she took her break. She saw the door unlocked and gave an annoyed look. "Bruno," she grunted. "He skipped work again. If he weren't my boyfriend, he'd be so fired." Morgan let out a sigh. "Now calm down. Maybe one day he'll grow up. Yeah right, fat chance Morgan." Morgan fixed herself a sandwich before she noticed the vial of pink triceratops DNA. Of course, Morgan didn't know what it was. "I thought we were all out of pink lemonade." She said.

Without any idea of what that pink slime would turn her into, the bespectacled blonde museum curator drank the vial with her lunch and then returned to her post at the museum, not noticing purplish pink scales that were growing on her now expanding backside. Morgan then felt something on her nose. "Is that a pimple?" she asked. It was too early to tell, but what was growing on Morgan's nose was not a pimple, because two more of that exact same growth were growing on both sides of her forehead.
1122312122222222222.title: Night of the Triceratops

choices: The Next Tour Group Enters the Museum and Spots Her
11223121222222222221.content:
Morgan walked into the museum and was looking at her face in the mirror, looking at what she through was a pimple on her nose. "I've dealt with pimples before," she said. "All you have to do is to squeeze them." Morgan tried that but found the "pimple" too hard to squeeze. "What the heck?" she asks. "This pimple feels like it's made of bone. Morgan failed to notice that as she was walking down the hallway of the museum, she appeared to be slowly growing taller and her ass appeared to be getting bigger, to the point where her underwear was clearly visible. It was there Bruno came by and realized something. "Hey, Morgan," he said. "I think your butt is getting bigger." Morgan glared at her boyfriend and then slapped him.

"Jerk," said Morgan. "I'm beginning to wonder why I don't just dump him." Then Morgan saw Maya looking around. "Where is it?" asked Maya. "Where is it?" "Where is what?" asked Morgan. Maya froze and turned to see Morgan and at this point, the "pimple" on Morgan's nose had turned into a horn and Maya's skin was turning a light pink color. Maya gasped and then looked to see Morgan had doubled in weight and her jeans were coming apart. Maya then bit her lips. "Oh, nothing Morgan, nothing." Morgan just walked away and scratched her head and grunted because she pricked her fingers. Those two other "pimples" on her forehead appeared to have turned into long horns and Morgan's body had completely turned pink and scaly.

Morgan scratched her head again and then walked past an allosaurus skeleton but then gasped because she was actually taller than the skeleton. "That's odd," she said. "That skeleton is 16ft tall, how could I..." Morgan realized she was 20-feet tall and then looked down but couldn't see her feet past her large 22-foot wide belly. Speaking of which, her feet burst out of her shoes to reveal that her feet had become large flat feet like a prehistoric herbivore. She then saw she had a large tail and that her butt was 24-feet wide. Morgan gasped and looked into a mirrored window to see that she was now a gigantic and obese pink-skinned triceratops.

She then bit her lip that had turned into a beak as her face had fully turned into a triceratops face. "This has Bruno written all over it." She mumbled.

What happens now?
11223121222222222221.title: Three-Horned Curator

choices: Skip to the End of the Tour
112231212222222222212.content:
Before Morgan could do anything else or confront Bruno about her condition, the 20ft tall and 24ft wide triceratops girl heard movement and gasped as she turned around. She saw the next tour group and for the most part, they were surprised to see such a large anthropomorphic dinosaur right in front of them. Morgan bit her beaked lips rather nervously. “Terrific.” She moaned to herself. The crowd had mixed opinions. Several children were looking in awe at the huge dinosaur lady while one woman looked in distress to see her son looking at Morgan. “Riley,” said the woman. “Stand back from that creature. It could be dangerous.” However, a couple of teenagers took photographs of Morgan with their cell phone while one middle-aged man let out a scoff. “Are you kidding me. That has got to be the cheesiest looking costume I’ve ever seen.” The man stomped up to Morgan and pulled on her beak as Morgan grunted in pain. “See, it’s just a mask. I can see the leather and everything.” However, the man was having a hard time trying to pull off Morgan’s nose horn, prompting Morgan to snort him into the ground. The man was now convinced that Morgan was a real

“Don’t panic,” said Morgan nervously. “I mean you no harm. I just for some reason was transformed into a dinosaur because of something that probably has to do with my soon-to-be ex-boyfriend. In case anyone is concerned, the dinosaurs I’ve turned into is the triceratops, scientific name Triceratops Horridus, an herbivore.” Morgan smiled nervously before thinking to herself. “Although I am currently thinking of swallowing Bruno whole after he mutated me. “The name, Triceratops translates to “three-horned face”. In fact, this will be a perfect way to start our tour. Follow me.” Morgan stomped down the museum hallway and although some members of the crowd were reluctant, they all followed after the triceratops curator.

“The triceratops was a very massive dinosaur that reached a length of up to 30ft and a weight of up to 19,000lbs.” “Lady,” said one teenager in the crowd. “You definitely look more than 19,000lbs.” Morgan gave the young man a glare to force him to be quiet before she continued. “The horns of the triceratops are made out of keratin, the same substance that makes up our finger and toenails and the triceratops’s heavy head required its tail to be just as heavy as the skull. To demonstrate this, Morgan slammed her new tail on the ground to shake the floor, with one teenage girl spilling her soda all over herself. “Okay,” thought Morgan to herself. “So I’m a giant fat triceratops. Maybe I can get used to it.”

The triceratops giantess cleared her throat as she walked up towards several skeletons that looked similar to herself (albeit without human DNA to make them walk upright. “The triceratops belonged to the suborder, Ceratopsia, a suborder of dinosaurs known for their large and horned heads with beaked noses. Here are a few of the triceratops’s relatives.” As Morgan was explaining, a little girl and boy in the crowd noticed her tail moving back and forth and let out a laugh as they decided to have some fun. “First,” said Morgan. “This specimen is called Chasmosaurus, name meaning “opening lizard” for chasms on its forehead. Chasmosaurus males used their large frilled heads to attract mates and fight for dominance, much like modern hippopotami or stag beetles.”

Morgan then walked up towards the next skeleton as the girl and boy climbed up her tail. “This creature is called Styracosaurus, “spiked lizard” because its head had more spiked armor than other ceratopsians. Notice the protective spikes over the eyes. Also notice the tyrannosaurus-killing horn at the front of the nose. At 3ft long, the Styracosaurus’s nose horn was the longest of any dinosaur.” “And your butt is the largest of any dinosaur.” Said that same teenager from earlier. Morgan then stomped the ground and roared at the heckler to make him back off. “It is believed that Styracosaurus lived in herds like modern mammals.

Morgan then walked up to a third skeleton as the girl and boy had climbed up to her neck area. “She sure is big.” Said the girl. “What do you expect?” asked the boy. “She’s a dinosaur. And a very funny one.” “Now,” said Morgan as she held up a rather small skeleton that looked liked it had a parrot-like face. “Finally, this oddball is called Psittacosaurus, “parrot lizard”, a runt compared of its larger cousins but it was a more early creature that gave rise to giants. The creatures beak was used to snap through branches and because it was so small, it was said to walk on its hindlegs. These creatures were very common in what is now Asia and it’s believed that they only lived for 10 years.”

Suddenly Morgan grunted. “What the?!” muttered the triceratops girl as she felt a slight pain in her back. The girl and boy from early had climbed over the giantess’s head and and were giggling as each grabbed one of the horns on Morgan’s forehead as Morgan shook her head about. “Cool. I can see the whole museum from here.” “Ms. Triceratops, are there any other creatures like you?” “That I doubt.” Muttered a very annoyed Morgan. The kids’ mother spotted them on Morgan’s head and gasped. “Riley! Kira! Get down from there! You’re going to get hurt!”

Morgan just let out a sigh as the kids kept riding on her swaying head. “Note to self,” thought the huge triceratops to herself. “What to do later: Step 1) Dump Bruno, Step 2) Fire Bruo, Step 3) Eat Bruno.”
112231212222222222212.title: Titanic Triceratops Tour

1122312122222222222122.content:
An hour later, the tour had ended and Morgan waved goodbye to the tour group. Of course, she was more than happy that the children playing on her head had left and let out a sigh as she shook her head and walked down the hallway, the ground echoing with every step of her massive feet. “I need something to eat.” She said. Morgan remembered a nearby vending machine and because she couldn’t reach her wallet over her titanic ass, she decided to screw it and smash the snack machine open with her large head before stuffing herself with candy bars and potato chips. As the triceratops was snacking, she noticed that she had another growth spurt. She was now 35ft tall with a 40ft wide belly and 45ft wide ass and a pair of H-cup breasts. “This is not happening,” said Morgan. “This definitely cannot be happening. It has to be a nightmare. I’m sure that this is the result of one of Bruno’s get-rich-quick schemes but how. I know there’s no way he has the brains to be able to do something like this.

As Morgan was trying to figure out what was going on, she heard the sound of somebody dropping something and then turned around to see that Maya was looking up at her and staring. “Oh my gosh!” yelled Maya. “Morgan? Is that you?” Morgan was at this point so big that one of her toenails was slightly bigger than Maya. The triceratops stared down at her friend who looked more astonished than afraid of her. “Maya,” said Morgan. “I... I can’t explain. Look. I don’t know how, but I’ve been transmogrified into a mutated triceratops and not only am I gradually getting bigger, I’m also gaining a rather large amount of weight. I look more like a Thanksgiving balloon than a dinosaur. I don’t know how it happened. Is this one of those Franz Kafka stories? Because it isn’t funny.”

Maya of course realized that something was very wrong with her boss and knew exactly what could’ve caused such a strange transformation. “Morgan,” said Maya nervously. “Did you eat or drink anything unusual earlier?” “I just had my usual lunch; bacon, lettuce and turkey. Okay, so maybe I went overboard with the lettuce but that probably had to do with my new herbivorous DNA. I washed it down with some pink lemonade I found in the fridge.” “Pink lemonade?!” yelled Maya. “Oh no. That wasn’t lemonade, Morgan. It was the culture fluid I was using to try and create a dinosaur egg cloned from triceratops DNA.” “What?!” yelled Morgan. “You were trying to clone a dinosaur. How stupid can you be. Didn’t you watch Jurassic Park!?” “I did. That’s why I used an herbivorous dinosaur. I’m not stupid.” “Why were you trying to do an irresponsible thing like that? You know, I really don’t want to know. I’m guessing since I drank your serum before it could turn into a dinosaur egg, it turned me into a dinosaur.” “But how did it get into your fridge?” asked Maya. Morgan grit her beak. “Bruno,” she said. “I’m sure of it. Obviously he saw an opportunity to get rich and seized it. This is worse than the time I had to bail him out of jail for selling the neighbor’s cats as baby manticores.” Morgan was so mad that she stomped her foot on the ground and cracked the floor. “I’m through dealing with Bruno’s screw ups this time. This time I’m going to dump him.... once my stomach acids have finished breaking him down!”

Maya was really horrified at that threat. “Morgan. You’re an herbivore, remember.” Morgan then lowered her head and snorted into Maya’s face. “Don’t think that I’ve forgotten that you’re partially to blame for this. I’ll give you 30 seconds to give me a damn good reason why I shouldn’t fire your tiny ass. 29... 28... 27...” Maya knew that she was in hot water. She had her colossal mutated triceratops boss staring down at her menacingly. Not only was she in danger of being fired, but Morgan was so big at this point she could swallow her whole without even feeling it. “Think of the benefits of being a dinosaur. You won’t have to take the car to work. You won’t even need a car anymore.” “26... 25... 24.” Counted Morgan more menacingly than before. “Morgan! Be reasonable! Nobody will try to mug you anymore! Maybe you can get a job on P...” “23, 22, 21, 20, 19, 18.” Counted Morgan quicker than before as she then proceeded to grab Maya and hold her like a doll. She even opened her mouth to give Maya a view of her humongous teeth. Sure, they were herbivorous teeth, but Maya was legitimately afraid that Morgan would eat her just to calm her nerves.

“17, 16, 15, 14, 13, 12!” “Morgan!” “10... 9... 8.... 7....” “What about the museum!” yelled Maya. “I did it for the museum.” “6,” muttered a now very interested Morgan. “5...” “Think about it,” said Morgan. “This is just what we need to increase our number of visitors. What better way to get people hooked on dinosaurs. They loved you back there as a prehistoric tour guide. This way you can be the museum’s curator and mascot at the same time.” Now, Morgan didn’t necessarily like that idea but Maya did have a point. People couldn’t help but stop and stare at a real life dinosaur in the museum and while the kids climbing up on her irked her, the giant mutated curator realized that the museum had nothing left to lose.”

Morgan put Maya down on the ground and let out a snort. “This idea of yours had better work, Maya,” said the triceratops giantess. “I really don’t like any plan that makes me a spectacle but if it double attendance, I guess I can make it work. Just don’t you dare try to make any more homegrown dinosaurs. I don’t feel like having more giants like me roaming a....” Before Morgan could finish her sentence, she heard a rather loud ripping sound and then she turned her head around to see that her jeans had fallen off of her giant prehistoric rear and her panties appeared to be falling apart as well. The ceratopsian colossus blushed before she tried to cover her rear with her hands in case anybody saw her. "Maya!" shouted Morgan. "Now, now, now, Morgan," said Maya. "Don't panic." "Don't panic? I'm a triceratops, I'm the size of a house and I'm fat, I can't walk around naked. Then people will really be staring at me." "I have an idea." However, Morgan gave a snort as she lowered her horned nose in front of her friend. "If it involves a Power Rangers costume, you can already start looking for another job."

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Soon, Maya had dressed Morgan up in a skin-tight leotard designed to look like dinosaur bones. the black and white skeletal design contrasted with her purplish pink scaly skin. “So?” asked Maya. “What do you think?” Morgan let out a sigh. “Well at least my naked pink ass isn’t showing... too much. I really hope this is worth the utter embarrassment. I mean, a 35ft tall sumo-sized blonde triceratops in glasses is not something you see everyday.” That was when Morgan heard a loud crash and turned around to see Bruno had slipped on one of the dents left into the floor by Morgan’s enormous footsteps. “What the hell?” asked Bruno. “Darn kids. I really hope that Morgan doesn’t expect me to clean up this mess.” Morgan was instantly filled with rage at the sight of her boyfriend, having recently learned that her transformation was completely his fault. “Bruno!” yelled the triceratops rather angrily.

Bruno then looked up and was at first horrified but then he recognized the giant fat triceratops lady as Morgan. “Oh,” said Bruno. “Morgan. You look... different. Did you do something with your hair.” “YOU did something with my body! What kind of idiot leaves mutagenic primordial ooze in the fridge!” “What?! You drank my dinosaur? I was going to sell it to a zoo.” Maya gave a glare Bruno’s way and Bruno realized that he was in big trouble. The scoundrel tried to get away but Morgan kept placing her enormous feet in the way of his escape.

Then Morgan stared down at Bruno and wagged her tail. "You will be extremely lucky if I just decide to dump you after this. I've dealt with your screwups before, Bruno, but this time you've gone too far. Thanks to your irresponsibility I am going to be a triceratops for the rest of my life." "Now don't blow your top, Morgan," said Bruno. "You make a very sexy triceratops. And with how big the rest of your body is, it makes that fat ass you always had a lot less noticeable." Bruno chose the wrong choice of words and Morgan let out an angry growl before grabbing her boyfriend and making him yell. She snorted in his face and then gave a smirk. "I'll decide whether or not I'll dump you later, but I have another tour to give in three hours. Until then, you're going to spend those hours...."
1122312122222222222122.title: Wrath of the Triceratops

11223121222222222222.content:
This story begins in a laboratory in Kansas where a madman is working with a fossilized pterodactyl egg and is extracting what appears to be some sort of marrow from the egg as he is working with it. The old man adjusts his glasses to study the formula more closely. "For thirteen long years they've mocked me," the man said. "For too long have I have been shunned for my beliefs, they all thought I was insane. The university, my employers and even my stupid ex-wife! But I'm going to show them. I, Dr. Dwight Harbinger, will resurrect the long extinct."

But before Dr. Harbinger could say another word, he heard a knock at the door. The mad doctor let out a grunt and walked out. "Idiot, neighbors," he said. "Do they not understand I am making history. Keep your shorts on! I'm coming." Dr. Harbinger opened the door to see a taller young man with pale strawberry blonde hair and glasses. The sight of this young man somewhat irked the doctor. "What are you dong here, Jerry?" "I see you've been working without sleep in that lab of yours again, Dad," said Jerry. "You're going to blow yourself up one day with those crazy experiments." "Fool!" yelled Dr. Harbinger. "I have been making history." "I know, I know. Trying to resurrect dead species through DNA experiments. Dad, you've been cooped up in that lab for thirteen years and you haven't had much success. I hope you've been remembering to pay the bills. Your landlord is going to kill you." But Harbinger shrugged his son's comment off. "What are you doing here anyway?

"Well," said Jerry. "My wife and I were in town and we thought we should..." "Wife?! Since when are you married?" "Since six months ago. You were invited to the wedding. Burgess! You haven't been reading your mail have you." "Why should I?" asked Dr. Harbinger. "Nothing but junk anyway." "Wow," said a female voice. "You were right, he is uptight." Dr. Harbinger turned his head to see that his daughter-in-law was an African American woman with long black hair that had crimson highlights and had a tattoo of a talon of some sort on her shoulder. Dr. Harbinger looked in surprise.

"Dad," said Jerry. "This is Sora. It's about time you caught up with current events." Dr. Harbinger grumbled as he inspected Sora. Sora just looked in concern. "You look absolutely terrible. When was the last time you got any sunlight?" "That stuff is bad for you," said Dr. Harbinger. "You're just asking for skin cancer." "I was just saying. Ugh, what smells like sulfur and primordial ooze." "If you must know," said Dr. Harbinger. "I am moments away from my greatest triumph ever. I would appreciate it, if you two would leave me alone." The mad scientist stomped back into his lab as Jerry let out a sigh. "He's at it again." "At what again?" asked Sora. "Well," said Jerry. "For thirteen years, Dad has been trying to find a way to use DNA to resurrect extinct animal species." Sora actually seemed curious at that. "You're kidding. That sounds amazing. You mean like dinosaurs." "Not exactly," said Jerry. "He's been probing at a pterodactyl's egg for some time."

Sora was confused. "I thought pterodactyls were..." "No, pterosaurs are not the same as dinosaurs. Dad told me that a long time ago. That was before he lost his mind." Sora nodded her head. At that time, in Dr. Harbinger's lab, he had finished his formula. "Yes," he said. "Yes. I've done it. I've created an egg cell that will actually bring life to a new pterodactyl. All I need is the right female body to act as an incubator." That's when Dr. Harbinger looked into the next room at his daughter-in-law as a fiendish idea cracked in his head.

That night, when Jerry and Sora were asleep, Dr. Harbinger snuck into the guest room and had placed the egg cell into a syringe as he walked up to the sleeping Sora. He uncovered her and saw her naked form and his chance to put his experiment in action. He inoculated Sora and then walked away knowing that she carried the egg cell that he hoped would resurrect the pterodactyl from extinction. However, as Sora was asleep, the egg cell that her father-in-law placed inside of her, suddenly popped and broke. You would think that it was a sign that the experiment failed. You'd be correct. However, it would still give way to resurrection of the most terrifying kind.
11223121222222222222.title: Horror in the Skies

choices: Dwight, to Give Him an Earful
Food, to Satisfy her Monstrous Hunger
112231212222222222221.content:
Inside of Sora's body, the broken eggshell leaked primordial ooze throughout her cells and her DNA strands were glowing as her heart was beating faster and her skeleton started to throb and sprouting strange veins. As this was going on, Sora was having night terrors and the dark-skinned woman was sweating heavily in her sleep before she burst up and gasped as she held her chest. She saw the vials and blueprints and equations littered all over the walls and even saw smoke leaking out in the hallways. While her husband was used to Dr. Harbinger's strange experiments, she could not get used to staying with her mad scientist father-in-law and got up to walk into the halls.

Sora was panting and even coughed as the smoke was filling the air. She could barely breathe and held her neck before making her way, still naked, into the kitchen. "Drink," she said. "I need something to drink." But when Sora opened Dwight's fridge, she saw various vials that were filled with strange liquids and one bottle that even appeared to have a lump of dinosaur flesh inside it. She gagged at what she saw. "This stuff doesn't look fit for human consumption. Ugh. Now calm down, Sora. You've been living with Jerry for six months and everything has been fine. It's just that your new father-in-law is a total FREAK! I wouldn't be too surprised if he conducted experiments on me in my sleep." Sora then coughed again and held her throat.

"I really need to get something to drink," the African American girl said to herself. "But I'm not taking my chances with Dwight's poisons. I saw a vending machine down the street. Maybe a good Coke will calm my nerves." Sora was just out the door when she realized she was naked and covered herself. Sora then spotted her coat and put it on before she ran out down the street before she approached the vending machine. She reached into her coat for her wallet and took out a dollar but then she realized that her fingernails looked really sharp. "Geez," she said. "I need a manicure worst than I thought." But Sora didn't notice anything out of the ordinary, not even the fact that she was currently standing 8ft tall and her butt had expanded to six feet."

Once Sora had her soda, she begun to drink it and was going to walk away but then heard a crashing sound. She turned around in shock at both how huge her butt had grown and at the fact that it had broken the vending machine and made bottles of soda fall out." Sora then felt her coat coming apart and gasped. She was frantically running down the street. "Oh man," said Sora. "The last thing I need is to be arrested for streaking. But what's going on. How come I'm getting so... ugh!" Sora held her stomach and felt that it was getting bigger because it was now 10ft wide as her breasts became D-cups.

Sora then gasped and then felt her head in pain because it was changing shape. She sprouted a large yellow horn in the center of her head as her mouth stretched out into a large yellow beak and her skin turned as crimson as the streaks in her hair. Then she sprouted large light purple membranes under her arms that revealed themselves to be wings as her feet turned into talons and her fingers turned into claws. "What is happening to me?" asked Sora as white stripes appeared on her thick legs. Sora then flapped her new wings and was flying in the air as she continued to grow and grow. With how monstrously obese she was getting, Sora was surprised to know that she was actually capable of flight.

Once Sora's transformation was complete, she was a 45ft tall pterodactyl with a 75ft belly, a 55ft butt, thick thighs that looked ten times thicker than any drumstick and a 150ft wingspan. Sora let out a shriek as she hovered in the air. "I am a giant, fat, reptile," she said to herself. "The only consolation is that I can fly. That's a plus, right. How did this." That's when Sora realized something and was filled with rage. "Dwight! That sick freak mutated me! I am going to have a long and vicious talk with my husband about this father-in-law of mine. I'm going to..." Sora's stomach rumbled and she let out a roar.

The giant sumo-sized pterodactyl girl then flew off in order to find...
112231212222222222221.title: Terror-Dactyl

1122312122222222222212.content:
Sora let out a shriek because she couldn't take the rumbling in her stomach. "Okay," the pterodactyl giantess said to herself. "First I find something to put in my stomach and then I tear that mad scientist father-in-law of mine a new one." Sora then flapped her large flabby wings and wound up soaring into the air, much to her surprise. "Well I'll be a dinosaur's caboose," she said. "Looks like my new wings are actually strong enough to get my new fat ass off of the ground." Sora flew overhead in the air as she cast a shadow over Kansas. As she was flying, there was a college-aged stoner looking out of a convenience store when he looked up and gasped at the pterodactyl flying overhead. The young man hesitated but he took out his iPhone to take a photograph of Sora.

However, Sora didn't even have time to think about whether or not somebody saw her in her transmogrified form. She was hungry and she needed food. "There's gotta be something yummy nearby. I have a sudden craving for meat. Hmm, maybe when this is over, I'll eat Dwight. Hmm, don't be hasty, Sora. You might be able to coerce him to undo the damage." Sora then spotted something in the distance. It looked like a farmhouse and as she flew overhead, she spotted several sheep bleating and licked her lips before she flew down. The sheep all spotted her and bleated in shock before they begun to run. However, the pterosaur giantess flapped her wings and shattered the fence that held the sheep in. As the sheep were trying to retreat, Sora swooped down with an open beak to swallow as many of the livestock as she could.

Once she was done, Sora was rubbing her stomach and then held it in pain. "Next time," she said as she felt her huge, bloated, pulsating gut. "Chew and then swallow. Ugh. Why did it have to be sheep. Mouton always did give me gas. But I guess giant mutated reptiles that can fly can't be choosers." Sora felt her stomach again and then groaned before she flew off again. "I better find a truck filled with antacids to swallow." Sora flew back into city limits and then spotted a large truck carrying seltzer when she decided to swoop down and separate the load from the truck using her claws. The truck driver grunted and gasped because he saw the pterodactyl in his side mirror and immediately hit the gas to drive away for his life as Sora made off with the seltzer. "Okay," said Sora. "Once my stomach isn't throwing a tantrum anymore, I am going to tell Jerry exactly what that father of his did to me. Ugh. You stupid sheep calm down in there or I'm going to swallow a wolf!"

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Back at Dwight's house, Jerry had woken up and was looking for Sora while Dwight was in front of the television working on some strange machine. "Dad," said Jerry. "Have you seen Sora? I suddenly woke up and she wasn't in bed with me." "How do you know she's not in the bathroom?" asked Dwight. "I checked. She might've gone across the street for some reason or another. Doesn't she realize how dangerous the city can be at.... night?"

On the television there was a report on that concerned Sora's activities as a pterodactyl. "Attention all listeners," said the newswoman. "We have just heard reports of a giant flying monster soaring over our big city." On the screen appeared the photograph of Sora that the stoner took earlier." "This photograph taken by an on-the-spot witness reveals our creature to potentially be a rather overweight and voluptuous pterodactyl." Jerry gasped at the news report, not realizing that the pterodactyl was actually his wife. However, Dwight seemed more surprised than anything.

On the television, the farmer whose flock was attacked appeared on the screen. "I saw that critter. It was awful. It ate my entire flock of sheep." Then there was the truck driver whose truckload of seltzer was stolen by Sora. "I barely got away with my life. That flying reptile took off with my seltzer." The anchorwoman nodded her head. "People of Kansas. Beware. There is a ginormous and obese flying dinosaur with an upset stomach and it's starving." "Uh," said the truck driver. "Technically pterodactyls aren't dinosaurs."

Back home, Jerry was horrified and then put on his coat. "Where are you going?" asked Dwight. "Are you kidding?!" yelled Jerry. "My wife is probably out there with a giant pterodactyl flying around. I gotta find her. That thing might eat her." Once Jerry had left, Dwight had put two and two together. "That pterodactyl won't eat Sora. That pterodactyl was Sora. Something must've gone wrong when I put the pterodactyl egg cell in her womb and it turned into mutagen. This might actually be better than my original plan." With that, Dwight gave a sinister smirk.

Whose P.O.V. do we continue from?
1122312122222222222212.title: Feast of the Flying Titan

choices: Sora Sees Dwight Trying to Sneak Away and Grabs Him
11223121222222222222122.content:
Jerry ran down the street in horror and took out his keys. “Don’t panic, Jerry,” he said. “So your wife is out there in a city she’s never been to before, just as a giant carnivorous creature from the Jurassic period is flying in the air and looking for food.” Jerry gulped as he finally unlocked the door. “Now that’s something to really worry about. Oh. If anything happens to my wife, I’d never forgive myself.” Jerry got into his car and zoomed away as Dwight was on the veranda and had his binoculars out to look for any sign of Sora. “I’ve been going at this the wrong way. In order to bring back the monsters of the past, I didn’t have to plant a dinosaur egg in my daughter-in-law’s womb. I had to turn her into an actual prehistoric beast. Hmm, this is going to make things really difficult at Thanksgiving and I’ll probably face consequences from Jerry’s in-laws, providing they’re still alive. But it will be worth it. I’ve shown that it’s possible to bring the past back to life.” Dwight let out a maniacal laugh before he coughed and held his chest. “I wish I didn’t work with so many toxic fumes.

Jerry was driving down the street looking all around. “Sora! Sora! Where are you!” Jerry feared the worst. Since he did not know that the pterodactyl flying around Kansas was his wife, he assumed that Sora was in danger of being eaten. “Where did that pterodactyl even come from?” asked Jerry to himself. “Giant flying reptiles don’t just come out of thin air. I wonder. Did Dad play a role in bringing that beast to... no way. Dad may mess with a lot of dinosaur DNA, but there’s no way that he’d be competent enough to create a pterodactyl from scratch. Besides, if he did, it would’ve only been as big as a newborn. That thing is 45ft tall with a 150ft wingspan. Do pterodactyls even get that big? No! There’s no way. But this definitely isn’t an ordinary pterodactyl.” Jerry then stopped his car and looked up.

He saw Sora flying overhead and she appeared to have gotten bigger and was carrying a truck that appeared to belong to a meat packing plant. Jerry gasped and then drove off faster. He saw that there was nobody on the streets and was growing more and more worried. “I really hope that pterodactyl didn’t already devour Sora. I’m pretty sure if pterodactyls were alive today we’d be at the bottom of the food chain.” Jerry turned on his radio to see if he could find a news update on the pterodactyl that was flying around Kansas. “So far,” said the voice on the radio. “No half-eaten corpses or skeletons have turned up in coprolite have turned up, so we know the pterodactyl has yet to add humans to its diet. Still, citizens of the area are advised to stay indoors.” Jerry gave a sigh of relief. “Thank goodness. There’s still a chance that I can get to Sora before that creature does.”

Speaking of Sora, the obese pterodactyl giantess had torn open the back of the truck with her beak before she dug out all the meat and scarfed it down her big fat and greedy throat. Sora then let out a loud belch and held herself by the neck. “Thank goodness that came out from the attic and not the basement. I hope that greedy tummy of mine can give me a break for now.” Then, Sora shrieked because she looked forward and noticed Jerry’s car. “I recognize that car,” she said. “Jerry! Oh my gosh! He must’ve heard that news reporter. He doesn’t know I’m the pterodactyl that’s flying about. I’ve got to stop him.” Sora flapped her wings and panted as she took off again and lifted her hulk up into the air. “Flying isn’t as hard as I thought it would be,” she said to herself. “But with this girth and ass, takeoff is backbreaking labor.” Sora shrieked and continued to fly towards her husband’s car.

Jerry was looking all around for his wife and bit his lip. He took out his cellphone and shook it. “I know I shouldn’t do this when I’m driving but...” Jerry then gasped. Before he could even think about pushing any buttons on his cell phone, he looked into his side mirror to see the colossal pterodactyl SSBBW flying after him as she shrieked. Jerry screamed and sped up as Sora flew after him. “Jerry!” yelled Sora. “Wait! It’s me!” But Jerry couldn’t hear Sora from so far away and forced the pterodactyl to fly lower. In the process, Sora’s hips brushed against several buildings and caused them to crack slightly. “Jerry!” yelled Sora. “Stop the car!” Unfortunately for Sora, Jerry couldn’t hear his wife and kept driving and hit the gas. This provoked the pterodactyl giantess into flying forward and then flapping her wings to tip the car before she swooped down and grabbed it by the trunk.

Jerry looked out the window and his jaw dropped upon seeing the pterodactyl he had no idea was his wife as she was shrieking. “No way!” yelled Jerry. “I’m not on the menu tonight!” Jerry quickly unbuckled his seatbelt and jumped out of the car as Sora turned her head. Jerry landed on his feet and ran off as Sora dropped the car on the ground and then flew in front of her husband and landed on the ground with a boom. Jerry froze in fear as Sora stared down at him. He tried to back away but the enormous sumo-sized flying lizard held out her wings in order to block his path. Jerry took out a can of mace and sprayed Sora in the eye as she shrieked in pain. "Stay away from me, you monster! I'm not letting you find my wife!"

Sora moaned and held her eye. "Jerry! It's me! I am your wife!" Jerry gasped and stepped back. "You... you... just talked. How could...?" "Jerry," said Sora. "I'm Sora." "That's impossible. If you're really Sora, then what is your maiden name." "Shelby." "What date we were married?" "February 17th." "Who gave you away?" "My grandfather." Jerry couldn't believe it. Since those answers were true, he knew that the pterodactyl in fact had to be Sora. "Sora? What happened to...?" Jerry then realized exactly what was going on and he was savage. "Dad! He must've been experimenting on you when you were asleep. I'll ****ing kill him! Using his own daughter-in-law as a lab rat." Sora gave a shriek. "You're gonna have to get in line behind me. If he doesn't have a way to change me back, I'm going to tear him to shreds!"

Jerry then turned to see several overturned food trucks and then stared at Sora who could only blush in embarrassment (no that it was completely visible on her dark reddish skin). "Don't judge me," she said. "I was hungry." Jerry poked his wife in the stomach. "All brides let themselves go eventually. It's a really good thing that this didn't happen indoors." Sora gave a nervous laugh at that and then let out a shriek because she heard sirens. Jerry turned his head and saw several police cars coming forward. "Oh no." He groaned.

Out came a S.W.A.T. team that was pointing their weapons at Sora, forcing the pterodactyl to curl up her wings in fear. "Back away from that dangerous creature, sir," said the leader of the S.W.A.T. team. "We've come to destroy this pterodactyl before it becomes a major threat." Sora shrieked in fear but Jerry held out his arms. "She's not dangerous. This pterodactyl is my wife! She's harmless." The S.W.A.T. officers were so confused that they lowered their weapons. "Your wife? You're not serious are you? She's a dinosaur." "First of all," said Jerry. "She's not a dinosaur, she's a pterodactyl. Second of all, she wasn't a pterodactyl when I married her. My father did this to her. My name is Jerry Harbinger and...." "Harbinger?" asked the S.W.A.T. leader. "As in Dr. Dwight Harbinger? The disgraced paleontologist? We've got several complaints from his neighbors about the noise from his experiments. We always thought he was a harmless kook, but this, this is just going too far. It's time we had a little talk with Mr. Mad Doctor. As for you, Mr. Harbinger, I'd advise your wife to be more careful about her appetite. This is Kansas. People might not understand a pterodactyl flying around looking for food. Good night."

The police drove off and Sora uncurled her wings as she let out a sigh. "Damn," she said. "I thought for sure I'd wind up extinct all over again. Jerry, what do you think those police are going to do about your father." Jerry shook his head. "I don't know, but I don't think that it will be pleasant. What if he doesn't know how to turn you back?" Sora shrieked in horror and then flapped her wings. "Easy, girl!" yelled Jerry. "Easy!" Sora then grabbed her husband by the shirt with her beak and then tossed him onto her back. Jerry had to step on the rolls of lard on the pterodactyl's back right before she started to fly up into the air. Jerry looked down and then grabbed on tight to Sora's hair as the prehistoric giantess flew higher and higher. "What are you doing?! Oh my. How are you flying? From my position you should be too fat and heavy to get off the...."

Sora glared at her husband. "One more crack about my weight and I swear that I'm going to drop you." Jerry zipped his lips right before Sora flew over the skyscrapers and right over the police vehicles. "Where are you going... Honey?" asked Jerry to his monstrous wife. The pterodactyl gave a shriek. "I'm going to pay that father of yours a visit. Why should the police be the only ones to tear him limb from limb for this atrocity. Don't try and talk me out of this. I'm going to show him why you don't turn beauty into the beast and get away with it." Sora flew down and Jerry held on tight as he saw his wife flying. "Well," he said. "At least we won't need to buy plane tickets to go to Paris."

Sora flew down in front of Dwight's apartment and bangs on the wall. "Dwight! I'd like to have a word with you, you old bastard!"
11223121222222222222122.title: Atop the Wife's Back

112231212222222222222.content:
Victor Thalassa was waiting in a bar in Chicago as he was looking at his watch. “Where is he?” he asked. “That cargo is dangerous. He said so himself.” Victor then heard a loud belch. “Hey barkeep!” yelled a female voice. “Another round here! Victor is paying!” Victor let out a groan. He had made the mistake of bringing his girlfriend Veronica with him. The woman was the biggest alcoholic ever met. In fact, it was a wonder that she hadn’t died of alcohol poisoning by now. Not to mention she was between jobs, so Victor was usually stuck paying for it. Sure, he could avoid it, being the regional manager of a major chemical company, but he still didn’t like it. He had tried time and time again to get her to stop drinking but it was to no avail.

That was when a mysterious man in a white coat encountered Victor. He appeared to have yellow eyes and a completely shadowed out face. “What took you so long?” asked Victor. “My boss wants that... ooze you said it was.” “Primordial ooze,” said the man in a surprisingly high-pitched voice. “A mysterious slime that existed from the time of dinosaurs, a slime that might hold the keys to evolution itself.” Victor gave a gulp at the dealer. “You know,” he said. “I really don’t know if that stuff is safe. It’s a million years old and it might be unstable. But I’m just the regional manager and I’m only supposed to do what the boss says.” The dealer then gave a hiss as he held out a bottle of the primordial ooze and Victor looked at it. But then the dealer pulled the ooze away and glared. “You have the money?” Victor handed the dealer a suitcase and the dealer quickly looked through all the cash. The dealer hissed and then nodded his head. Then he disappeared.

Victor was actually surprised to see this happen. “I hope I know what I’m getting into.” That was when Victor heard a loud sound that sounded a lot like glass breaking and saw Veronica glaring at a man sipping a drink with a straw as she held her head in pain. “Hey, you jerk! Quiet down! My head feels like it's about to blow!” Victor let out a sigh. "Why did I bring her here, again?" he asked himself. Veronica then grabbed a jar of pickle juice and drank it before gagging. "What kind of beer is this?" "That's pickle juice," said the bartender. "Not beer." "You trying to poison me?!" yelled Veronica. "Ouch! Just get me another glass." Victor walked up to Veronica as she held her head. "Hey, Vick," said Veronica. "Would you believe the gall of these people. I'm here with a painful headache and they're making noise like it's the apocalypse around here." Veronica let out a few hiccups and Victor let out a groan. This was something that happened a lot between him and Veronica.

“Veronica,” said Victor. “You have got to stop drinking. You’re hungover and you’re still drinking.” “Nyah,” groaned Veronica. “A little beer never hurt anybody, Victor.” “Then explain why you license is suspended.” Veronica just huffed and grabbed what she thought was her beer. However, it turned out to be the primordial ooze that Victor had on the bar counter. Victor gasped as he realized exactly what Veronica was doing. “Veronica! Don’t do it!” But Veronica drank the ooze and didn’t seem to register that it wasn’t alcohol and then she let out a large belch. “This is good stuff. You think they have any more?” Victor just bit his lip nervously. “I doubt that,” he said. “I really do.” Victor then gave a gulp. He had no idea what that primordial ooze would do to his girlfriend but it didn’t seem to affect her appetite for alcohol. Victor could only bite his fingers.
112231212222222222222.title: Bad News in a Bottle

1122312122222222222221.content:
Well, even though Veronica’s mind was addled by alcohol, Victor knew that the primordial ooze wasn’t going to be any good for his girlfriend’s health and was trying to pull her out of the bar. “Come on, Vick, you’re such a meanie, I’m perfectly fine, I’m fit as a fiddler.” Veronica even drunkenly swung her fists as she hiccuped. “Yeah,” said Victor. “A fiddle that’s out of tune. You drank something I don’t think you should’ve. We need to get you to a hospital.” “My liver is in the best shape of its life, Vick, Go shang a halami.” Veronica hiccuped again and swayed from side to side. “For some raisin I feel like I could take the Elite Four and Seven Samurai.” Victor shook his head.
