Down the street, Erlking was walking by with his hands in his pockets and a piece of wood in his mouth when a giant feather the size of a car fell in front of his feet. He looked up just in time to see Grey flapping away. "Oh dear," said Erlking with a sigh. "Looks like I goofed again. I wish that didn't always happen but... oh well." With that, Erlking faded away as if to teleport to somewhere else.

Grey was laughing through the air right before she stopped to roost on a large skyscraper, scratching it with her talons and causing it to crack under her enormous butt. She tossed Arnold into the air and he grabbed hold of his wife's blonde hair before placing his feet on her back. "This is fun," said Grey. "And to think, I used to be afraid of heights." "Come on, Grey," groaned Arnold. "Stop fooling around. You know, one would think being turned into an enormous bird would be a lot more traumatizing." Arnold then felt something beneath his foot. From the looks of it, Grey's back had grown a lot more fat. He also saw his enormous bird wife's shadow over several buildings as crowds flocked to look at the huge canary and saw that Grey seemed to have gotten bigger as well as fatter. But Grey was too busy whistling a tune to notice her belly and butt hanging off of her roost.

Before Arnold could put any more thought into the matter, he heard loud flapping yet again and saw that Grey was getting ready for takeoff again. Arnold held on tight as his huge canary wife flew off again. At that time at the glee club, the club president, a rather weedy and ugly looking red-haired young woman with long fingernails was watching as a new recruit was singing a song in Japanese. Everyone else loved the song in the club, but the leader for some reason hated the music. "Rejected." The redhead said. The applicant was shocked and then hung her head down and left. "Come on, Vicky," said one of the male glee club goers. "She sounded pretty good. Even better than you." Vicky gave a glare to intimidate the male club goer. "Nobody is better than me! The nerve of some trash that tries to get in." Vicky then gave an obnoxious laugh. "Like that hussy Grey Nance. Her voice sounds like a cat on drugs." But as Vicky was laughing, everyone heard flapping. "Huh?"

The glee club members walked out and Vicky was leading them right before she looked up to see a large shadow coming down. Before Vicky could get out of the way, she looked in fear as Grey was coming down fast. Everyone gasped at the sight of a huge canary and it was no wonder as Grey seemed to have grown larger than she was before.

Now the canary woman was...
112231212222222222222222232222212.title: Empress-Sized Canary

11223121222222222222222223222222.content:
Our story begins in a mountainous area right above a small town. Atop one mountain was a pale white haired albino woman in a tangerine jumpsuit who was drawing images of wild birds. Her name was Drew Weever and her husband was the town undertaker. However, Drew was surprisingly cheerful and pleasant for somebody who was married to a man with a rather dark and grim profession. At that moment, she was smiling as she drew an image of a bluebird. However, as she looked up, she let out a sigh when she saw a cardinal flying. She looked through her sketchbook and saw the dozens of images of different birds. Some of them were still lives while some were clearly not as they depicted birds such as flamingos, parrots and Japanese cranes that clearly were not indigenous to the area. The fact was, Drew loved birds. This was because they possessed a gift that human beings didn’t, namely, the ability to fly. “Man,” said Drew. “I envy you. All of you.”

Drew walked away and continued to look at her sketchbook as she was pondering to herself. “It’s too bad that humans cannot fly.” She said. She even let out a giggle. However, she then saw a sight that really irked her. Several punks were picking on a middle-aged homeless looking man in green rags and a tin plate mask. “Get out of our town, freak!” yelled one of the punks. “We don’t like your kind around here!” One of the gangsters even tried to steal money from the man. “Oh, come on,” muttered the man. “You’d really steal money from someone like me?” “It’s one thing to have a beggar in town,” said the punk. “But a bad one? This isn’t even enough for me to buy beer. Let’s take him out back and...

Before the goon could finish his sentence, Drew jumped up and kicked him in the head. She then glared at the gang before she violently beat them up. “Get out!” she yelled. The villains scattered as Drew grabbed the one who tried to rob the man in rags and then snatched the money back before kicking the goon in the rear and forcing him to run. Drew then handed the man in rags back his money and took out her wallet to pay him extra. “I’m really sorry about that, sir. People who pick on the homeless oughta be tortured to death.” The man in rags smiled at Drew. “You are a very kind woman. I am Erlking.” “Drew,” said Drew. “Erlking. That’s a strange name.” “I know. I don’t even remember where I got it from. I’ve been around for a very long time.” That was when Erlking noticed Drew looking up at the air at a bird flying through the air. “Oh,” said Erlking. “You wish to be able to fly like birds.” Drew gave a look of surprise. “How did you...?” Erlking nodded his head. “It’s my job to know people’s wishes. I am a granter of wishes.” Drew just let out a laugh at that absurd idea. “Get out of town.” She said. But Erlking shook his head. “I am serious,” he said. “I will grant you your wish to fly, that is, if you want it.”

Drew didn’t know what to think about this development, but still the idea of being able to fly sounded too good to pass up and she let out a giggle. “Okay, Erlking. Hook me up.” Erlking stood on a nearby tree stump in order to cast a spell to grant Drew’s wish. “I say, 1, 2, spell me do,” chanted Erlking. “Let this lady’s wish come true. Here me high, hear me well, let me be this spell.” With that Erlking’s eyes begun to glow bright and magical energy entered Drew’s body. Drew gagged and held her throat as a strange aura surrounded her. She didn’t see it but the aura took the shape of a vulture. “There you are,” said Erlking. “You will soon be able to fly just like a bird.” Drew just raised an eyebrow. “But how will I know it will work.” Erlking gave a sweet smile before he spoke again. “Oh, you’ll know. See you later.” With that, Erlking faded away and disappeared in a pile of rags. Drew chose not to doubt the man as he was clearly a wizard. She smiled because if Erlking was right, then she would soon be able to fly. However, when Drew told Erlking her wish, she failed to be specific about what type of bird and the way you word your wish can be very important as the albino woman was about to learn as she was walking away and sprouting tail feathers.
11223121222222222222222223222222.title: 1, 2, Spell me Do

112231212222222222222222232222221.content:
At that moment, Drew’s husband, Corey was putting together a casket when Drew walked back in. “I’m home.” She said. Corey just continued his work. “You know,” said Corey. “You’re surprisingly chipper for somebody whose husband buries people for a living. It kind of creeps the townspeople out.” Drew then smelt the air and for some reason was aroused. “Has it always smelt so good around here?” she asked. “What is that wonderful aroma?” Corey raised an eyebrow. “This is a funeral parlor,” he said to his wife. “What could you possibly smell that smells good? You usually complain about the smell. Whatever, could you please do me a favor and hand me that file.” Drew walked over to get the file for her husband, not realizing that her ass seemed to have gotten bigger.

“So who died this time?” asked Drew. Corey let out a grumble. “Nobody who will be missed in my opinion. You remember that other undertaker from the next town over. He was found beaten to death.” “Who killed him?” “I dunno. Probably the corpse of one of his clients. I never liked him that much anyway. He had no respect for the dead. I don’t think he even used embalming fluid. I also heard a rumor he killed somebody. Oh well. Gotta make the right coffin. Not like one of those cheap pine coffins he used to sell. So how was your day? Draw any good birds lately.” Drew let out a laugh. “I met a very nice but very strange man who asked me for my wish and I told him I wished to be able to fly like a bird. He said he’d grant it.” “Sounds to me like a crackpot. There’s no such thing as a wish granter. I think you’ve been out in the sun too long, Drew.” “Some sun would do you good, Corey,” said Drew as she was walking up to her husband with the metal file. “I’m albino. What’s your excuse?”

Corey just rolled his eyes. Given how grim he was and how perky his wife was, people didn’t see any reason how they could’ve gotten together in the first place. Drew then bent over to hand Corey the file in order to properly prepare the coffin. “Here you go, Sweetie.” “Thanks... Drew.” Corey looked to see that Drew was several heads taller than he was now and appeared to be somewhat pear-shaped as well. “What the?” asked the mortician in regards to his wife. Before Drew could walk away, Corey grabbed her by the ass cheeks and made her grunt. “These are a lot thicker than I remember,” said Corey. “I thought you were on a diet.” Then Corey found something really puzzling that seemed to worry him. It was what appeared to be a grayish brown feather and then he pulled it out, Drew screamed in pain. “Careful, Corey.” Corey gave a befuddled and very afraid look. “Uh, Drew,” he said. “Exactly what did you say to this wish master.” “Well,” said Drew. “I wished only to be able to fly like a bird. Why?”

Then Drew begun to twitch as she ran out of the house. “Drew!” yelled Corey in shock. Something really strange was happening to Drew. First her belly and breasts expanded wide enough to break the zipper on her jumpsuit and then her legs expanded into thighs as thick as mammoth pumpkins as the feathers above her growing ass were growing more and more. Drew then obtained a rather noticeable hunch in her back as her neck stretched out. The albino woman let out a shriek as her mouth extended into a black beak. A collar of white feathers appeared around Drew’s neck before gray-colored feathers were soon growing all over her body, everywhere except for over her neck. Then her boots ripped apart to reveal sharp talons as feathers grew on her arms to turn them into wings. Drew was also getting bigger and bigger until the house only reached up to her knee. “Oh my gosh!” yelled a very afraid Corey.

By the time Drew’s transformation was complete, she was an 80ft tall humanoid vulture with a 110ft wide ass, a 125ft wide stomach, H-cup breasts and several chins in her neck. She looked around and stretched out her wings as she looked at her new body in pure fear. “She’s a vulture,” thought Corey as he looked at his mutated wife. “My wife is a giant vulture, a giant vulture fatter than a hippopotamus. Oh no. That wish granter must’ve been real after all. She did say she wanted to fly like a bird. Dammit. A vulture IS a bird. Damn literal.” Corey then looked up at his enormous vulture wife. “Uh, Drew? Are you feeling okay?”
112231212222222222222222232222221.title: Vultures in the Plain

choices: The Telephone Inside the House Rings
The Town Makes Drew Into a Tourist Trap
1122312122222222222222222322222211.content:
Drew breathed heavily as she looked at her new vulture body and begun to sweat as she bit her beak slightly. “What went wrong? I don’t understand this.” “Well, I do,” said Corey. “That’s the problem with people who grant wishes. You have to be very careful what you say. You told this Erlking character that you wanted to be able to fly like a bird. So he turned you into a bird. Since you weren’t specific, he turned you into the one bird that would make the most sense for the wife of an undertaker.” Drew held her head and groaned. “I get it,” she said. “I get it. I’m an idiot.” Corey let out a sigh. “You’re not an idiot, Drew. But your fascination with birds just reached its pinnacle. The neighbors are going to stare you know. It’s really not considered healthy for someone of my occupation to be married to a vulture. It’s bad enough that a certain French comic depicts undertakers keeping vultures as pets.” Drew just felt around her body and snapped her beak. “Being a vulture, I could probably get used to. Being a giant vulture, it might not be so bad. But why oh why did that stupid Erlking have to make me so fat.” Drew’s movements caused her jumpsuit to finally rip to shreds and reveal that she wore no undergarments underneath. Drew shrieked and tried to cover up, but then she realized something. “What am I worried about? I have feathers.” Drew let out a laugh as Corey let out a groan and looked to see that Drew bursting through the roof had totally wrecked the funeral parlor and he then looked up with a stare. “Somehow,” he said. “I don’t think our insurance covers up damages made by vultures.”

Suddenly, Drew’s 125ft wide stomach growled and the vulture giantess rubbed it. “I guess mutations give you the munchies,” said Drew. “I am starving. Oh gross. I’m a vulture now! That means I’m gonna have to eat carrion. Yuck!” “Don’t panic, Dear,” said Corey. “No wife of Corey Weever is going to eat a corpse, even if she’s a vulture as big as Godzilla. Just stay here and I’ll get you something to eat.” Corey was almost out the door when he stopped himself. “And don’t eat Mr. Thoreau’s body while I’m gone. It wouldn’t look good for an undertaker to feed the corpses under his care to a giant obese bird. Besides, I’ve already embalmed him. You’d poison yourself.” Drew gave an angry shriek at her husband. “Give me some credit, Corey,” said the vulture titaness. “I’ve got some self-control.” “I’m just making myself clear.” Said Corey. Corey kissed his wife at the tip of her beak before walking out. Drew let out a squawk as she was walking around the remains of the funeral home right before she sat down on the part of the house where she and her husband lived before her transformation.

“Does he really think that I have so little self-control that I’d actually resort to eating a human? We’ve been married for so long that you’d think he’d have some faith in me?” Drew then opened up her wings and saw that she now had a 200ft wide wingspan. “Hmm,” she said. “Well, Erlking did grant my wish to be able to fly like a bird, no matter how utterly literal, misguided and clueless he was with the results. Since I’m going to be a bird, I might as well get used to these wings. Heck, this is the reason I made the wish in the first place.” Drew then heard a cracking and got up off of her seat. “Uh-oh,” she said. “Corey’s not going to like it if my ass crushes the main part of the house. I better get to work on an alternate dwelling.” Drew flapped her wings and the vulture giantess flew up into the sky. On the ground, there was a birdwatcher with thick goggles who was observing a rare golden-cheeked warbler and sketching the creature.” However, the warbler suddenly flew off in fear. The birdwatcher mumbled in confusion before he looked back and gasped as Drew’s shadow was cast straight over him.

In the process, one of the enormous vulture woman’s feathers fell. The birdwatcher ran up towards the colossal feather and saw that it was as big as himself. “Incredible,” he said. “This feather is huge. But that’s impossible. The largest flying birds to ever exist were the Teratornithidae family of prehistoric vultures. Teratorns have been extinct since the Pleistocene era. But this feather looks like it comes from a creature even larger than a teratorn. What kind of a bird is flying around here?” While that birdwatcher was pondering what could’ve been flying around. Drew flew into a clearing and started to use her rather enormous beak to tear out several trees from the ground as she gave a loud shriek. “I’m definitely not going to wreck the house again,” thought the vulture woman to herself. “If I’m gonna be a bird, I know what I have to do first and foremost."

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Meanwhile, Corey was at the butcher's shop and had bought up most of the stock. "Buddy," said the butcher. "Is there any reason why you're buying so much meat? There's enough food here for a dinosaur." "You wouldn't believe me if I told you." Said Corey. The butcher's assistant ran forward carrying a small leg of lamb. "This is the last edible thing that hasn't been unfrozen, Sir." "Well, Harold," said the butcher. "Looks like we're closing early today." As Corey handed his debit card to the butcher, he noticed a man brooding outside." "What's with that guy?" he asked. The butcher let out a sigh. "He's having marital trouble. His wife and him haven't been getting along well." Corey gave a scoff. "That's nothing compared to the trouble I've seen. My wife is a vulture." "I see. Married a real gold digger, did you." “No,” said Corey. “I mean she’s literally a vulture. A big, fat, fat, fat vulture.” The butcher and his assistant looked at Corey in concern. “Uh,” said Harold. “Exactly what line of work are you in?” Corey didn’t know exactly what to say and just bit his lip. “I’m a.... a mortician.” With that, he left the butcher shop and the butcher let out a sigh. “Undertakers,” he said. “They’re lonely men. They don’t have a lot of options so they scrape the bottom of the barrel. Still, they serve a purpose, just like the vultures.”

Soon, Corey was driving back home with the meat and let out a sigh. “I hope Drew hasn’t dug up any graves in her hunger. That would seriously make me look like an incompetent undertaker. What a day. I really hope I can get used to this.” Suddenly, Corey came to a stop because Erlking walked out into the road. Erlking screamed as he was nearly run over.” Corey drove to the side and then parked the car before running out to confront Erlking. “Look before you cross the road, dumbwad!” yelled Corey. “I’ve got enough problems today without...”

Suddenly Corey stopped mid-sentence as Erlking was waving his hands. “I’m sorry,” he said. “Erlking was just...” “Erlking?!” yelled Corey. “Aha! So you turned my wife into a vulture!” Erlking gulped. “Oh dear,” he said. “It happened again. I’m bad at this.” Corey raised an eyebrow. “Happened again? What do you mean?” “It happens whenever I grant a wish. I don’t try to do it, but my magic just has a mind of its own.” Corey was now horrified beyond belief. “You mean to tell me that my wife isn’t the only one of your mutated victims? You jerk! Fix it right now!” “I can’t,” said Erlking. “Once I grant a wish, I can’t grant a wish to undo the wish. I'm afraid that the damage is permanent." Corey was so mad that he was just about ready to punch Erlking but he stopped himself. "You're supremely lucky I've got bigger birds to fry. Get out of town. I never want to see you again, you troublemaker." Erlking nodded his head nervously and teleported away. Then Corey let out a sigh. "Well," he said. "It looks like I'm going to have to break the bad news to Drew."

Once Corey was back home, he saw several spectators gathering around. "What the?" Corey looked to see several people staring out and taking photographs. "What's going on here?" One of the young men from the crowd turned and faced the mortician. "You've got to see it," he said. "It's the biggest vulture I've ever seen." Corey looked up and was completely dumbfounded by what he saw. Drew was gathering trees, barbed wire and crushed cars and appeared to be building a nest atop the biggest mountain within range. "Drew!" yelled Corey. "What the Sam Hell are you doing!?" Drew had to wait to answer Corey because she had a broken down truck in her mouth that needed to be put down. "What does it look like, Honey?" asked Drew. "I'm building a nest. You don't seriously expect me to fit in our bed and house anymore." "Drew! The neighbors are literally staring." Drew gave a scoff. "Well," she said. "You got to admit, a vulture as big as a Megazord isn't the easiest creature to hide. What do you expect?"

The crowd was even more surprised. "A talking vulture?" "Wait, did he say that vulture was his wife?" "Isn't he the undertaker." "Undertakers are creepy guys, but I didn't think anyone would be creepy enough to marry a giant buzzard." Corey slapped himself in the face and grumbled. "First of all, a vulture and a buzzard aren't the same thing. Second of all, she wasn't a vulture this morning. Some idiot turned her into a vulture because she wanted to fly like a bird." The crowd didn't appear to hear Corey and just started to take photographs. Drew let out a sigh as she continued building her nest. "There goes the neighborhood." Corey shook his head and let out a groan. "Oh sure," he said. "My customers can rest in peace, but we'll never get a day of peace with all this commotion."

To make matters an even bigger headache for the Weevers....
1122312122222222222222222322222211.title: The Biggest Vulture in the World

choices: Drew Obliges and Flies Corey to City Hall
Too Late! The First Tour Group Arrives
11223121222222222222222223222222112.content:
A few days later, Drew had settled into her nest and was snoring away. Corey on the other hand couldn’t sleep at all with an 80ft vulture wife snoring. He was shaking in bed. Since Drew could no longer fit in it, Corey had the bed to himself and as a consequence he wasn’t used to the extra space. The very next day, Corey was drinking an extra large cup of coffee as Drew was busy with something she scrounged for breakfast. “You know, Corey,” said the ginormous vulture to her tiny husband. “You would sleep very tightly in the nest.” Drew smirked and shook her 110ft wide feathered booty. Corey just gave a scoff. “You may not be a human being any more but I still am. It’s bad enough that people know I’m married to a vulture. It’s bad press for an undertaker to be married to....”

Corey then saw Drew munching and was horrified. “What the **** are you eating!” Drew just swallowed what was in her mouth before speaking. “Don’t rightfully know. I found it in the woods. I think it was a bear given the size. Hard to tell. I think some other scavengers got to it first.” Corey gagged and turned his head to vomit. “That is disgusting!” Drew let out a slight burp. “Well,” said Drew. “I’m a vulture. Vultures eat dead things.” Corey grumbled. “Drew! I handle the dead for a living! I’m a mortician! Do you have any idea how bad for business it would be if people knew my wife was a scavenger!? Nobody wants their deceased to be fed to a giant bird.” Drew gave a scoff. “What do I look like? A cannibal? Geez, you’re such a pessimist.” “When you do what I do, Drew, it’s hard to be optimistic about anything.” Drew just let out a sigh.

Suddenly there was the sound of hammers pounding away. “What the?!” yelled Corey. Corey immediately ran to check out the noise and realized it was coming from a couple of construction workers pounding in a rather large billboard. Corey looked up and read the billboard. “Come, see the largest vulture in the world. What?!” The billboard depicted a more stylized version of Drew and depicted the giant obese vulture woman chewing on what looked like a skeleton of Godzilla or at least a similar dinosaur. “What!?” Corey rushed to the foreman just as Drew flew overhead and cast an enormous shadow. Drew tried to perch on a nearby mountain only to have it come apart underneath her big butt. She had to flap her enormous wings as she could just to avoid falling flat on her ass.

“What the hell is going on?!” yelled Corey to the foreman. The foreman lit a cigar right before he coughed. “We have orders from Mayor Baldwin. He thinks that your blimp of a wife is good for publicity.” “Say what?!” The foreman coughed a few more times before he held his throat. “We’re looking at the world’s largest vulture. Your old lady makes the California condor look like a chickadee.” Drew let out a laugh at that idea and even blushed but Corey wasn’t laughing. “That’s not cool,” he said. “She’s my wife! Not a sideshow freak!” "Don't shoot the messenger, man. Think about it. It could put the eggs through college." The foreman laughed at his own joke as Corey let out an angry yell into his hat.

That comment really shook Drew up. "Oh my gosh, Corey. I never thought about it like that." "We don't have kids, Drew." "Not yet," said Drew as she held her beak down to her husband's level. "But we could one day." "Drew," said Corey. "Don't you find it more pressing that the town wants to turn you into a laughing stock." Corey was walking to the car when Drew stepped in front of him, her belly pressing against the ground. "Calm down, Corey. Don't you think you're being too hasty." "You don't see the gravity of this. Nobody will take you seriously after this. If I have to, I'll fly to city hall to complain to Baldwin!"
11223121222222222222222223222222112.title: Tourist Trap

112231212222222222222222232222221121.content:
Drew let out a squawk and then held one of the flabby wings down as Corey looked up at his vulture wife in surprise. Drew shook her large booty and smirked as well as she could with a beak. Corey realized exactly what he said and gave a groan. "Drew," he said. "I didn't mean that literally. If you think I'm... Ah!" Before the undertaker could finish his sentence, his wife grabbed him by the back of his collar with her beak and then tossed him onto her back. Corey slid down and then grabbed a hold of one of Drew's tail feathers and laid his other hand against his vulture wife's mountainous ass before he heard wings flapping.

"Oh no, oh no, Drew. You are not..." But before Corey could reason with his wife, Drew flapped her wings and flew up into air above the mountains. Corey looked down and nearly had a heart attack as he saw the entire town miles below. Drew let out a laugh at her minuscule husband's fear. "What's the matter, Hun? Don't tell me you're afraid of heights." Corey let out a grumble and climbed the vulture's enormous booty. "If I wasn't before, I sure as heck am now. Just get us to city hall so I can complain."

Drew gave a shriek and then flew down. Over town, everyone stared at the vulture giantess flying down. One old man dressed as a birdwatcher was drawing pigeons in the park when he spotted the enormous and obese bird and dropped his teeth before he switched the sketchpad and tried to draw the giant vulture. Drew flew down and landed on the street, creating a giant dent in the road the shape of her behind. She then looked in embarrassment to see that she flattened a truck. Corey let out a sigh. "When the owner gets back. Tell him to send me a bill. I'm going to have a talk with Mayor Baldwin."

Drew shrieked and nodded her head as her husband entered city hall. She then started to pick at her feathers with her beak while Corey gave a grimace. Corey walked up to the secretary and pounded his fist on the table. "I'd like a word with Baldwin. Corey Weever. Undertaker." "Right this way, Sir." "I know the way!" Corey kicked the door open and confronted the mayor. "Baldwin! You have no right to make an exhibit out of Drew!" Mayor Baldwin held up his head and looked at Corey in fear. Corey's undertaker outfit made him look like a western ghoul and it didn't help that he was angry.

"Come on, Weever," said Mayor Baldwin. "Don't you go blowing your top. Sure, your wife's condition is unfortunate but she doesn't seem to think so. Besides, you can't hide a vulture as big as the Chrysler Building. People will find out sooner or later, so why not find a way to profit off of it. This could put our town on the map. After all, Oakhaven has the world’s biggest turkey. We’ve got the world’s largest vulture.” Mayor Baldwin gave a laugh and held up a t-shirt of a vulture sitting on the Earth. However, Corey wasn’t amused. “That vulture just happens to be my wife!” “Listen,” said Baldwin. “Weever. I happen to know you’re a mortician. Vultures eat carrion don’t they? Who would trust a mortician whose wife could and would eat his “clients”.”

“First of all,” said Corey. “Drew is still human on the inside and is not a cannibal. Second of all...” There was suddenly a crashing noise. Both Drew and the mayor looked up and spotted the ceiling cracked and a part of Drew’s feathered butt sticking out. The two men looked outside to see that Drew had tried to roost on city hall and cracked the ceiling in the process. Corey looked in surprise while everyone around took photographs.

“Wait,” said Mayor Baldwin. “She looks fatter than I thought she was. And bigger.” Corey looks up and his eyes pop out because indeed Drew’s height and weight both rose and her stomach at the point was both obstructing traffic and pressing against a bank wall at the same time. She was bigger than she was just five minutes ago, but by how much...
112231212222222222222222232222221121.title: Fly to City Hall

112231212222222222222222232222222.content:
Our story begins during football practice at a college called Red Rhodes University. The quarterback was getting ready. “Hut, hut, hike!” The quarterback tossed the ball to one of his men but that young man grunted before collapsing on the ground. The quarterback let out a groan. “Come on, Waterman. We have a game tomorrow.” “What’s the point, Armstrong? It’s been a lousy season. The Chickenhawks haven’t won a game all year.” Armstrong bit himself in the lip before he spoke again. “Okay,” he said. “Okay. I know that we haven’t been having the best season, but come on, people! We have a game coming up and we have no time for pessimists.”  It was there eight cheerleaders showed up and the leader was Armstrong’s girlfriend, Dory. She was a tall and very buxom young woman with red-orange hair as she shook her pom-poms. “Chickenhawks sore through the sky, the other team will drop and die. When we swoop down today, the football field we’ll find our prey! Go chickenhawks!” Armstrong let out a sigh. “At least somebody is being optimistic.” Dory ran up to Armstrong and grabbed her boyfriend’s arm. “The only reason you guys haven’t been winning is because you guys forgot how to think like real winners. Just try and be positive, Armstrong.” Armstrong let out a scoff. “Are you kidding me, Dory? Let’s face it. We can practice all we want but these mopers have a point. And tomorrow we go up against the Gladiators. They’ll slaughter us. I appreciate your support, Dory. But nothing is going to save the chickenhawks now. Come on, Chickenhawks, let’s take five.”

Soon, Dory was with her friends, Reika and Michelle and were walking through town. “Your boyfriend is being a real grouch lately.” Said Reika as she licked her ice cream. “Well, Reika,” said Dory. “He’s under a lot of stress. The chickenhawks were unbeatable when Armstrong’s dad went to school but now, they’ve been facing a losing streak for 10 years and now that Armstrong is in college he’s taken it upon himself to get the hawks back on track.” “Come on, Dory,” said Michelle as she brushed her blonde hair. “The chickenhawks haven’t been doing so well lately and that’s why Armstrong is so grumpy.”

“You know what the problem is,” said Dory. “The problem is bad luck. What we need is a good luck charm in order to raise people’s spirits.” “Tough luck, Dory,” said Michelle. “I spent my lucky penny by mistake the other day. Besides, where are you going to find a four leaf clover?” Reika then pointed to a shop. “That shop looks interesting.” Up ahead there was a shop that had voodoo dolls, strange charms, jars with strange alien skeletons inside and a minotaur’s skull laying on the center of the table. Michelle gave a shiver. “I don’t know,” she said. “That looks like an evil shop.” However, Dory looked in and say an Egyptian looking necklace of a hawk’s eye and gave a smile. “What better good luck charm for the Chickenhawks?” she asked.
112231212222222222222222232222222.title: GO! Chickenhawks

1122312122222222222222222322222221.content:
Dory walked in and the next minute, she had bought the eye necklace and put it around her neck. Reika and Michelle looked on as their leader gave a smug grin. “The eye of Horus,” she said. “It brings good luck. Armstrong’s team needs all the luck that they can get.” “Oh come on, Dory,” said Michelle with a laugh. “We’re not so desperate that we have to rely on superstition do we?” “At this point, Michelle, yeah.” Said Reika. As the trio walked away, the eye around Dory’s neck was glowing brightly.

But Dory didn’t think about that and instead, she walked out in order to continue with cheer practice. All 8 of the cheerleaders were practicing ferociously but Dory was leaping higher than the other girls. “Would you look at that,” said a Hispanic girl. “Dory is jumping higher and higher. She looks like she could fly. “Don’t be ridiculously, Faith,” said an African girl. “It’s a placebo effect. She thinks that the necklace works and so it does.” “But, Layla,” said Reika. “I don’t think any amount of cheering is going to do any good for the Chickenhawks.” Dory jumped down and confronted Reika. “I heard that Reika. Any more negative attitude and you’re suspended from the squad. Okay girls. Since Horus is guiding us, we’re going to do an old favorite. The human pyramid. Line up. We’re going to give it all we got.”

The girls all did as their leader commanded and lined up for the human pyramid. Four of the girls jumped back first as Reika, Faith and Michelle jumped into their hands. Finally Dory jumped up and then landed on their hands. However, the girls grunted and then fell back and Dory grunted as she landed butt first on Reika. “OMG! Are you girls okay?” Reika groaned and then got up. Then she gasped. “Dory,” she said. “You might want to look at your caboose.”

Dory looked back and gasped because not only had her ass expanded exponentially, but she also had sprouted bright reddish brown tailfeathers. Reika and Michelle ran up to Dory as Dory started to grow taller. “Dory,” said Reika. “What’s wrong?” Dory slapped her ass as the eye necklace around her neck glowed brightly. “So, my butt is getting bigger. Armstrong will like that. He always said it was his favorite part of... urk!” Then Dory looked and saw that her belly and breasts were following and her neck got much thicker as she sprouted a triple chin and then she felt more feathers growing all over her body as she appeared to be getting bigger. “Oh my gosh,” said Reika. “This is not normal.” Dory then saw her shoes slip off and her socks get torn off as her feet turned into large and sharp talons and her legs stretched out into thunder thighs. “Oh no,” groaned Dory. “This is why I hate Mondays.” With that, Dory’s mouth turned into a sharp beak with a black tip.

The rest of the cheer squad looked at their sorority leader and saw that Dory had been transmogrified into a 60ft tall anthropomorphic and Egyptian looking chicken hawk. She had two F-cup breasts that her shirt was barely containing, a 90ft wide butt that completely murdered her skirt, an 80ft wide belly and thighs big enough to crush elephants. The rest of the cheer squad looked in shock and Dory herself was surprised and then held up her necklace. She took it off, believing that it would undo the spell but it didn’t and she was still a hawk. “Dory?” asked Michelle. “Are you alright?” Dory just smiled and then let out a laugh. “Uh, Dory?” asked Reika. “Dory just flew into the air and revealed her 135ft wingspan as she perched onto the dorm building, her fat ass completely shading it. “Oh,” said Dory. “I’m more than alright. This is awesome. Wait until the football team sees that their head cheerleader now doubles as the mascot. If I could find enough material, I can dress as an Egyptian goddess and then we’d really be jumping.”

Dory let out a laugh as Michelle held up one of the hawk giantess’s feathers that was now as big as a human being. “Dory,” said the blonde. “You do realize this will take some getting used to, right?” Dory just gave a smug grin. “Call me...”
1122312122222222222222222322222221.title: Eye of Horus

1122312122222222222222222322222222.content:
It happened in Paris where a woman with pinkish purple hair worn in a ponytail was walking down the street. Her name was Marie Delacroix and she was a food critic, a new American-style restaurant called Zoogie Burgers opened up across the street and she was hired to check it out. “I was looking forward to American cuisine for a long time,” the French woman said to herself. “However, it is my job to determine the worth of this eatery. Marie walked in and saw that the restaurant looked like a standard 1950s restaurant but what worried her was that there was nobody there. “This does not look promising.” She said.

The owner then walked out and let out a laugh. He was a tall and very hairy man with a mustache and from the looks of it, he hadn’t showered for days and Marie held her nose at the sight of him. “Welcome to Zoogie Burgers,” he said. “I’m Zoogie. May I take your order?” “Oui. Ma nom est Marie Delacroix. Food critic.” “Oh,” said Zoogie. “Then this is my chance at the big time if you like my burgers. Don’t worry, I’ll find you something good. Just wait here.” Marie did that and looked around to see paintings of American cartoon characters from the early half of the 20th Century. Marie heard chopping and was very much not looking forward to whatever Zoogie was doing in the kitchen but then sighed at the décor. “I personally prefer European cartoons. I wonder who’s more popular in America? Luke or Asterix?”

It was there there was a loud sound and Zoogie came back with food. “There you are! Ostrich burgers, specialty of the house.” Marie looked at the burgers and was not confident with the quality of the brugers. “Excusez-moi,” said Marie. “But aren’t ostrich burgers illegal in this area.” Zoogie just gave a nervous laugh. “I won’t tell if you don’t tell.” Marie just shrugged her shoulders and then bit into the burger. However, she immediately regretted it and gagged because something about the burger was not doing her tastebuds any good. What Marie couldn’t have known was that A) the ostrich burgers were indeed made out of actual ostrich meat but it was made out of ostrich meat that had been improperly handled and was sitting next to tanks of what appeared to be toxic waste and had been out in the sun too long. That combined with Zoogie’s poor cooking had violently upset Marie’s stomach and she held herself in pain. “Oh, please don’t sue me!” yelled Zoogie. Marie just held her stomach in pain. “I really don’t think that I need to taste anything else.”

Marie groaned and then jumped out of her seat as Zoogie tried to stop her. “Wait!” yelled Zoogie. “You’re making a horrible mistake.” Marie groaned. “The only mistake that I ever made was eating your horrid cooking. You can expect a rather nasty review for your restaurant, Monsieur Zoogie. Oh.” Marie stormed out of the restaurant and Zoogie pulled on his hair. “Dammit!” he yelled. “Another dud! I gave up plumbing for this?” Marie just continued to groan as she was walking away from the restaurant. “I better tell Henri that I’m not going to be in the mood for cooking tonight. Ugh. He and the kids will just have to order… ow. Oh, as soon as I’m done calling Henri, I’m calling the health department to shut that eyesore restaurant down.”

However, as Marie typed on her cell phone, indigestion was going to be the least of her problems. In fact, she didn’t notice but her rear end was getting larger and fatter as she walked away and her legs were getting as long as ostrich legs.
1122312122222222222222222322222222.title: Ostrich Anyone?

choices: Marie Was Still Hiding Her Head in the Ground
Marie's Stomach had Recovered and She was Hungry
11223121222222222222222223222222221.content:
Marie’s stomach continued to gurgle as she held her stomach. “Sacre bleu,” she said as she walked down Champs Élysées. “J’ai mal au ventre. Zoogie should be in prison for selling such tainted and putrid food.” Marie then groaned again. “I feel so bloated.” Marie had no idea how spot on she was because she was getting bigger and more bloated with every step. Her skirt tore apart and revealed the panties trying to cover her enormous ass. However, her hips were the part of her that were growing at the most rapid rate and her nylon stockings were tearing apart.

But she wasn't just getting fatter. Marie's body was changing. Her neck was slowly getting longer and fatter and bright colored reddish brown feathers were growing all over her body and she sprout long fluffy white feathers on her butt. Her feet also turned into talons like those of a bird. Of course, these changes went completely unnoticed by the French food critic as she took out her cellphone to contact her husband Henri, all while she was holding her stomach in absolute pain.

"Bonjour, Henri. C'est moi. Ça va? Moi, J'ai mal au ventre. I ate at a restaurant run by a man named Zoogie who is less qualified to be a restauranteur than a bathroom attendant. He fed me ostrich burgers that were so rotten that the flies wouldn't even touch them. I might even have to go to the hospital. Listen, I'm not going to be in the mood to cook tonight, so please tell Marcel and Chantal that you'll have to order out. I don't care. Order a pizza or something. I won't be ready to eat for some time. My stomach is killing me. Au revoir."

Marie let out a groan as she held her stomach in absolute pain and hung up. She saw a pub up ahead and then ran in as she yelled. Everyone looked at her and saw her run into the bathroom. She was about to reach a stall when she twitched and got on her knees. Feathers sprouted all over her body as she became more and more bloated. "I think I might just be allergic to ostrich meat." Then, Marie squawked and her mouth turned into a beak as her neck elongated. Outside, there were several people tapping on the bathroom door. "Mademoiselle? Mademoiselle, are you alright?"

Marie then stood up and her panties tore apart revealing a patch of black feathers that had grown to resemble a pair of small shorts on thick meaty grayish pink legs like those of an ostrich. Marie then felt her butt expand and knock the sinks off the wall as water came bursting down the pipes. Marie then squawked because her belly got larger and larger and pushed into the stalls, breaking them down. Her neck expanded and her breasts got bigger as her arms turned into wing with clawed, feathered hands. She coughed a few times and then she started to grow until she burst through the pub's roof and everyone outside the pub looked up and saw a sight that made them stop and stare.

Marie had transformed into a giant anthropomorphic ostrich. She stood 80ft tall (110 if you included her thick neck), 3 chins, a 90ft wide butt and 100ft wide belly that crushed the rest of the pub, forcing the patrons to run out. Marie looked at herself in horror. "Zut alors! Un grand autruche!" "She is huge! But I saw her entering the bathroom and she was a human." "What is this world coming too."

Marie let out a groan and looked at her new body. "Those ostrich burgers were even worse than I thought. I've been poisoned! Oh! And my stomach still hurts." Marie waddled up to a nearby river and stuck her head into the water in order to swallow as much as she could to heal her stomach. Marie took her long neck out of the water and then gargled before she stomped away. She then reached into what was left of her jacket to take out her cellphone to call her husband.

Henri was at home watching the television with their children, Marcel and Chantal and they looked in shock at what they were watching on the television because it was video footage of the giant obese ostrich woman stomping through Paris holding her stomach in pain. Henri and his children had their jaws dropped and then the phone rang and Henri answered it. "Bonjour?" "Bonjour, Henri," said Marie. "You aren't going to believe me, but I've somehow turned into a giant ostrich from really bad cuisine." "Oh," said Henri. "I believe you, Marie." On the television, the ostrich giantess was holding up her cell phone.

"Papa," said Marcel. "Is Mama going to be okay?" "Je ne connais pas, Marcel," said Henri. "I have never seen a case of food poisoning this bad." Chantal then took the phone from her father. "Chantal! What are you doing?" Chantal then talked with her mutated mother on the phone. "Mama," she said. "I think you need to see a doctor. You look severely ill." Marie groaned before she sat down on a large building and spoke with her daughter. "Tell me something I don't know, Chantal. I feel like I'm either going to fart a hurricane or lay an egg as big as the Eiffel Tower. But I think it's getting better, I think that...."

That was when the ostrich giantess held her stomach in pain and then let out a loud fart. Everyone around her looked in disgust and Marie blushed in embarrassment before running out of the city limits and then she ducked her head in the ground. She gave a moan. "This truly is the lowest point of my life. From a food critic to the world's largest bird." As the ostrich giantess had her head in the ground, the rest of the Delacroix family drove to look for their matriarch. Henri was driving their car when Marcel looked out and spotted something. "Papa, look!" What Marcel spotted was Zoogie at his restaurant.

Zoogie was being pulled away in handcuffs. "Oh come on! That meat was only left out for two weeks. How was I supposed to know the chemicals I was using were harmful. I had no idea it would turn that lady into an ostrich." "Well," said Chantal. "It serves him right. He turned Mama into a big bird." "Well," said Henri. "I hope that wife of mine is doing well. Wherever she is."

Out in the forest at the time...
11223121222222222222222223222222221.title: An Ostrich in Paris

11223121222222222222222223222222222.content:
“Now don’t you let the coach give you any guff,” said Janet Monroe to her nine-year old son. “I have a thing to say about him. My son, the goalie. That’s no position for a Monroe. Sit up straight in the car. You don’t want people to make you think you were raised in a barn.” “Sorry, Mom.” Groaned Cole. Janet was driving her son to soccer practice. Cole didn’t even like soccer but Janet bullied him into joining. The fact was, Cole had the extreme misfortune to have been born to the ultimate soccer mom.” Janet’s husband was with them and looked at Cole in sympathy. “Dear,” said Taylor. “Don’t you think you’re being too hard on Cole? So what if he’s not the most athletic kid in the world.” “That’s the problem, Taylor,” said Janet to her husband. “Lack of exercise leads to health problems and I will not have my child spending his school year in the emergency room.” Cole rolled his eyes in the back. He resented his mother for being so overdramatic and acting to control him. He would like to see how she felt when something happened that she couldn’t control.

Soon the Monroes arrived at soccer practice and Taylor and Janet walked out to talk to the coach. Before Taylor could say a single word, Janet butt in. “I would like to know why you made my son goalie instead of captain. His grandfather was the football captain when he was in school, my brother was captain before…” “Mrs. Monroe, I already told you, Cole has weak legs.” Said the coach. The coach then lowered his voice. “Not to mention a weak will from dealing with you all the time.” Janet stomped her foot. “You listen here. It’s your fault. If you worked towards improving upon the weakness, my son would have a future, but no, you had to just be apathetic…” As Janet was giving an earful, the rest of the soccer team was staring and one turned to face Cole in embarrassment. “Boy, Cole. Your mom sure is mean.” “You don’t know the half of it.” Thought Cole.

Taylor then pushed Janet to the side to speak with the coach. “Janet,” he said. “Perhaps we should let me speak to Coach Delgado.” Janet gave a glare and stomped away before she got in the car and drove off. “I don’t have to deal with this,” she said. “I’m late for the bake sale anyway.” In the back of the car was a blackberry pie. Coach Delgado glared at Taylor. “You need to stand up for yourself more. That harpy needs a big fat kick in the fanny treating you and Cole like that.” “She’s not all bad,” said Taylor. “I mean, she wants what’s best for…” “She wants what she THINKS is best for Cole. She’s not letting him live his own life.”

Janet overheard the coach and then drove forward rather angrily. She parked the car and then let out a scream. Janet then turned her head to learn that nearby, there was a man in green rags and a metal mask rooting through the trash. “Come on,” said the man. “I saw that pizza boy drop you. I know you’re in there, come to Erlking.” Janet scoffed. “I’ll bet that you don’t have to worry about your child’s performance in soccer.” Erlking turned his head and looked in confusion at Janet. “What do you mean, lady?” he asked. “It’s my son,” said Janet. “He’s not the captain of the soccer team. The coach said he had weak legs. What does he expect from substandard equipment?” Erlking nodded his head and then he took out a slice of pizza from the trash. “So, you want him to get stronger.” Janet nodded her head. “For the Amarillo High Amadillos, they need a much bigger and harder ball. I wish I knew where to buy one.” Erlking noticed the pie in Janet’s car and smirked. “Paid in full!” he yelled.

Janet turned and saw Erlking grabbing the pie and yelled. “Hey! Come back with that pie for the bake sale you dirty hobo!” Erlking saw Janet chasing after him and had to run as he cast his spell with a mouth full of pie. “1, 2, Spell me too. Let this woman’s wish come true. Hear me high, hear me well. Let me be this spell.” Erlking faded away as Janet grit her teeth. “Why you no good.” Suddenly, Janet grunted and then felt her butt expanding. “Oh no,” she said. “What’s going on?” That was when Janet turned to see her back was getting bigger and then looked into her mirror and screamed as she saw her face turning into that of an armadillo.
11223121222222222222222223222222222.title: The Ultimate Soccer Mom

112231212222222222222222232222222221.content:
Janet looked in horror at the face in her mirror. "What happened to my face?! I look like an armadillo! I'll bet that it was that bum. With all the trash that's coming into this town, it makes it hard for decent people to breathe. I'll fix his wagon." Janet took out her phone not realizing that her back was expanding, to say nothing of the rest of her.

"Hello," said Janet. "Sheriff? This is Janet Monroe and I'd like to report a crime. A dirty, haggard, ugly, homeless man in a horned mask and green rags just stole the blackberry pie that I made for the bake sale and then he made my face look like an armadillo's. No I am not drunk! It happened just as I dropped off my son for soccer practice! Are you threatening me!? Listen here, you bumpkin! I don't know what the rest of the town sees in you but when election day comes, you're in for a big surprise! You hear me!" Suddenly Janet heard a ripping sound and turned to see her butt had expanded until each cheek was the size of a watermelon. Her butt also had plates on it like that of an armadillo and a long tail.

Janet saw the bright golden orange-colored plates and gasped before she looked at her fingers to see they turned into claws. Janet yelled in horror as her clothes tore off and she expanded into a 17ft tall armadillo woman. Her belly was now 25ft wide, her butt was 20ft wide and she had a pair of large D-cup breasts. She appeared to have a triple chin now and she felt all over her fat body in horror and let out a scream. "This isn't happening!" she shouted. "This can't be happening! This is a nightmare!" Janet then walked forward and accidentally stomped on a mailbox before she yelled.

Down the street, Taylor was walking down to look for his wife. "Coach Delgado is right though," said Taylor to himself. "Janet has been pushing both me and Cole around a lot lately. Heck, Cole hates soccer. It was Janet's idea he joined the team. She's too much of a perfectionist. One of these days I'm going to really tell her... Ugh!" Taylor nearly slipped and fell into a hole in the ground. He stopped himself and then noticed that the hole was shaped a lot like a footprint of some kind. "That looks like an armadillo footprint," said Taylor. "But there aren't any armadillos in this area. Heck. This footprint looks like it belongs to an armadillo big enough to eat a bear."

Taylor heard a rumbling sound and saw that there were more of the armadillo footprints in the ground, at the time, unaware that they were Janet's footprints. As Taylor followed the footprints, he spotted the giant armadillo woman slowly trying to scurry away and gasped before falling to the ground on his back. "Good grief!" Janet's ears picked up and she turned and faced her husband at her feet. "Taylor!?" yelled Janet. Taylor recognized the giantess's voice and gasped. "J-Janet?" Janet turned her head. "Don't look at me!" yelled Janet. "Ugh! This is horrible."

Taylor stood up and poked one of Janet's car crushing butt cheeks before looking up at his wife. "Janet?" asked Taylor. "What the... how... how did this...?" Janet let out a shriek and grabbed her ears. The armadillo woman was filled with intense rag. "Some homeless man did this to me. His name was Earl or something or other and said some mumbo jumbo to turn me into this ugly beast. And that idiot sheriff didn't believe me. I mean, what are we paying the ****ing town for!" Taylor tapped his wife a few times and was in shock. But then he realized something and rubbed his chin. He thought about how Janet pushed both him and their son around and her bad attitude towards the soccer coach and insistence that the school was at fault for Cole being a mere goalie. Given how mean Janet was lately, he saw this as an opportunity to teach her a lesson for her behavior. "Uh," said Taylor. "Janet, maybe you should curl into a ball. After all, you can't let anyone see you like this." Janet admitted that her husband had a point and then with a little effort, curled her giant obese body into a large and round ball.

As Janet was curled up, she let out a grumble to herself. "I hope they find that horrible man who did this to me and throw him in jail for the rest of his life. Dirty hobo. I'd like to..." Janet then grunted because she felt something being attached to her. "What the?!" What Janet didn't know was that Taylor was applying tape to her to make sure she stayed curled up in her ball form. He was laughing to himself as he put on a tape. "Janet did say faulty equipment was at fault for Cole's status on the soccer team. Well, let's see how hard they can kick this ball."

"Taylor!" yelled Janet in a muffled tone. "What are you doing?! I swear if... ack!" Taylor took out some white paint in order to paint his armadillo wife to look like a soccer ball. "You've been quite an overbearing soccer mom lately, Dear," said Taylor. "Let's see how you like it when the shoe is on the other foot." Taylor took out black paint in order to finish the paint job on Janet as Janet was fuming mad inside. "You traitor!" she yelled. "If you're thinking what I think you are, you can cook your own dinner for the next month!" Taylor paid his wife's threats no heed and finished the paint job. He then whistled to himself as he pushed Janet towards the soccer field as the curled up armadillo giantess let out muffled swear words.

Taylor returned to the soccer field and Coach Delgado and the soccer team looked in surprise at the large "soccer ball". "Janet said that you had substandard equipment," said Taylor. "So I decided to pick up something to remedy it." "Oh my gosh." Said the coach. "Dad," said Cole. "Where did you get a soccer ball that big?" "Uh," said Taylor. "I'd rather not say." Janet let out a moan as Taylor rolled her into the field. "You're gonna pay for this Taylor. You will pay."
112231212222222222222222232222222221.title: Soccer Mom to Soccer Ball

1122312122222222222222222322222222211.content:
Coach Delgado blew his whistle and although his heart wasn't into soccer, Cole was the one who ran up to the "ball" and inhaled and exhaled before giving it a kick that sent it rolling, causing Janet to let out a muffled scream. Soccer practice was quickly rolling and the children were surprisingly able to handle such a rather large "soccer ball" and manipulate it without hurting themselves. "Ooh!" shouted Janet in pain. One young boy gave a blink. "Is it just me, or is this ball surprisingly light?" One girl then headbutt Janet, making the armadillo giantess curled into a ball groan as she wobbled in a zigzag pattern. Inside her curled form, Janet grabbed herself by the mouth to prevent herself from vomiting all over herself.

While the kids were busy with soccer practice, Taylor had explained everything to coach Delgado. "What?" asked the coach. "That soccer ball is Janet?" Taylor nodded his head. "This may sound hard to believe, but somebody turned her into an armadillo the size of a bulldozer. She's been acting really mean and snooty lately, so I decided to teach her a lesson. Since she was blaming your equipment on Cole's performance in soccer practice and didn't consider that Cole may not even like soccer, I decided to paint her to look like a giant soccer ball." "You're right," said the coach. "That is hard to believe. But if that's true, she's going to be furious. You're dead meat, Taylor." Taylor let out a sigh. "I'll jump off that bridge when we get there.

On the field, Janet kept grunting in pain as she was kicked through the soccer game. "Why is this even happening?" asked the mother turned armadillo to herself. "I'm 10 times bigger than these kids and (ouch!) they're kicking me around as if (Ooh!), I was lighter than (Ow!)..." Cole was about to get ready to kick the "ball" but then he gave a look of confusion. "Is it my imagination?" he asked. "Or is that soccer ball screaming?" One girl on the same team stepped forward. "You can't be serious. Get out of the way. That thing will crush you." Janet rolled forward, trying to shake off the glue holding her in her ball form but the girl got ready and ran towards her. As small as that girl was and as big as Janet was, the young challenger kicked what she assumed was a soccer ball so hard that Janet was sent rolling and screaming at a rapid speed towards the goal. The goalkeeper saw the "ball" coming and out of panic, jumped out of the way as the "ball" kept on rolling out of the field and down the hill.

"Oh no!" shouted Janet from trapped inside her spherical form. Taylor saw the "ball" rolling and grabbed himself by the mouth. "Okay," he said as he tried to fight back the urge to laugh. "I know I'm going to get it later, but it'll so be worth it." At that moment, Janet kept rolling down the hill screaming and people were running for their lives to avoid being flattened by such a giant round creature. The armadillo giantess kept on rolling and rolling until she reached a large pier and rolled off the docks with a big splash into the water.

Fortunately for Janet, the water diluted the glue that was holding her stuck and caused her to uncurl. The water also washed away the paint that made the armadillo giantess look like a soccer ball. She had also undergone another growth spurt. The armadillo woman was 30ft tall with a 35ft wide butt and belly. She coughed and shook her head as she climbed back onto the docks that shattered beneath her massive weight as she crawled back onto land. The massive armadillo lady gave a cough before she grit her teeth. "You're going to pay when I get home, Taylor Monroe. Oh, you're going to pay." Janet then looked at her reflection in the water and screamed.

"I'm even bigger now! And look at how fat I am! All that time on the treadmill come to naught! I can't believe I got turned into a giant armadillo. What did I do to deserve this?" Janet growled and then she grunted as she held her stomach in pain and it let out a loud growl. "I'm starving," said the giant armadillo woman. "Oh man. I'd probably need to eat an entire truck to stop this aching hunger." The armadillo giantess then looked forward and saw that she was about to have a feast as up ahead there was...
1122312122222222222222222322222222211.title: Armadillo's Comeuppance

112231212222222222222222232222222222.content:
Our story begins in a police car in Miami. The cops inside were Officers Drake Savage and Alexandria Drum. As Drake was driving, Alex was stuffing her fat face with donuts. Drake turned to his overweight partner before he spoke. “I never thought a woman would have an appetite like you. You eat like a shark with a tapeworm.” Alex just let out a scoff. “Okay, so I’m a bit of a compulsive eater. I’m still an artist with a gun. You remember that Cutthroat almost went home with his gender changed when he tried to run out of the back of the bank. If I was a lousier shot, he would’ve been in for a very lonely eternity.” “Just make sure you have that gun ready to fire. Under Lord’s goons have been getting bolder. I just got a tip that Circle-5 was spotted down at the warehouse.” Alex gave a confident grin as she bit into a Boston Crème. Well, just because they’re getting bolder doesn’t mean that they’re getting more competent.”

The police arrived at their destination and then exited the car. Drake smashed a warehouse door with his fists and saw a printing press of some kind that was being used for counterfeiting purposes. “Yup,” said Alex. “Funny money.” “Then why aren’t I laughing?” asked Drake as he punched the press to wreck it. However, he then heard a motor and then Drake and Alex ran to see the gang members of Circle-5 leaving on a motorboat. “Not today, punks.” Said Drake.

Both Drake and Alex ran up and then jumped out in order to land on the getaway boat. As Alex landed, she caused the boat to rock slightly and then the grunts turned around only for Alex and Drake to shoot their guns out of their hands. “You can so be Lucky Luke.” Joked Alex to her partner. But that was when Drake turned and noticed that there was far worse cargo on the criminals’ ship that simple counterfeited money but what looked like a case of experimental bombs. “What are those?” he asked. It was there a rather large criminal muscleman with wires attached to his head and muscles charged in and then assaulted Drake to make him drop his gun into the water. “None of your business, creep.” Drake stood up and then looked at the much stronger criminal. “Smasher.” He said. Smasher smirked. “Well,” he said. “If it isn’t Drake Savage. I remember how you’ve been hunting me like a dog for years.” “Maybe that’s because you ARE a dog, Smasher.” Smasher didn’t like being unfavorably compared to a dog and tried to strike Drake again, but then Alex shot at him a few times. “Leave him alone, jerk.” Smasher then gave an evil smirk and grabbed Alex by her double chin. “Alex!” yelled Drake in worry. Smasher laughed wickedly and threw Alex overboard.

Drake tried to jump to help Alex but Smasher grabbed him and slammed him face first into the railing of the ship, knocking lose the crate full of bombs. Alex was sinking before she managed to keep herself afloat and then saw Drake continuing to be beaten on by Smasher. Before Alex could even think about getting out of the water and going after Smasher, she saw a great white shark coming forward. “Oh no.” She said. The shark attacked Alex and forced her to try and wrestle the creature before it could bite her. The shark had obviously mistaken the overweight woman for a rather large seal. While Alex was busy with the shark and trying to keep it under control. One of Smasher’s bombs fell out of the ship and floated right near the policewoman and the shark and begun to beat. Alex spotted the bomb counting down and gave a look of fear because she was sure that it was going to kill her. “Oh…”

“BOOOOOOOM!”
112231212222222222222222232222222222.title: Great White Panic

1122312122222222222222222322222222221.content:
However, as the bomb went off, it bathed both Alex and the shark in a strange energy and Alex let out a yell as she saw the shark beginning to fade away. As Alex let go of the shark, she saw that her fingers were becoming webbed and her teeth were falling out as hundreds of razor sharp fangs were taking their place. Alex then grabbed her neck and yelled because gills were sprouting on her neck and her obese body seemed to becoming even rounder than usual and she was quickly getting bigger. “What next?” asked Alex. “Augh!” Alex yelled because at that moment, a large dorsal fin had sprouted on her back and her eyes had turned bright red. She then let out a loud roar.

Back on the boat, Savage had cornered Smasher. “You’ll pay for what you did to Alex, Smasher.” But Smasher just cracked his knuckles as Savage held up his gun. “Give me a break, Drake,” he said. “Cops risk their lives everyday. You’re risking it right now picking a fight with somebody who you just can’t win against.” Drake shot at Smasher but Smasher blocked the bullets with his biceps and then ran at Savage where he proceeded to beat on the policeman. Savage grunted as he was punched and blood leaked out of his mouth. Drake then headbutt Smasher and slammed Smasher to the ground. He would’ve put the cuffs on him but Smasher came prepared with mace and then sprayed the cop in the eyes before putting him in a headlock before squeezing tight.

“Your girlfriend is probably shark food by now,” said Smasher. “Which is what you’re going to be really soon.” Smasher let out a laugh but then he also heard a rather loud roar. “What was that?” the criminal asked.” There was a large shadow and then there was a loud shaking noise. “Sounded to me like one of the sharks jumped ship.” Smasher’s men then screamed and ran away. “Monster! There’s a monster shark on board!” “Cowards,” said Smasher. “It can’t move on land. Just don’t go anywhere near...” The crooks then screamed as they heard a loud roaring noise and something tore through the cabin of the ship.

Smasher looked in fear because it was a 27ft tall anthropomorphic great white shark very obese with a 45ft girth, a 35ft wide butt and large H-cup breasts. The shark also had reddish brown hair worn in the same style as Alex and was wearing lipstick and the remains of a police uniform. Drake looked in surprise because he recognized the titanic shark mutant as his partner. “Alex?!” he yelled. Smasher was in pure fear as Alex looked down at him with red bloodshot eyes. “The bomb hitting the water combined with the shark attacking her must’ve mutated Alex,” thought Drake. “And with the appetite she had before, I really hope that sharks prefer donuts to human flesh.

Alex just let out a growl.
1122312122222222222222222322222222221.title: Shark Attack

1122312122222222222222222322222222222.content:
“Come on, Atlanta,” said Archie to his wife. “The joint is gonna be jumping.” “I’m ready to dance, Archie,” said Atlanta as the light brown-haired woman walked down in her heart-shaped sunglasses, medallion, buckskin jacket and bellbottoms. “It’s time for us to spread the love and get our groove on.” “That’s what I’m talking about, Atlanta. Let’s rock and rule!” Atlanta and Archie laughed before Archie spun his wife around and she shook her dancing shoes. Atlanta and Archie Rainmaker were a couple that although they weren’t born even close to the 1970s, they lived in the time period everyday with how they decorated their home. Most people thought they were insane but every Friday night, the two would shake a leg or two at the local discotheque.

“Alright, Arch,” said Atlanta. “Let’s get out of this place and bust a move.” Archie let out a laugh. “I knew that there was a reason that I married you. Let’s boogie!” Both Archie and Atlanta were right outside the door and Atlanta did a twirling dance only to slip as she grunted. Before she could hit the ground, Archie grabbed hold of her.

“Whoa there, Little Mama, you alright?” “I’m fine, Little Papa,” said Atlanta. “But it don’t look like we’re going anywhere tonight.” “What do you mean, Atlanta? After all, we’ve always gotten down on Friday Night. It’s called TGIF for a reason. Come on!” Atlanta then held up her foot and showed that the heel broke in her shoes. “Looks like my dancing shoes have had their last dance. I can’t go anywhere with one heel, they’ll think we’re weirder than we normally are.”


 However, that was when Archie saw a mysterious shop with strange odds and ends up ahead and smiled. “Don’t you worry, Atlanta, my dancing queen, we’ll knock them dead soon enough on the dance floor. I’ll bet that store sells shoes. Wait here.”

Archie ran up to the store and then walked inside to see all sorts of odds and ends all around. There were scarlet beetles in jars, what looked like a golden seashell, a box that appeared to be shaking and even a crystal ball. “Aha,” said Archie as he walked up ahead. “Shoes.” Archie saw several pairs of shoes, there was a pair of glass slippers, a pair of sandals as red as blood, a pair of blood-stained Jordans but the shoes that caught Archie’s eyes were a pair of green shoes resembling alligator shoes. “Snazzy.”  Archie picked up the shoes and read the label.

“No alligators were harmed in the making of these shoes. But it’s highly recommended that you don’t put them on. Of course I won’t put them on. They’re high heels, shoes for Atlanta. She’s gonna love them. Hey, shopkeep! Huh, he must be out.” Archie took out some money to put on the table and then walked out, not noticing that there was a nearby minotaur’s skull on the table that appeared to be snoring.

Meanwhile, Atlanta put the shoes on and smiled. “So, how do you like those croc shoes, Atlanta?” Atlanta smiled. “Banging, Archie. Now it’s off to the club. Disco waits for no one. Woo!” Archie and his wife laughed and walked off, not noticing the large and scaly green tail sprouting from above Atlanta’s now surprisingly large butt cheeks.
1122312122222222222222222322222222222.title: Put on Your Alligator Shoes

11223121222222222222222223222222222221.content:
Archie and Atlanta walked up towards the nightclub, blissfully unaware of Atlanta’s rise in weight and her scaly green tail. “Ready to paint the dance floor red, my Atlanta ocean?” asked Archie as he twirled his wife around and grabbed her in an embrace. “Oh, you know it my Archie De Triomphe.” As Archie held onto his wife, he noticed that Atlanta’s ass had gotten bigger and rougher and he also felt her tail. “Since when did you get a faux snakeskin belt?” asked Archie. Atlanta looked at her husband as if he was daft and shook her tail that she had no idea existed. “What are you talking about, Arch?” “Uh, nothing.” The Rainmakers decided that it would be best to walk up into Club Mango. The bouncer was a tall Japanese man in a bright red jacket with a banana tattoo on the side of his arm. “Archie and Atlanta,” he said. “It must be Friday.” The bouncer then noticed that Atlanta who had previously been shorter than Archie, was now the same height as her husband and appeared to have gotten fatter as well from the looks of her much larger midriff. Wanting to change the subject, he noticed Atlanta’s alligator dancing shoes. “New shoes?” he asked. Atlanta held up one of her legs that looked thicker than usual and smiled. “That’s right,” she said. “One of my dancers quit on the way over and it was good fortune that there was a bizarre bazaar that was selling footbenders, yo.” The guard nodded his head as the Rainmakers walked in but then gasped the minute he saw that Atlanta had a tail. “I know a certain Anton who is going on the rack for this.” Said the guard to himself.

The discotheque was jumping and music was filling the air as Atlanta and Archie walked up towards the bar. They didn’t notice it but there were a few people who couldn’t help but stare at Atlanta’s reptilian tail and her massive rear that was slowly devouring her bellbottoms as green scales were growing all over her back. Her skin was turning tough and somewhat reptilian in appearance. However, the Rainmakers were both blissfully unaware as they came up to the bar table and Atlanta’s now much larger ass had taken up three whole seats, three of which wound up being bent due to the sheer magnitude of the female hippie’s rear. The bartender didn’t even turn around to look at Archie and Atlanta until Archie banged on the table. “Yo! J.J.! What’s shaking!” yelled Archie. “Well, well,” said J.J. “If it isn’t the Rainmakers. I was wondering when you two would show up for the party.” “Sorry, Cat,” said Archie. “My young lady bent an Achilles heel on the way over, but luckily there was a shop nearby that sold gators.”

While Archie was busy speaking with the bartender, Atlanta felt her stomach gurgling, although she had no idea how large it had gotten and then she spotted a vending machine. However, it was one particular treat in the vending machine that caught her eye. It was a small bag of Jack Link jerky and the sight of it prompted Atlanta to get up from her three mangled stools and walk up to the machine to buy the jerky. By the time she returned, Archie looked at her in surprise, not at the fact that she was now taller than him and obese but because of the fact that she was eating jerky at all. “Atlanta?” asked Archie. “That’s beef jerky. I’ve never known you to munch on meat.” Atlanta just gave a hiccup before speaking again. “I’m sorry, Arch,” she said. “I don’t know what came over me but I’ve got the munchies for something dead and red.” The barkeeper saw nothing unusual and gave each of the Rainmakers a glass of rather odd-looking blue lemonade. “Voila,” said J.J. “Mr. and Mrs. Rainmaker, this here is my new concoction, blue flamingo lemonade.” “Blue flamingo?” asked Atlanta with a laugh. “J.J. your eyes must be running on monochrome, yo. There’s no such thing as a blue flamingo.” “He must be from the land of the boars,” said Archie. “I’m open for new experiences Atlanta.” “And whatever’s good enough for my man is good enough for me, Archie,” said Atlanta. “Bottoms up.”

As Atlanta and Archie were drinking their drinks, J.J. noticed that Atlanta’s skin looked a shade of yellow-green for some reason and her teeth appeared to be turning into razor sharp fangs. “Whoa, Atlanta,” said J.J. “When was the last time you saw a dentist.” Atlanta looked in confusion and was slightly dazed from her drink. “What do you mean?” asked Archie. “Are you saying my wife has yellow choppers?” “Not yellow, Archie. Atlanta’s teeth look a little too sharp for my tastes. They look kind of mean.” Atlanta then looked at her fingernails and realized that they had been turned into rather sharp claws and then looked back and noticed her alligator’s tail. However, because she had recently downed an unfamiliar drink, it didn’t cross her mind that she was mutating. “Gee whiz, Archie,” said Atlanta. “I’m not sure I like this new drink. J.J. you haven’t been putting any L and S and Ds in here have you? I’m starting to see crazy things.” J.J. just scratched his head before the DJ started to play (ironically) Crocodile Rock.

“O.M.G.!” yelled Archie. “Atlanta, that’s his voice, the great one.” “Wicked cool, Archangel,” said Atlanta. “That’s the song they played on our wedding night. Let’s show the squares how the Dancing Queen and her king tear up the disco floor.” Archie and Atlanta laughed and made a break for the dance floor as J.J. looked and noticed the stools that Atlanta had murdered and then saw Atlanta’s scaly green tail and dropped his jaw in the process. The music was playing as Archie and Atlanta grabbed each other in an embrace and were dancing ferociously on the disco floor. At this point, Archie was too into the music to notice that his wife was now two heads taller and had at least 150lbs on him as he twirled her around and she wagged the tail she had no idea she had at the moment. As Atlanta was moving her feet, her alligator shoes appeared to merge with her feet and transformed them into the feet of an alligator just as her bellbottoms were being stretched out.

- - - - - - - - - - -

Back at the strange shop with the minotaur’s skull, the skull had come alive and was looking around. “Achilles!” he yelled in a ghostly voice. “Have you seen the alligator shoes made out of the scales of Sobek himself? Not crocodile. Alligator. We locked the crocodile Sobek shoes in the basement. I know Sobek was a crocodile god but alligators and crocodiles are related species. Huh, what’s this money from. Don’t tell me some yutz took those... well at least they paid for once. Although by now they’re probably paying with more than money. Guess we better leave town. One titan in this place is enough for now.”

- - - - - - - - - -

Back at Club Mango, Atlanta was giggling as she and Archie continued their dance and the other dancers were staring. “Look at her skin,” said one girl dancer. “She’s so dry she’s already sprouted a tail.” “Not only that, she’s huge,” said another girl. “Her bellbottoms are being eaten alive by all that ass.” “And look at those teeth. I don’t know whether she’s going to kiss him or bite his head off. She looks absolutely hideous and disgusting.” But Archie and Atlanta were completely oblivious as to what exactly was going on with them. “Alright, Archie. Let’s knock them dead.” “You got it, Atlanta.” Archie twirled Atlanta and those her giggling self up into the air with the intent to catch his wife as she landed.
 However, while in the air, Atlanta was getting larger and larger as her transformation was completing. As she was laughing, her face stretched out until her head was that of an alligator as her long brown hair appeared to be glowing from the shine of her scales. Her underbelly turned a more yellow-shade of green to contrast with her Chartreuse scales as her throat expanded and she grew bigger and fatter. The other patrons of the discotheque screamed in fear of the giant alligator lady who was about to land. But before Archie could realize what had happened to his wife...

BOOM!

Atlanta landed butt first on top of her husband and cartoonishly flattened him into her enormous alligator booty. However, Atlanta got up and was really concerned, though she had no idea that she was an alligator. “Archie? What happened, you were supposed to catch me. Archie managed to squeeze his way out of Atlanta’s reptilian butt cheeks before he looked up and saw what had become of his wife. He then gasped and then took off and adjusted his glasses and then stopped to clean them because he didn’t trust his eyes 100% that he was seeing a giant alligator, a giant alligator that had to be 25ft tall with a 40 ft wide girth and ass, D-Cup breasts and three chins. While Archie was trying to reconfirm what he saw, Atlanta looked at her scaly hands in surprise and then felt her obese scaly belly and opened her mouth to see that she had hundreds of sharp teeth. But surprisingly despite everyone else in the discotheque staring at her in pure fear, Atlanta didn’t fully believe that she wasn’t hallucinating.

“Archikins,” said the alligator titaness. “I think that lemonade has turned.” Archie put his glasses back on and looked at Atlanta before...
11223121222222222222222223222222222221.title: Alligator on the Dance Floor

choices: Atlanta Gets Hungry During the Night
112231212222222222222222232222222222212.content:
Surprisingly as Archie looks at his enormously obese alligator wife, all he did was rub his eyes. “Babe,” he said. “You’re right. Dang.
