11223222.title: The Warthog

112232221.content:
I was dead silent as the massive creature stomped through the forest like an elephant, effortlessly pushing the thick branches asia with her immense strength. I couldn't tell where she was taking me until the trees began to clear up ahead, which I could see strange structures within.

Once we cleared away from the trees, we were within some strange village composed of houses made from trees. I gawked at hundreds of others of similarly huge, obese animal-women populating the area, either ravenously stuffing themselves or lifting massive workloads about with intimidating strength. The shorter ones had to be about seven feet tall, while the tallest ones clocked in over twenty feet while balooned to unfathomably fat proportions.

The warthog approached a fruit stand run by an gigantic cow woman, whose gut must've been bigger than my captor was.

"Morning, Gorus. The usual?"

"Mmm-hmm. Got lucky today."

"Lucky, eh?" She reached over a shelf and handed her a burlap sack that was bigger than I was. "What'd you find?"

"A human." She slowly turned for her friend to see, who looked surprised upon sight.

"Wow! Nice work!"

"Thanks. See you round!" She trudged off the other way, opening the bag and greedily scarfing down its contents. The sound of her wolfing down the food caused me to fearfully gulp, hoping she wasn't a carnivore.

Once she finished the entire bag, she lazily tossed it aside and continued en route for...
112232221.title: She took me to a village of obese anthro amazons

choices: ... was by far the biggest woman you have ever seen! Tall and fat!
1122322211.content:
As my captor waddled slowly through the crowded village, I began to realize that a lot of the titanic women have taken notice of me and start following this "Gorus" woman, a mix of expressions in their non-human faces, some ranging from wonder, to curiosity, to even lustful looks making me sweat quite profusely. Soon enough there is a procession of sorts, as more and more of the women gather behind Gorus, waddling slowly and a few steps behind her. A few minutes have passed as we moved deeper into the village until suddenly, I felt my captor come to a halt, given by how frantically the "cage" shook. That was it, I couldn't help it, my curiosity got the better of me, and I turned to her fleshy back and poked her.

"What's going on? Why did you stop?" I asked, raising my voice just so Gorus could hear me. Sure enough, I felt a sense of vertigo, the world shifting in a sudden movement as the cage is brought to the ground, opened, and I was forcefully (but also somewhat gently) taken out and placed outside. Before me as a very large tree, its thick and old trunk being hundreds of feet tall, branches sticking out and nearly blotting out the sun. At the base of the tree there was an opening that obviously led into the tree itself, and a staircase that led to it. But what really got my attention were the figures at the entrance of the steps, three of the largest women I had ever seen, standing easily at 30 feet and sporting the biggest, well, everything, from their thunderous thighs to their hefty chests, to even their soft pillowy midriffs, their sizes as intimidating as the masks they wore and yet, I couldn't help but think they were somewhat...arousing. The one in the middle, standing just a little taller than the other two, wearing a plumed mask and grasping an ornate wooden spear, took a step forward, her grey skin glistening under the sun.

"Gorus! Back so soon? What's this you bring with you?" She drops to one meaty knee, her massive belly getting a bit in the way as she takes off her mask to look at me. Looking at my shocked form with an inquisitive expression in her rhino-like face, she scratched her horn absent-mindedly. "..oh?... Oh! A human, and a male at that! Nice catch, the Chieftain will be pleased!" Chieftain? Oh no, this could turn out very badly, by the way it was headed...

My thoughts were interrupted when the head guard, I assumed, hoisted herself back up and raised her spear into the air. The low murmurs that have been following me and Gorus were instantly silenced.

"Everyone! Hear me! Your suspicions are correct, Gorus has found a MAN!" There was a few gasps and then a sudden cheer, as the animal-like women shouted in apparent delight, conversing in an animated fashion, from what I understood. I guess they haven't seen a man in ages, I mused to myself nervously. My musings however, didn't last too long, as I was yanked off the ground by the rhino guard lady. She stuck the spear on the ground with her other hand and held it under me, so I could stand in her palm. "YOU are a lucky one, not many men manage to find us or this village, or get to speak with our Chieftain." Her face turned stern. "One word of advice, mind your tone with her, you do not wish to get on her bad side, or mine for that matter. Disrespect her, and anything she will do to you, I will do it ten times worse!"

At this statement, I'm not going to lie, my skin turned completely white. She noted this, and as if reading my thoughts, she added, in a somewhat reassuring manner:
"Do not be frightened out of your skin, man, she may have a temper sometimes, but our Chieftain is fair and wise, and we will not harm you...unless you force us to." And with that statement, she beckoned Gorus, who had been assisting to this whole thing with an amused look in her boarish face, to follow her. I couldn't resist the urge to look back to the crowd as we climbed the steps to the tree, and I saw that the massive crowd (pun not intended) had gotten...um..."friskier" in their celebrating, as many started feasting, singing, and downright kissing and groping each other. Even the two other guards had joined in the "celebrations", discarding their spears and ornate masks in favor of making out with each other passionately.

"...okay, soooo thankful I'm not over there..." I can't help but mutter to myself. It wasn't however, low enough, as the head of the guard looked at me as she waddled up the steps.

"Don't mind them, stranger. The effects of your presence here shall be explained soon enough."

"Umm, am I really that special to your people?" I ask, shyly. She and Gorus share a thunderous laugh, their soft bodies jiggling wildly and by extension, making me shake as well.

"Patience, stranger, all shall be revealed soon. We have arrived." I shifted my gaze, having been so completely distracted by the sway of their large chests and the motion of their titanic stomachs. The allure had been such that I completely missed the hallways, the working maids and of course, the large room we found ourselves in.

Nothing, however, could have prepared me for their Chieftain, as she...
1122322211.title: …the village chief.

11223222111.content:
The room was incredibly huge, considering the absolute leviathan of a woman who sat in the center. For a moment, I couldn't tell if it was just some amorphous mountain of smooth black dough, but the white streaks implied it to be an orca.

Dozens of dining tables were suspended from wooden cranes on the walls, one of which was resting on her gargantuan breasts as she stuffed her obscenely fat body. Even while seated she had to be forty feet tall, with legs that had to be bigger than houses hanging from her sides. It almost looked like she'd been rendered completely immobile, given her (nudge) whale of a gut bloated to an almost impossibly gigantic size, puffing out probably larger than she was tall.

"MORE!!!" I heard her call out, and the table she was eating from was lifted away, another one filled with food swinging in to take its place.

"Excuse me, my chief!" The rhino guard called out, acting her from taking the next bite.

"Yes, guard?"

"We wish it to be known that a human male has been found on the island, whose presence we have made known!"

Slowly, and somewhat to my horror, the whale-woman braced herself and managed to heave her grotesque bulk onto her two legs, the ground beneath me shaking as she trudged forward. I could see less of her upper half as she got closer, seeming all the more huge as she got closer. I was shaking as her footsteps grew louder and louder, until she finally came to a halt as she was several paces away, and all I could see was the curvature of her belly and the hand that she held out.

"May I see him?"

"Of course." I was broken out of my daze as the guard gently picked me up and help me up to her, who grabbed and lifted me up to see her face. Her head rested on a hill-sized chin with puffed cheeks, and each of her eyes had to be bigger than I was.
11223222111.title: ... was by far the biggest woman you have ever ...

choices: Curiosity takes over, I ask her what's going to happen to me.
She starts asking me loads of questions, clearly curious about me.
112232221112.content:
As I was suspended in front of her eyes, which I noted were golden, I nervously waved one hand at her and muttered a feeble "Hi." She blinked once, smiled warmly, and gently handed me back to the head of the guard without a single word. As I stood on the palm of her hand, the orca chieftain turned and wobbled back to the center of the room, no doubt to continue feasting.

She sat her massive bulk on the ground, and with a few huffs, addressed the rhino woman who held me. "Thoria, have the man sent to the Shamaness's quarters to prepare him." Prepare me? For what? Was I going to be eaten? I began to panic on the inside of my head. "Also, summon her sister here, I will have need of her services."

I shook a bit in Thoria's hand as she bowed to the massive woman. "As you wish, chieftain. But what of Gorus here? She was the who found him." And she raised her hand for emphasis, holding me further away from the ground. The blob of an orca paused, and after a few seconds addressed the boar woman.

"Gorus, you will sit with me in tomorrow's Grand Feast. Bring your mate with you, and be sure to enjoy yourself tomorrow. You've earned it, plus a bag of gems. Use them wisely." She winked at the boar lady, who bore a mix of shocked surprise and joy as a maid brought her the aforementioned bag of gems.Gorus fell on her fat knees and bowed multiple times, shaking her meaty body. "Thank you, I shall never forget this honour, my chieftain! Thank you!" She cheered, happily accepting the gift.

As Gorus raised herself and turned to leave, no doubt to go tell her "mate" about the good news, Thoria turned to her right and went through an archway, heavily decorated with paintings and strange symbols. After a short while of a silent walk, I turned to face my carrier, who was humming some tribal tune as she waddled through the corridors.

"Excuse me, uhh..miss Thoria, was it? What's going to happen to me?" with a smile on her horned face, she eyed me.

"You, little man, are going to meet our Shamaness, Lanirra. She's going to prepare you for our chieftain." Again, I was left more confused than enlightened, so I pressed her some more.

"Prepare me for your chieftain? I thought you said I wasn't going to be eaten." she chuckled, and patted me gently in the back of my head, as if I was a pet who had amused its owner. Needless to say, I wasn't liking the idea of being petted.

"If we wanted you as a meal, you'd be taken to the head cook, not the shamaness. Don't be afraid."

"Point taken." I admitted, that made sense. I was about to say something else when she suddenly stopped in front of a heavy, wooden door. This is it, I thought to myself. Thoria knocked twice, and from the inside I heard a snore, followed by rustling and slow, heavy footsteps.

The door opened and I gagged as colored fumes and smokes emanated from the room. I heard a feminine yawn, and gazed upon this new woman, the shamaness called Lanirra. She was slightly taller than Gorus, but had an extremely hourglass figure, with thunderous thighs and big butt, a small potbelly in her midriff, and a meaty but shapely bosom. Her fur was snow-white, and she had long, wavy, black hair. It was an odd detail, since she was a rather stunning lioness. Her blue eyes at first focused on Thoria, and then darted to me, surprised.

"Thoria, what's this? A male? Is this why you interrupted my meditation?" her voice was girly, yet at the same time, mature. I heard the rhino lady chortle, and saw her smirking, amused.

"Lani, you weren't meditating, you were napping, I know the difference. And yes, this is a male alright, Gorus found him, and the chief has sent us here so you could prepare him for...that." at this, Lanirras' eyes brightened, and she held out her hand. I was passed on to her care, i thought. "Do what you must with him, I need to summon your sister, chief's orders. Is she in her quarters?"

Seeing the lioness nod her head, Thoria waved to me and left. I was carried inside the room, trying not to gag or suffocate under these heavy scents and smokes. Lanirra on the other hand seemed to like taking deep breaths of this stuff. Her room was cramped, full of wooden totems and idols, scrolls and manuscripts, strange handcrafts with feathers and wooden beads. Hanging on the walls were some eerie maks, and a bunch of cushions lay on what I assumed was her bed. She set me down in a cushion, and sat crosslegged in front of me, her blue eyes regarding me with curiosity. A brief moment passes where neither of us says anything.
112232221112.title: Something else...

choices: The chieftain, obviously - but something's different.
1122322211121.content:
"So... what's this all about?" was the exact first thing that came out of my mouth, because I just couldn't take it anymore, I HAD to know. Lanirra wasn't surprised at all, and she grabbed a large smoking pipe that was in one of the cushions. It was lit, and she too a whiff of it, exhaling a sweet fragance that made me feel slightly lightheaded. As I shook my head to clear my mind, she casually set it aside and focused on me, completely serious.

"You have been given a great honor, stranger. But I'm afraid I cannot tell you more than what you think you know. It is our way. But rest assured, no harm will befall you, and soon, you will understand" She took a strand of her lustrous black hair off her face, and sighed. "You were brought here to be revitalized, these smokes may smell a bit foul, but they clear your spirit of any impurities. They also heal wounds, clear your mind, and, well, let's just say that they're good for you. What you just smelled from this pipe was in fact a light narcotic, to me it just brightens my day, but for you...the dose was too big, so you're going to be knocked out for a while." Wait. What? That's when it hit, my vision blurred and I began to wobble like a drunkard trying to stay awake.

"You...what did you....do to me?...Ah feel....fuh....fuh-nee..." When I looked at her, I saw twins, then triplets, and quadruplets before I plopped down, completely wasted. Last thing I heard before passing out was her voice saying "Sleep now, stranger, you will feel like a new man when this is done..."

------------------------------------------

I don't know how long I was out, but when I awoke, I was alone, and not in Lanirra's room. I was laying in a large bed, still clothed, thankfully, and I felt myself to see if anything had changed. To my relief, nothing about me changed, or so I thought. At the time I didn't realize, but whatever the lioness did to me had made me...well, denser. As in, capable of withstanding great pressure and supporting it without breaking bones or pulling muscles. It was invigorating, that was for sure, and that was what I felt. Lanirra wasn't kidding, that was some therapy she did to me.

I stood up on the large bed and gazed around the room: it was lavish, to say the least. There were a few ornate chairs and a table with some fruits on it, some I recognized while others were exotic and unknown to me. There were also colorful curtains hanging on the walls, even though there were no visible windows. Luxurious carpets lay on the floor, and a pleasant aroma lingered in the air. At first I was just taking my surroundings in, but something began gnawing at my mind, couldn't figure what it was until hit me.

I was in a bedroom, SOMEONE'S bedroom. Feeling the implications of this, I panicked and looked around, completely flustered. But then I recalled what was said in the chieftain's hall and again at Lanirra's door:
"Have him prepared for 'that'."

The words echoed in my mind as the truth sunk.

"Hoo boy..." was all I could say, as heavy footsteps thundered outside the room, becoming louder and louder as they came closer to the room. I was about to have company, big company. But who was it?
1122322211121.title: Curiosity takes over, I ask her what's goin...

11223222111211.content:
I faced the doors as they slowly, but noisily opened, and saw two large guards enter. Like the ones guarding the entrance of the tree, they were wearing ornate masks with multicolored plumes on top, skimpy armor that revealed their huge waists, hefty bosoms, and wide hips. They stood at the doorway, looking at me in silence, almost sizing me up it felt, and then lightly bowed their heads and took a sidestep in each direction, revealing the miniscule figure that was concealed by their size.

It was a young woman. A beautiful young woman, human like me, that began walking towards the bed, her toned yet curvy hips swaying seductively from side to side, and her generous chest jiggling and bouncing with each step she gave, a smile curving her supple lips as she saw me gawking. I was caught with my guard down. This mysterious lady snapped her fingers, and the guards withdrew at once.

She had shoulder-length black hair and wore a tiara in her head, glistening with jewels I couldn't distinguish, and her slim but well-endowed figure was clad in nothing but a bikini and a see-through skirt. The closer she got, the more my nostrils were filled with a sweet aroma of honey and jasmine.

"You are awake, I trust you slept well?" she inquired, stopping just an arms' lenght in front of me. There was something familiar about this woman, I just couldn't see what...

"...Yes...I suppose so. How long was I out, and why did that Lanirra woman drug me?" I asked, looking at this woman's golden eyes. Golden eyes? No...it couldn't be...

"You needed that, Stranger. You're no good to me tired and weakened, so the Shamaness treated you so you could regain your lost vitality. It was only for a few hours, don't worry." She gently took my hand, and we sat by the huge bed. She smiled. "You must have lots of questions, hmm?"

"Yeah, like, who are you?" Her smile widened even more, and I saw her perfectly white teeth, also unusually sharp. There was an idea forming in my head about this woman's identity, but it was absurdly impossible for it to be true. She held up one to her mouth, giggling.

"But we have already met, don't tell me you've already forgotten? Thoria brought you to me while I was enjoying lunch." My face was becoming paler and paler by the second. No way. Seeing my reaction, she held my hand tightly. "It's me, the chieftain of this tribe, Alyssia."

I let go of her hands and stumbled back, while she give a hearty laugh at my reaction. "Oh, don't be such a drama queen, human. It's nothing a little sorcery and enchantments can't make. After all, it's why I summoned Lanirra's sister for, she's the enchantress here." Regaining my composure, I asked her why the sudden change from a 40foot tall, morbidly obese, orca woman to a small and thin human, just inches shorter than me.

Cocking her head sideways, she says...
11223222111211.title: The chieftain, obviously - but something's ...

"Come again?" it was all I could ask, as my mind was speeding at Mach 6 at the time. She tilted her head to the side, bemused, and raised her hand to stroke my cheek, sending a cold shiver running down my spine.

"You heard me, Stranger. I asked for all this to be done for you." gesturing to herself, for emphasis, Alyssia continued.
