12211221111111121222.title: Violet arrives just in time!

12211222.content:
It was strange really.

Geoffrey had always known he had a great-uncle, and he'd often see him when he was a toddler during Christmas Eve, all dapper and fine clothes, as well as a curly handlebar mustache he was immensely proud of, with an eccentric personality to match, but other than that, he knew very little of him or what he did for a living. So Geoffrey, now a young man aged 24, finds himself holding a letter addressed to him, from his late great-uncle. How was this possible? He died years ago! Stranger still, it was delivered to him by a young woman, who couldn't be any older than him.

And there she stood, waiting for him to say something, staring intently at the beffudled youth. "Aren't you going to open it, Mr.Bulwark?" he lifted his gaze from the envelope and eyed the deliverer with a cocked eyebrow. She was a pretty lady, with fiery, red hair reaching her shoulders, a few curls on the tips. Deep emerald eyes gazed back at him, so deep they were they almost looked... feral. Not to mention, her petite nose dotted by a few freckles, and pouty lips that were curled into a patient smile. She was dressed in a casual manner, wearing a loose black skirt that reached her shins and a cyan cardigan that covered the black t-shirt and the wolf drawn on it. He also couldn't help but notice how shapely she was, not too thin, just... shapely, with noticeable hips and an eye-catching chest.

"I... I don't know how to take this. He died fourteen years ago. Why now? And what about the rest of my family?" he was almost exasperated. "Why me, of all people?" the mystery girl just shrugged nonchalantly.

"Maybe if you open the letter you'll find out." she quipped, still smiling in that odd way. With a sigh, Geoffrey relented, and gently tore the edge of the letter. Taking it out and opening the folded letter, he began reading:

"To my dearest friend and great-nephew,

Geoffrey, my dear boy! How have you been? It has been ages since that last Christmas gathering, you were eleven years old, if I recall correctly, and already such a fine man! This old fool misses you greatly, of all the folks in the family, you were the only one who showed me kindness and genuine concern.

Alas, if you're reading this letter, then I have already passed away, I'm afraid. Now now, save your tears, those were the bad news. The good news will improve your mood, I hope. For all the kindness you've shown me, and the eager enthusiasm you demonstrated in wanting to hear my tall tales and stories, and, of course, for treating me like actual family, I've decided to leave all my worldly possessions, my mansion and my money, to you.

Speechless, eh? You won't have to worry about a thing for the rest of your life. Just be sure to be polite to my employees, they can be a bit of a rowdy bunch at times, but at heart, they are all gentle souls. You have a spark within you, boy, of the likes I sadly could not see in my younger brother, and all those others that came from him. You will learn more from my employees, many of whom are just eager to meet you!

Sincerely, and with all the affection I can spare,

Sir Gabriel Severus Bulwark

The girl smiled more intensely as Geoffrey wiped away the few tears that blurred his vision. "Crazy old fool." he muttered, shaken. He recognized the fine handwriting on the letter, and the signature, this was surely his great-uncle's work, as well as the rubric at the corner of the letter. With a cough, he regarded once more the girl standing in front of him. "So... I've just became his heir?"

"Yup, you sure are. So as cute as that beard you have is, you might want to give it a little trim, because tomorrow I'll be here to pick you up to go to his mansion and accept the will." she pointed at his unkempt beard and goatee, and he felt it, slightly embarrassed. Dang, she was right, he thought. "Gotta make yourself look presentable, at least."

"Wait, you want me to just leave and go to some mansion I've never even been to? I mean, I knew he had one, but he never said where he lived." Geoffrey stated, and the girl just rolled her eyes, a hint of frustration visible in her expression.

"You were just fired from your job, right? And just this morning you got the letter of eviction from the landlord, hmm? One day left, is all you have, before turning in the keys. You're also low on cash because your family disowned you and left you. So tell me, buddy, what have you got to lose?" this caught him off-guard. How could she know all of that, from a first meeting, no less? Was someone spying on him? Still, what the odd girl said was true, ever since he left his superficial and arrogant family, and was disowned by his father for refusing to become a banker like him, Geoffrey was one step away from being homeless. What little he had was vanishing away, and before long, he would be just another beggar on the streets.

With a sigh, he relented. "Fine, you win. I'll be here, and ready, tomorrow."

--------------------------------------------------------------

True to his word, after preparing his old and worn baggage with what little he had left, mostly clothes, a few art books, and a small knife that had been given to him by his late great-uncle, and giving himself a do-over, mostly shaving his beard off except for his goatee, picking his best clothes, and tying his long brown hair into a low ponytail, Geoffrey was ready.

He wasted a few minutes turning in the keys to his small apartment to the landlady, a rude, cantankerous old woman who enjoyed making life miserable for everyone around her, and was kicked out after being called out on all his imperfections.

His mood brightened up a bit as he walked near the road and saw a black Rolls Royce parked on the road, the same red-haired girl waving at him with a toothy grin. There were two other people in the car as well, a senior man with a very neat hairdo and a thin mustache, dressed like a butler and a cheerful, portly short woman with graying curly locks and a kitchen apron, riding shotgun next to him. The man just gave him a polite nod whereas his chubby companion beamed a smile at him, and readily invited him in.

"Ready to go to your late relative's place, laddy?" she asked with a thick irish accent. He nodded, and she began clapping her hands in excitement. "Eeee, he was right, yer' such a handsome young man!" she quipped, making Geoffrey slightly embarrassed as he got in the car together with the girl.

"Poppet, you're making the young master uncomfortable." declared the man, crinkling his nose, eyes on the road. "So, I wager you read the old master's letter, correct?" The uncertain young man just gave a quiet nod. "Splendid. You may call me Charles, I am the head butler at your late great-uncle's mansion, and this is my wife and head cook, Elisabeth. The young woman sitting to your left is one of the maids there, I do believe you're already acquainted?" Geoffrey shook his head, and the driver arched his eyebrows, peeking through the rear view mirror. "No? Well, fret not, young master, there will be plenty of time for that later."

The car drive went on and on, minutes of a tense silence turning into hours, to the point that Geoffrey dozed off in the car. When he came to, he didn't know how long he was out, or where he was for that matter, but...

"We're here." said Charles, opening the car door for him. As he groggily stepped out, the red haired girl presented him with his luggage, and humming a tune, went to join the portly cook heading into the mansion before them.

And what a mansion it was. Standing like some monolithic castle on top of a hill, the thick forest surrounded its seemingly ancient walls, so tall it was, so big, for a moment, Geoffrey entertained the idea that it was made for giants. As he silently followed the senior butler up the hill, he could not help but notice the size of the doors and windows, looming above him at thirty feet, give or take. Stranger still, there was another, smaller pair of doors that were made for people on the giant doors. With a potent knock on the door gong, the smaller pair of doors opened with a eerie creak, parting away slowly. The two ladies promptly entered, and with a polite bow and gesture, Charles beckoned the youth to enter.

He had been holding his breath as he regarded the place, so with a quiet sigh, for better or for worse, he stepped inside.
12211222.title: Monster Mayhem 4 - The Inheritance

choices: "Fine, let's just get this over with."
"I...I need some time to think it over."
122112221.content:
"Woah... this place is huge..." muttered Geoffrey, mesmerized as he was by the sheer size and ornate furnishings of the entry hall. To say the place was roomy was an understatement, there were halls everywhere, and two staircases that lef to the floor above, complete with an inner balcony overlooking the entry hall. Following Charles, the head butler, through a series of halls, the beffudled young man was led to a large room, a study of sorts, complete with tons of shelves and hundreds, if not thousands, of books. Just like the entry hall and the main doors, the place was huge, the ceiling so far up he could hardly see the chandeliers, and in the middle of the study were a few chairs and small tables, but that's not what caught Geoffrey's eye.

It was the maids. There was a large group of them, twenty or so, all young ladies, and all pretty gorgeous. The red-haired girl had joined them, having disappeared from Geoffrey's view as he was led by Charles throughout the house. She, like all the maids, was now wearing a short black dress with frills and an apron, as well as the customary hat most french maids wear. Noticing the way he was looking at the girls, Charles leaned in and whispered into the youth's ear. "I may be the head of staff, but the girls were very persistent that I let them wear that for your arrival. I apologize on their behalf."

"Uh... it's fine? I guess..." Geoffrey muttered, a blush forming on his cheeks as he averted his gaze to the table and the documents on it. With a gesture, the senior butler pointed to it, and the guest sat himself. "So... I just have to sign this document, right?"

"Yes, but first, I must give you a warning, and another message from our late master. You see, everything in that will shall be given to you, but there are a few things you must also do. You'll live a life of luxury, and be free to indulge in your arts if you so wish..." he trailed off, looking at all the maids assembled before him. Geoffrey had a lingering suspicion he wasn't going to like the next part. "One of the terms of this will is for you to choose one of the maids as a potential partner."

Wait, what? Geoffrey pinched himself, then rubbed his eyes, and then just made a face. "What."

"If I do recall, young master, you do not seem to be in a relationship, or were ever in one, so your great-uncle thought it would be a good idea to, ahem, pardon the term, 'make a man out of you'." some of the maids started sniggering and whispering among themselves, but a stiff cough from Charles silenced them. With that, he turned once more to the guest and spoke in a quieter tone. "Just for clarification, that rule is entirely optional, but these girls have been dying to meet you for a long time. You'll pardon them if they show an interest in you, or if they are a little...straightforward... with you."

For his part, Geoffrey just sat there with a dumbfounded look on his face, still trying to process what was going on.

"The next rule will be... a bit of a shocker, to be honest. Your late relative had a very imposing job, one that required absolute secrecy. You see, this plot of land, happens to be located in a place with quite the story. A long time ago, a cult of druids began a ritual, and that ritual brought forth energies that spread all accross the world, bringing life to the supersticions, the supernatural entities, and more. It also opened a portal to a paralel universe that is now populated by all the myths and urban legends in the world."

"Come again?" Geoffrey couldn't believe his ears, was this some sort of sick joke? "So, monsters live here or something?"

"Pretty much, yes."

"And you want me to be the guardian of this so-called portal, and live here?"

"Of course."

"...okay, I'm done." and with that Geoffrey stood up, and grabbed his luggage. But before he could so much as take a step towards the door, Charles sighed and looked at the head cook, Elisabeth. She smirked, and snapped her fingers. With a blur, all the maids positioned themselves in front of the door, forming a semi-circle barring Geoffrey's passage. "Please move, I've had enough of this joke, and I'd rather much not be part of whatever it is you're doing here." he said, but to his chagrin, they didn't budge, instead, they just traded glances among themselves, and then looked to Charles. He just pinched the bridge of his nose, and waved his hand.

Geoffrey was about to repeat what he said, but his voice died out when he looked over at the girls. They were taller.

But that wasn't the only thing that changed. Slowly but surely, they rose, growing taller and taller, until they loomed over him at twenty feet, and then they filled out, flab and cellulite spreading like an infection on their figures, bloating them until they were obese parodies of their former model-like bodies. The french maid uniforms however, miraculously stretched with their inflating figures, looking snug on them. As if the scene couldn't get more bizzarre, they then started growing fur, or scales, or horns and tails, and most intimidating of all, fangs and claws.

The maids, all of them, were monsters of legend. They were there, looming above him like predators looking at prey, smirking and giggling as they looked at the terrified young man, and one of them, a giant werewolf with pale grey fur and a mane of red hair, which looked familiar, strutted forward, bent over, and picked Geoffrey up. Her emerald green eyes looked even more feral now. "Look, buddy, we went through all the trouble of looking for you when we could've just forgotten about you and left you to that life. You can be a really rich guy with a harem of beauties such as ourselves, or poor homeless guy without a cent in his pocket. It's a pretty good deal, get girls, get riches, but in turn, you have to be the guardian of this place."

"Now now, missy, that's no way to treat him, put him down, this instance, or you can forget that cake I promised I'd bake you!" scared as he was, he turned is head to see who shouted, and was surprised to see the head cook now wearing darker clothes and sporting a slightly green skin tone, as well as a slightly fuller frame. Was she a witch?

"She's right, you know. Put him down before you hurt him, right this instant!" Charles ordered, tapping his foot. His appearance hadn't changed, other than the fact he was now glowing and the tips of his shoes faded a bit. A ghost?

Geoffrey's head was spinning at Mach 6 speeds, and disoriented, he just shivered and sweat bullets until the remorseful werewolf woman set him down, gently. His knees buckled and bent like paper. "...this can't be real, I must be dreaming..."

The ghost knelt next to him, and placed a ghostly hand on his shoulder. Geoffrey felt a cold shiver run down his spine, and looked to the butler's face. It was sympathetic. "I understand your shock and fear, Master Geoffrey. It's a lot to take in, so we are willing to postpone the contract business for a few days, if we must. Just so you can have time to mull it over. But remember this: your great-uncle had a great burden, and when his family, his own flesh and blood, cast him aside, even at the family gatherings during Christmas, only you went up to him and kept him company, even when your parents forbade the contact. You were like a son to him, the same way these girls are like daughters to me and my wife Elisabeth."

"Aye, don't worry about a thing, we've taught these lassies how to behave themselves around a strappin' young lad such as yerself." said the witch as she offered a hand to hoist Geoffrey to his feet. He took it gingerly, and got back up, still shaken. He dared to look up to the monster giantesses that filled the study, once a big, spacious room, now a little too crowded with their fat frames, and saw concern on their faces, also some aprehension over revealing their secret.

"So... what will it be, master? Do you want some time to think it over, or are you going to sign that contract?" asked the red-haired werewolf, sheepishly.
With a sigh, Geoffrey decided to say...
122112221.title: One step into the darkness...

choices: (Continuing this tomorrow, 10 more ladies to come!)
1221122211.content:
Rubbing his temples, Geoffrey could only sigh at the absurdity of the situation. Monsters. Not only that, giant, freakishly fat female monsters as maids, a mansion so huge it could fit several individual houses inside, a ghost of a butler, his witch wife, and all the rest his great-uncle left behind.

These were going to be a part of his life now, however strange they may be, he could at least respect his deceased relatives' wishes. "Fine, I'll stay, for my great-uncle's sake." he said, and there was a collective relief in the study. The giantesses traded glances with one another, cheering quietly, and Charles nodded with approval, with Elisabeth the witch/cook chuckling beside him. He cleared his throat, catching everyone's attention. "However, could you, um, shrink back to normal? I mean, I don't think monsters are supposed to be that tall...or that fat. No offense." he quickly added, last thing he needed was to offend twenty giantesses.

To his relief and surprise, they just shrugged it off, even laughed at his request. The witch went to him and gave him a playful pat in the back. "Oh, we'll have plenty of time for that later on, lad! But for now, let's just finish the introductions, shall we? As they are." she winked at the girls, and they all nodded in agreement.

The red-haired werewolf strutted forward, made a seductive pose, and gave a cutesy howl. "I'm Bellatrix, but you can call me Bella. Don't you forget it, Master Geoffrey." He would make sure of that, it's not like he would forget a grey-furred werewolf with red hair, green eyes, wide hips and thighs, and a large bust to match. Hourglass, yes, that was the shape. Like in a runway, she walked back to the crowd of maids, and another took her place.

As Bella did, she strutted in and made sure to lean right above Geoffrey, giving him an ample view of her enormous cleavage, so big they were that her plush midriff and chunky thighs were completely obscured by tit-flesh. "Like what you see, Master? Name's Jessie, and I'm a minotaur." She leaned in closer, and Geoffrey took a step back, amusing her. "Moo." she cooed and with that, Jessie turned around, swished her bovine tail, and walked back to the crowd.

Next to walk towards him for the introduction, were twins. Twin gargoyles, both identical save for the color of their skin and hair, which was fairly long and straight in a bobcut. Geoffrey couldn't help but think they had something oriental going on, oddly considering what they were. They both struck a pose, their plush bellies smooshing together in a mock hug and their wide bums jiggling with flab. "I'm Dawn!" giggled the one with white skin and black hair, cheerfully. "I'm Dusk." said the one with dark skin and white hair. "And together we are the Yin-Yang twins!" both blew a kiss at Geoffrey, who had calmed down somewhat at their little routine. It was still kinda cute, he thought to himself.

Next up was a female unicorn, he could tell that much, with a long straight horn addorning her head with her cyan curly hair (that kept flowing gently even without any wind blowing), who in an elegant manner (for someone so wide and bloated) walked up to him, gave a polite bow, and then smiled in a warm manner. "My name is Amanda, Master, at your service." she grabbed the tips of her skirt, and gave him a curtsy bow, which he retaliated politely as well, before turning around and rejoining her fellow maids.

Following Amanda was another equine giantess, this time sporting large wings instead of a horn, and wearing an orange ponytail that reached all the way to her plush derriere. "Hello, my name is Azure, and I'm a pegasus. Hope you don't mind flying with me once in a while." she quipped, gently flapping her winds and blowing a breeze in Geoffrey's face, which blew his shirt up revealing his torso. With a blush, the youth scurried to compose himself while Azure just held a hand to her mouth and politely chuckled, amidst the chorus of laughter.

Slithering forward was a creature he recognized as a naga, as she had the lower body of a snake and the upper body of a woman, or in this case, a whole lot of woman. She merely loomed over him with her massive gut and bulbous chest and hissed in a seductive manner. "Caitlyn." was all she said, before sending her long tail to bop him on the head playfully. "Pleasssed to meet you at long lassst."

After the fat naga slithered her way back to the crowd, a lady with wings for hands and avian talons for feet walked forward, the brown feathers on her neck poofing a bit and her long white tail perking up. "Hi!" she quipped, looking at Geoffrey with big, golden eyes, like an eagle's. "I'm Muriel, and I'm a harpy! I love flying and... and... uh..." she scratched her head with one wing, before she remembered. "Oh right, and I also love persimmons!" what a thing to say, mused the youth. He also heard a slapping sound, and from the corner of his eye, he could see Charles holding his hand to his face, muttering something he didn't quite fully catch, except for the words "airheaded bird brain".

As Muriel hopped back to the crowd of monster maids, the next female stepped forward, sporting a slightly chubby and busty upperbody and immensely fat legs. Her thighs, hips, shins and butt were absolutely massive, a true pear. She smiled as Geoffrey regarded her form, and as she did, the youth saw rows and rows of sharp teeth. Curled behind her was a unique tail, like a scorpion's. Her voice was rather mature and sultry, as she moaned "Marilyn. I'm a manticore." and then batted her eyes at him. Suffice to say, Geoffrey was starting to feel... weird. He had never felt so many lustful looks before, and most certainly not from monsters.

The tenth maid to walk up to Geoffrey was a true butterball, easily one of the fattest maids in the group. She had a belly with a deep fold where her bellybutton was supposed to be, that completely covered her privates, massive mammaries that strained her magically stretched french maid uniform, wide buttcheeks and thunder thighs, and flabby arms. "Call me Tania, Master." she muttered softly, almost in a shy manner. Guess she was a little self-conscious of her girth, he mused, as she didn't even try to give him a pose or anything, she just waddled as fast as she could to the group of maids.

"Ten down, ten to go..." he muttered, as he readied himself for the next wave of introductions...
1221122211.title: "Fine, let's just get this over with."

choices: Your choice goes here, what happens next?
Your choice goes here, what happens next?
12211222111.content:
Geoffrey just looked on as Tania waddled as quickly as her immense body would let her, still trying to process how someone so fat could still walk. A cough from the ghost butler standing next to him brought him back to his senses, and he turned to Charles. "Apologies, young master, Tania is much too shy for her own good. In fact, she even forgot to tell you what kind of monster she is."

"Oh yeah, she just said her name. Well, what is she then?"

"A bahamut, sir."

"...okay then..." Geoffrey was about to inquire Charles over what a bahamut was, but he felt something on his back, like a breeze. He turned, and was face-to-face with a chubby reptilian snout, curled into a friendly smile. His inevitable freakout greatly amused her, and she leaned back, revealing a very long, thick neck.

"Hi there! I'm Becky, a cousin of the Loch Ness monster. Nice to meetcha!" she quipped happily. Taking a good look at her, Geoffrey saw that she was a very heavy-set pear, with thick legs like tree trunks, wide love handles, a bulbous posterior...but a very petite chest. He momentarily wondered if she was self-conscious about it, but decided against asking her.

"Wait, so Nessie isn't a hoax after all?" the youth asked, beffudled. Becky stood silent for a full second, and then sniggered and laughed heartily.

"Of course not! I mean, her name isn't even Nessie, it's Nelma, but close enough!" she laughed and turned away, still jiggling from all the mirth.

On the way, another maid stepped up and as they passed each other, they high-fived and grinned. The newcomer had the most human-like appearance of all, and he understood why: she wore a cape of smooth, blubbery skin over her own stretched and tight uniform, which hugged every inch of her wide-hipped figure, down to the curve of her gut to her moderately-sized bust. But before he could so much as say what she was, the maid smirked and gave a curt nod. "Yeah, you guessed it, I'm a selkie, and my name is Maya." she then gave him a seductive look, and leaned a bit forward, hands on her chest. "I look forward to get to know you a little more..." she said before winking at him and walking away, swaying her hips. Once back in the crowd, she high-fived Becky again, and the two conversed excitedly.

Geoffrey gulped, these girls all wanted a piece of him, they really took his great-uncle's joke to the letter. His attention was then roused as two maids walked forward, both of whom resembled furry animals with their hair tied up in two side buns. The leading girl resembled a fox with white fur, blond hair and golden eyes, with seven tails swishing behind her engorged form, even if she was more top-heavy than her companion. Her companion seemed more homely and humble, as humble as one can get with a massive gut and bloated thighs that constantly rubbed together, and she resembled a raccoon with equally colored hazel hair, fur and eyes. "Hello, young master. I am Setsuna, the kitsune, and this is my best friend and adoptive sister, Megumi, the tanuki. I speak for the both of us, since she is a mute." and to emphasize on the fox woman's declaration, Megumi just closed her eyes and waved her hand in a friendly manner, to which Geoffrey replied in kind. "She was very eager to meet you, moreso than I." Setsuna added, before the both of them gave a polite bow, hands on their thighs, and waddled back into the group.

The next one was among the thinner maids, barely obese, but still quite roly-poly. She had a lime green skin coloration and sported a pair of maroon pigtails. Looming over Geoffrey, surprisingly, she gave him a glare. Why, he did not know. "Rachel. Goblin. Watch your step, human." she growled before stomping off, the other maids giving her some space. Turning to Charles, the ghost just sighed and shrugged.

"She's got some issues to work out, I'm sorry. She won't hurt you, rather, Rachel is very closed off to strangers, and protective of the others." he then gave him a reassuring smile and a pat in the shoulder. "Don't worry about it, I believe you can help open her heart." he said as another maid strutted forward to greet him.

She was similar to Maya, in which she was very human-like, minus the small horns on her head and the thick, smooth tail that peeked from under her short skirt. She had full lips, a round face with a double chin going on triple, really fat arms and body. Like Bella, she had an hourglass-shaped body, but either she was wearing a corset underneath her uniform, or she had a very, very small waist. Striking a provocative pose, she gave a sultry moan. "Call me Suzy, boy. I'm the best succubus in the house." she said, before turning around and walking slowly towards her compatriots, swaying her massive hips and butt. Geoffrey couldn't lie to himself, Suzy really made him feel hot and bothered, due to her nature.

Charles noticed his predicament, and tapping his shoulder, he offered the youth a napkin, which he readily accepted. The distraction was enough, as when he finished wiping off the sweat, a blob of a woman gazed on him, her body made out of pink slime. She had no legs, like Caitlyn, just a monumental amount of slime, although she was considerate enough to also wear the maid uniform. She beamed at him and spoke in a cutesy voice. "I'm Helga, and I love humans!" shifting her mass, she leaned closer to him, all smiles. "Let's get along!" she cheered. For his part, all Geoffrey did was nervously smile back, all the while waging an internal battle over his instinct to flee. As she slithered away humming a tune, he prepared himself for the maid coming forth.

At first she reminded him of Muriel, what with the feathers and talons, but unlike the harpy, this maid had feline talons on both her hands and feet, and a sharp beak to boot. She stood there, her pose confident and proud, and she bent her bloated form to one knee to shake his hand. "Heyo! I'm Sandra, the griffin. Nice to meet you, cool shirt you got on." she complimented, he had been wearing his favorite black shirt on, one that had a grim reaper drawn on. For the first time since he got into this crazy mansion, Geoffrey felt a bit self-conscious, even if the maids hadn't made a single mention about his clothes. Sandra side-stepped, shaking the floor a bit, in order to clear the path.

The last pair, just like the Yin-Yang sisters and the japanese monster girls had, came forth at the same time. They were truly massive, biggest of the group, and hand in hand, they did something that Geoffrey never expected, they started dancing a waltz. As graciously as their incredibly fat forms would permit, they twisted and turned, paying attention to form and flow, all the while swaying and jiggling their fat bodies for all to see. Their routine only ended once they reached the young man, and upon doing so, they gave him bow and composed themselves.

The leading dancer/maid was a Western dragoness, with 4 curly horns protruding from her blond messy hair and grey scales, glistening under the light of the study room. She puffed and grinned, revealing dozens of sharp teeth. "Greetings to you, Geoffrey Bulwark, I am Maddalorastraza, or Maddy for short." what kind of a name was that, he mused. "We have heard a lot about you from the former Master." she added, before letting her companion continue.

Her companion, an Eastern dragoness with a mane of blue hair over her red scales, a long, chubby neck (akin to Becky's, but shorter), long, prehensile whiskers on the corners of her snout and equally winded over their 'performance', huffed a greeting with a warm, motherly voice. "And I am Mei-Lun, her mate. We've longed to meet you for a long time, youngling."

"Nice to meet you two, that was pretty amazing, and... Wait, did you just say 'mate'? You're a couple?" Geoffrey asked before he caught himself. Luckily, the two draconic maids merely giggled at his confusion, and nodded in agreement. Before anything else could be said, Elisabeth, the witch, spoke up.

"One lesson you must learn, laddy, is that love is blind. Regardless of shape, form, gender or even species, love is love, and it is unstoppable." she winked as Charles stood next to her and placed a hand on her shoulder, which she knowingly took. Geoffrey had no ill-will over this matter, and simply nodded, a small smile creeping on the corners of his mouth. He then turned to the table and the contract and will on it, and sat himself on the chair, ready to sign. Both Charles and Elisabeth spent the better part of five minutes to explain the terms of the contract and the contents of the will left for him, and once it was all done and signed, the ghost sighed in relief.

"It is done." he neatly joined the documents together, and gave them to the cook, who made them vanish in a puff of magic fire. "Now that all that is settled, and the introductions are done, I do believe it's time for some well-earned rest. So if you follow me, Master Geoffrey, I will lead you to your bed chambers." he gave a curt bow and held out his hand to the doors. Geoffrey made to get up, but the looming shapes of the fat monster maids made him reconsider.

"Wait, can we uh...I dunno, do something about them? I'm not entirely confortable with the girls being that tall." he explained. There was a collective sigh from the maids, and with one firm glare from Charles, they shrunk, slowly, to their original heights.

But not into their thin human forms.
The maids were still in their fat monster forms, and before Geoffrey could object, Bella the werewolf spoke up. "You said you weren't comfortable with us being tall, so now what?"

Sighing, Geoffrey just followed the ghost butler who was chuckling over the girls' audacity. This was going to be the beginning of a very, very, wacky relationship. "...or rather, relationships." the young man muttered, exhausted.
12211222111.title: (Continuing this tomorrow, 10 more ladies to co...

12212.content:
Dawn of the Anthros

The story here is of a meteor shower raining down on the Earth and releasing strange radiation and viruses across the planet...that, strangely, only effect women. The victims quickly gain weight...followed by a permanent transformation into an anthropomorphic animal and growing to gigantic size, sometimes hundreds of feet tall. These giant, chubby animal-women can still have children with human men, though said children can be either "pure" humans of either gender, or "pure" anthro girls. Their children's species is largely a wild card.

The mutations have been spreading uncontrollably for years, and soon gigantic plus-sized antho women will be the ones running the show.


Our protagonist is one of these women, though she has yet to transform. But that will soon change...
12212.title: Dawn of the Anthro Amazons!

122121.content:
Milly sat in her living room, looking down at her rotund belly. Though she was wearing a loose T-shirt and sweat pants--her usual attire for a morning jog--the fabric of both stretched against her girth, doing nothing to hide it. Her shirt had even drawn back, exposing her black middriff. As for her sweatpants, they were already showing signs of wear trying to contain Milly's overly-ample rear.

Milly hadn't looked like this yesterday. She'd been a healthy 187 pounds, kept that way with a nice exercise routine, even if she splurged on the occasional ice cream or fast food. But now...

Now the only way I'll get ice cream will probably be eating the whole damn factory, Milly thought. Sudden weight gain like this was the first sign of the Anthro Plague--soon, she wouldn't only be fat, she'd be an animal giantess--maybe even as big as a skyscraper; that had happened before--AND fat. Milly had been infected early on, like so many other women, but she'd remained human. She'd even thought she was somehow immune to the transformations.
Until now.

Sighing, Milly pushed herself out of her chair, wobbling on her feet. "No point in going nuts over it...this will be the new me soon, but damn of I'm going to let it throw my life out of whack!" Encouraged, Milly slipped on her track shoes and went outside, into the morning glare.

One of her neighbors, an anthro vixen, pranced down the street carrying a tiny newspaper in her paw. There was no room on the sidewalk, since she was easily 30 feet tall and VERY pear-shaped. Seeing Milly's "new look", she waved and winked--learning someone was just about to transform was a big event for anthro women, and Milly knew she'd be "welcomed to the club" very soon.

She didn't know if she could put up with the gossip, though. Hearing rumors about the T-Rex women who'd moved in last week eating her ex-husband was bad enough already. Mumbling, Milly started her usual jog.
122121.title: Anthro Amazons Story 1

1221211.content:
It was an overcast day, and the dwindling summer made it the perfect temperature for a jog. Strangely enough, although at least 300 pounds, Milly didn't find herself being exhausted by her weight. She wasn't able to run, but was still able to maintain a brisk pace that didn't exhaust her, not changing speed as her engorged frame jiggled with each step.

However, she came to a halt as she was reminded by her stomach that she'd neglected her breakfast.

"Aw, come on! You're already big enough as it is!" She groaned as she looked down at her stomach, only half covered by her shirt. She tried to ignore her hunger, but also noticed a giant stand in a park nearby, lead by what she assumed was a giantess.

"Then again, you're not gonna get any smaller, either..."

She jogged into the park and entered the square wherein the huge doughnut stand was, owned by a wider and monstrously fat orca woman. Her gigantic breasts almost covered the counter, and Milly could tell the stand's size was to contain a massive stomach within. As Milly approached, the orca looked down at her with a friendly smile.

"Morning, Miss. Whaddya need?"

"I could go for a white frosted long john with sprinkles." But she paused as her stomach growled again. "Actually, make it two."

"You got it!" She replied with a chuckle. "Just started transforming, huh?"

"Yep. Just woke up this morning, and voila."

12212112212211.content:
One brief wait in line later, Milly and George sat down for lunch. Milly had had to pull up two chairs to accommodate her building-sized behind, but otherwise she was comfortable. Thankfully the food court was overstocked with chairs, since most of the other women's new forms required such arrangements as well. Not just because of weight or girth, either--many giantesses whose forms sported long tails set the appendages up in chairs to avoid tripping someone.

George was just happy he didn't see any more poor men being used as seat cushions. More concerning was what Millie had ordered. “Sushi, really?” He questioned with a raised eyebrow, still perched on Millie’s shoulder. Leaning against the side of her neck, he eagerly ate a California roll, chewing slowly to savor the taste. Surprisingly, the sushi place in the mall had food as good as any of the more expensive places in town, maybe even better. “I never figured you’d try it--I thought you hated seafood.”

“Me too!” Millie giggle-squawked, somewhat awkwardly handling the chopsticks with her flipper-hands. But as soon as I saw the sushi place...well, I know you love the stuff, but I just had this...craving, out of nowhere. You think it’s some weird side-effect of turning into a penguin?” She managed to get a good grip on one of the spicy rolls she’d ordered (scaled up to her size, of course), added a dab of wasabi and popped it into her beak.

Her eyes widened when the full wave of spice hit her, and a few muffled squeaks escaped her maw before she swallowed. George couldn’t help but laugh as he watched his titanic penguin girlfriend frantically grab a bottle of water and all but chug it down to quench the burn on her tongue.

Taking a sip from his own drink, George patted Millie’s cheek as she calmed down. “I tried to warn you that wasabi was strong stuff, my Arctic Angel. It’s not like some hot sauce you can just slather food with.”

Millie coughed and gasped a bit before craning her head around, fixing her tiny boyfriend with an annoyed look. “‘Arctic Angel’? Seriously? And the guy at the counter recommended the spicy rolls! I didn’t think I’d get a one-two punch to the tastebuds...gah! It’s like I ate a slice of a volcano…!” She gulped down more water.

George chuckled in sympathy, patting Millie’s beak. “It’ll pass, Millie. Hope this doesn’t turn you off seafood for good, you ARE a penguin now, after all.”

Millie tried to hold her glare, but George’s comforting patting was too much...that, and he was just so cute at that size. “Hmm...I don’t think so, Georgie. Maybe it’s just the transformation talking, but I think I still like fish. And...maybe don’t call me ‘Arctic Angel’ again; it’s cheesy. I’m pretty sure penguins live in the South Pole, anyway. Arctic means the North Pole.” She went for another roll, this time pointedly ignoring the wasabi.

“Or what? You’ll sit on me again?”

“Don’t tempt me, little man. You were a pretty comfy cushion, Georgie.” Millie winked and, just for emphasis, wiggled her ample rump on the chair. George winced and mimed zipping his lips...though he still joined her in chuckling. Millie loved how he kept his good humor even after her transformation.

They both went back to their lunches in companionable silence, but George’s mind kept wandering to one thing.
If Millie can do...that...WITHOUT squishing me like that zebra girl did to that poor guy….maybe we could try it again some time? Be an...interesting way to spend a Friday night. Maybe. Possibly. If she doesn’t think it’s weird...

Unbeknownst to George, Millie was thinking along similar lines.

"Would you look at that?" Kim sneered in disgust as she gazed up at the sky. Rather than be filled with a plane of solid blue peppered with white clouds, the outside world was shielded away from the suburb by a large dome of made of hexagon-shaped windows. The air felt sterile in the sealed village, which certainly didn't help to curb Kim's anger. "This is obnoxious! How're we supposed to live like this?!"

"Okay, Kim, would you just shut up for once?!" Pepper snapped, Kim's constant whining finally hitting the switch for her. "You know you're not alone in this place, right? Constantly complaining about this isn't going to make things better for anybody!"

Kim glared at Pepper, but didn't say anything as she left the porch in a huff and ran back to her home across the street. Pepper looked back at the dome and sighed, weighed down by everything that'd been going on for the last few months.

Ever since the anthro virus had started the world had been in an uproar. The very coarse of human nature was being thrown off the line as woman shed their own species and grew to nigh-unstoppable sizes. Her hometown was part of a rare few that were yet to be affected, and as such every precaution was taken to assure that it stayed that way for as long as possible. Pepper was initially happy to go unchanged for a while, but being cooped up in the same circle of land for months on end with no outside contact started to wear on her. Many of her friends lived out of town, a factor that made the dome so much less lively to her.

"Pepper? You doing alright?" She heard Keith ask as he walked onto the porch from the front door and stood at her side.

"Yeah, I'm...fine, I guess." She sighed. "You know...It's amazing how fast things can change in such a huge way."

"Don't worry, honey. Trust me, a lot of people are on the same boat as you."

"...I think I'm gonna go read." Pretty much the only thing she did around here, anyway.

"Alright. I'm gonna go to the store, so see you later!"

Inside the den, Pepper switched the TV on as she walked past and sat in her armchair, grunting as she felt her belt dig into her waist. To her surprise, onscreen was an anthro; a brown bird dressed in a blue reporter suit standing outside what looked like a building scaled to her size. She was so fat that the camera had to stand a decent distance away to keep her width on screen, the bottom cutting off halfway down her enormous bust.

"I'm standing here at Ethra towers, one of the largest resorts ever created on earth!" She announced. "This marks the first in many renovations designed to accomodate anthro womanhood!"

'Wait, what?" Pepper whispered, Adjusting a snug button on her shirt. I thought they were trying to stop the disease, not allow it!

"Women everywhere are in a hype when months ago they were fearing the outbreak of the anthro virus, but nowadays have reached a common concensus of approval, me included!" She motioned the camera to a raccoon standing next to her, a head taller and far fatter. The camera actually struggled to keep both of them in frame. "Miss, have you anything to say on this turn of events?"

"It's amazing!" The raccoon cheered. The voice tugged a few voices in Laura's mind, remembering it all to well.

Holy crap...it's LAURA!!!"

"I feel better than ever before! I feel a lot stronger, more refreshed, and it's absolutely fantastic!"

"How do you feel now compared to when you first heard of the virus?"

"Well....I was scared at first, but then I found out that when it happens to you, it's not so bad!"

"Any last words before we get off the air, miss?"

"I just wanted to say hi to my friend, Pepper!" She smiled, waving at the camera. "We're wishing you all the best, Pepsi!"

Pepper shut the TV, struggling to process what she'd seen. Last time she'd heard the nation was in utter panic, but now they were treating this whole thing like it was spring break!

"What the hell is going on?!" She groaned. She leaned forward and held her face with her hands, but winced as she felt her jeans' button dig even deeper into her stomach. "...huh?"
